original: @158b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @158b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: buddha p'a li ta m'u la ma dhya ma ka pritti /
analyzed: buddha p'a li ta m'u la ma dhya ma ka pritti /
translated: Buddhapālita-mūlamadhyamaka-pradipa

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa buddha p'a li ta /
analyzed: dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa buddha p'a li ta /
translated: The Buddhapālita Commentary on the Root Verses of the Middle Way

original: bam po dang po /
analyzed: bam po dang po /
translated: Part One

original: dkon mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Three Jewels.

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to youthful Mañjuśrī.

original: slob dpon 'phags pa klu sgrub la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: slob dpon 'phags pa klu sgrub la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the noble master Nāgārjuna.

original: slob dpon btsun pa bud dha p'a li ta la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: slob dpon btsun pa bud dha p'a li ta la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the venerable master Buddhapālita.

original: 'di ltar slob dpon rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rjes su ston par bzhed pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar slob dpon rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rjes su ston par bzhed pas /
translated: In this way, the master, wishing to teach dependent origination,

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i zab mo nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du gzigs pas ngo mtshar du gyur pa'i thugs dang ldan pa /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i zab mo nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du gzigs pas ngo mtshar du gyur pa'i thugs dang ldan pa /
translated: with a mind filled with wonder at seeing the profound dependent origination just as it is,

original: dad pa las byung ba'i mchi ma dkrug ces mdzad pa'i spyan mnga' ba /
analyzed: dad pa las byung ba'i mchi ma dkrug ces mdzad pa'i spyan mnga' ba /
translated: with eyes that shed tears of faith,

original: sku'i spu zing zhes mdzad pa dang ldan pas thal mo sbyar ba dbur bzhag ste /
analyzed: sku'i spu zing zhes mdzad pa dang ldan pas thal mo sbyar ba dbur bzhag ste /
translated: with body hair standing on end, placed his palms together at his head and said:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni chos kyi sku'o zhes don dam pa ston pa'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di brjod pas mdun du 'dug pa dang 'dra bar bzhag nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni chos kyi sku'o zhes don dam pa ston pa'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di brjod pas mdun du 'dug pa dang 'dra bar bzhag nas /
translated: By reciting this verse that teaches the ultimate, he is as if seated in the presence of the Buddha.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bla ma dam pa la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bla ma dam pa la /
translated: To the sublime Tathagata,

original: gang gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung //🔽'gag pa med pa skye med pa //
analyzed: gang gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung // 'gag pa med pa skye med pa //
translated: Who taught dependent origination,🔽Free from cessation and origination,

original: chad pa med pa rtag med pa //
analyzed: chad pa med pa rtag med pa //
translated: Free from annihilation and permanence,

original: 'ong ba med pa 'gro med pa //
analyzed: 'ong ba med pa 'gro med pa //
translated: Free from coming and going,

original: tha dad don min don gcig min //
analyzed: tha dad don min don gcig min //
translated: Not a single meaning and not a plurality of meanings,

original: spros pa nyer zhi zhi bstan pa //
analyzed: spros pa nyer zhi zhi bstan pa //
translated: The pacification of conceptual elaborations, the peace,

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas smra rnams kyi //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas smra rnams kyi //
translated: To the perfect Buddha, the best of all teachers,

original: dam pa de la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dam pa de la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage.

original: zhes rgyu snga na yod pa'i phyag bzhes pa mdzad de /
analyzed: zhes rgyu snga na yod pa'i phyag bzhes pa mdzad de /
translated: Thus he pays homage to the Buddha, the teacher of the past.

original: gang gis dbang phyug dang dus dang rdul phran dang rang bzhin dang ngo bo nyid la sogs par smra ba spros pa thibs por 'khyams pa'i 'jig rten la /
analyzed: gang gis dbang phyug dang dus dang rdul phran dang rang bzhin dang ngo bo nyid la sogs par smra ba spros pa thibs por 'khyams pa'i 'jig rten la /
translated: To the world that wanders in the thickets of conceptual elaborations,

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya ba don dam pa'i bden pa mchog tu zab pa /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya ba don dam pa'i bden pa mchog tu zab pa /
translated: The so-called dependent origination is the supreme ultimate truth, which is extremely profound.

original: 'gag pa med pa skye ba med pa /
analyzed: 'gag pa med pa skye ba med pa /
translated: It is without cessation, without origination,

original: chad pa med pa rtag pa med pa /
analyzed: chad pa med pa rtag pa med pa /
translated: without annihilation, without permanence,

original: 'ong ba med pa 'gro ba med pa don tha dad ma yin pa /
analyzed: 'ong ba med pa 'gro ba med pa don tha dad ma yin pa /
translated: without coming, without going, without a different meaning,

original: don gcig ma yin pa /
analyzed: don gcig ma yin pa /
translated: without a single meaning,

original: spros pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du 'gro ba /
analyzed: spros pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du 'gro ba /
translated: and it is the pacification of all mental fabrications. It is the path that leads to the city of nirvana.

original: zhi ba lam drang po 'di bstan pa /
analyzed: zhi ba lam drang po 'di bstan pa /
translated: This is the path of peace that has been taught.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas smra ba rnams kyi dam pa de la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas smra ba rnams kyi dam pa de la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage to the perfect, complete Buddha, the best of all teachers.

original: zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This is what it says.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis phyi rol pa phas kyi rgol ba thams cad byis ba bla ba 'dra bar thugs su chud nas 'gro ba long ba lag nom byed pa lta bu @159a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis phyi rol pa phas kyi rgol ba thams cad byis ba bla ba 'dra bar thugs su chud nas 'gro ba long ba lag nom byed pa lta bu @159a * //
translated: The Blessed One understood that all non-Buddhist opponents are like foolish children, and that wandering beings are like those who eat with their hands.

original: la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bstan par slob dpon gyis yang dag par gzigs pas smra ba rnams kyi dam pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bstan par slob dpon gyis yang dag par gzigs pas smra ba rnams kyi dam pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Master is called the best of teachers because he has seen dependent origination.

original: 'gag pa med pa zhes bya ba ni 'di la 'gag pa yod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'gag pa med pa zhes bya ba ni 'di la 'gag pa yod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Non-cessation means that it does not cease.

original: tshig lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshig lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to the remaining words.

original: tshigs su bcad pa de ni mdo lta bu ste /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa de ni mdo lta bu ste /
translated: This verse is like a sūtra.

original: bstan bcos lhag mas de rnam par bshad pa byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos lhag mas de rnam par bshad pa byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: The remaining treatise will explain it.

original: de yang brjod pa la mngon par zhen pa'i dbang gis sgo de dang des byed par 'gyur gyi go rims ji lta ba bzhin du ni mi byed do //
analyzed: de yang brjod pa la mngon par zhen pa'i dbang gis sgo de dang des byed par 'gyur gyi go rims ji lta ba bzhin du ni mi byed do //
translated: Moreover, it is done by that door due to the power of attachment to expression, but not in the proper order.

original: ci ste rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rjes su bstan pa la dgos pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: ci ste rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rjes su bstan pa la dgos pa ci yod ce na /
translated: If one asks what is the purpose of teaching dependent origination,

original: bshad pa / slob dpon thugs rje'i bdag nyid can gyis sems can rnams sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyis nyen par gzigs nas de dag rnam par grol bar bya ba'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid rab tu bstan par bzhed pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung
analyzed: bshad pa / slob dpon thugs rje'i bdag nyid can gyis sems can rnams sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyis nyen par gzigs nas de dag rnam par grol bar bya ba'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid rab tu bstan par bzhed pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung
translated: Nāgārjuna responds:🔽The master, whose nature is compassion, sees that sentient beings are afflicted by various sufferings. In order to liberate them, he wishes to teach the suchness of things.🔽

original: ba rjes su bstan pa brtsams te //🔽yang dag ma yin mthong ba 'ching //🔽yang dag mthong ba rnam par grol //
analyzed: ba rjes su bstan pa brtsams te // yang dag ma yin mthong ba 'ching // yang dag mthong ba rnam par grol //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: The master, whose nature is compassion, sees that sentient beings are afflicted by various sufferings. In order to liberate them, he wishes to teach the suchness of things just as it is, and so he composes this treatise on dependent origination.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said:🔽Seeing what is not real, one is bound.🔽Seeing what is real, one is liberated.

original: dngos po rnams kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin nyid gang yin /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin nyid gang yin /
translated: What is the suchness of things?

original: bshad pa / ngo bo nyid med pa nyid de /
analyzed: bshad pa / ngo bo nyid med pa nyid de /
translated: It is the absence of intrinsic reality.

original: mi mkhas pa gti mug gi mun pas blo gros kyi mig bsgribs pa ni dngos po rnams la ngo bo nyid du rnam par rtog na de dag la 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag skyed par byed do //
analyzed: mi mkhas pa gti mug gi mun pas blo gros kyi mig bsgribs pa ni dngos po rnams la ngo bo nyid du rnam par rtog na de dag la 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag skyed par byed do //
translated: The unwise, whose eyes of intelligence are covered by the darkness of delusion, conceive of things as having intrinsic reality and generate attachment and aversion toward them.

original: gang gi tshe rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba shes pa'i snang bas gti mug gi mun pa bsal cing /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba shes pa'i snang bas gti mug gi mun pa bsal cing /
translated: When the light of the knowledge of dependent origination dispels the darkness of delusion,

original: shes rab kyi mig gis dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid mthong ba de'i tshe na gnas med pa la de'i 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag mi skye'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi mig gis dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid mthong ba de'i tshe na gnas med pa la de'i 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag mi skye'o //
translated: and the eye of wisdom sees the lack of an intrinsic nature of things, then attachment and aversion do not arise in regard to that which is baseless.

original: 'di lta ste dper na la la zhig gzugs brnyan gyi bud med la bud med do snyam pa'i blo gros skyes nas kun tu 'dod chags skyed de de dang 'brel ba'i yid kyis de la rnam par rtog par byed do //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na la la zhig gzugs brnyan gyi bud med la bud med do snyam pa'i blo gros skyes nas kun tu 'dod chags skyed de de dang 'brel ba'i yid kyis de la rnam par rtog par byed do //
translated: For example, suppose someone thinks of a reflected image of a woman as a real woman and generates desire. With a mind attached to that, he conceptualizes her.

original: gang gi tshe yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa de'i tshe na bud med kyi blo gros med par gyur cing 'dod chags dang bral nas shin tu ngo tsha ba skyes te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa de'i tshe na bud med kyi blo gros med par gyur cing 'dod chags dang bral nas shin tu ngo tsha ba skyes te /
translated: When he realizes the truth of how she is, then the thought of her as a woman is gone, he becomes free of desire, and he feels great shame.

original: rang bzhin gyi sems gnas med pa la 'dod chags skye ba la 'phya ba de dang 'dra ste de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang dge slong dag bud med la nang gi bud med kyi dbang po yang dag par @159b rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi sems gnas med pa la 'dod chags skye ba la 'phya ba de dang 'dra ste de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang dge slong dag bud med la nang gi bud med kyi dbang po yang dag par @159b rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: The Lord also said, “Monks, you do not see the internal female organ of a woman as a real female organ.

original: dge slong dag gal te bud med yin na nang gi bud med kyi dbang po yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: dge slong dag gal te bud med yin na nang gi bud med kyi dbang po yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: Monks, if it were a woman, you would not see the internal female organ as a real female organ.”

original: zhes rgya cher bka' stsal to //
analyzed: zhes rgya cher bka' stsal to //
translated: He said this and much more.

original: de'i phyir slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
analyzed: de'i phyir slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
translated: Therefore, the master Āryadeva also said:

original: srid pa'i sa bon rnam shes te //
analyzed: srid pa'i sa bon rnam shes te //
translated: Consciousness is the seed of existence.

original: yul rnams de yi spyod yul lo //
analyzed: yul rnams de yi spyod yul lo //
translated: Objects are its sphere of activity.

original: yul la bdag med mthong na ni //
analyzed: yul la bdag med mthong na ni //
translated: When one sees the selflessness of objects,

original: srid pa'i sa bon 'gag par 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: srid pa'i sa bon 'gag par 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: The seed of existence ceases.

original: de lta bas na slob dpon gyis dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid rab tu bstan pa'i phyir 'di brtsam mo //
analyzed: de lta bas na slob dpon gyis dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid rab tu bstan pa'i phyir 'di brtsam mo //
translated: Therefore, the master composed this treatise in order to demonstrate the essencelessness of things.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say this:

original: gang gi tshe de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa thams cad gzigs pa thugs rje chen po mnga' ba nyid kyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de dang der de lta de ltar bshad cing rab tu bstan zin na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa thams cad gzigs pa thugs rje chen po mnga' ba nyid kyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de dang der de lta de ltar bshad cing rab tu bstan zin na /
translated: When the Tathāgata, who is omniscient, who sees all, and who possesses great compassion, himself explained and taught dependent origination in this way and that way,

original: yang de rjes su rab tu bstan pa la dgos pa ci yod /
analyzed: yang de rjes su rab tu bstan pa la dgos pa ci yod /
translated: what is the purpose of teaching it again?

original: bshad pa / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bshad cing rab tu bstan pa bden mod kyi /
analyzed: bshad pa / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bshad cing rab tu bstan pa bden mod kyi /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: It is true that the Tathāgata himself explained and taught dependent origination.

original: 'on kyang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang gis skye ba la sogs pa'i brjod pa dag gis bshad cing rab tu bstan pas /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang gis skye ba la sogs pa'i brjod pa dag gis bshad cing rab tu bstan pas /
translated: However, he explained and taught it using expressions such as “arises” in terms of mundane conventions.

original: de la da ltar nyid kyang brjod pa tsam la mngon par zhen pa'i blo can kha cig rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mchog tu zab pa ma rtogs pa na /
analyzed: de la da ltar nyid kyang brjod pa tsam la mngon par zhen pa'i blo can kha cig rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mchog tu zab pa ma rtogs pa na /
translated: Therefore, some who are presently endowed with minds that are attached to mere expressions do not understand the profound dependent origination.

original: dngos po rnams ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: They say, “Things definitely exist.

original: gang gi phyir de dag gi skye ba dang 'gag pa dang 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dag brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag gi skye ba dang 'gag pa dang 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dag brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because their arising, ceasing, going, and coming are described.

original: gang zhig yod pa las rtag pa dang chad pa dang de nyid dang gzhan nyid du sems pa dag byed kyi /
analyzed: gang zhig yod pa las rtag pa dang chad pa dang de nyid dang gzhan nyid du sems pa dag byed kyi /
translated: Those who think that permanence and annihilation, sameness and difference exist,🔽think that these do not occur in regard to nonexistents such as the horns of an ass.

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa med pa dag la de dag mi 'byung ngo snyam du sems pa de dag la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid rab tu bstan pa'i phyir slob dpon gyis rigs pa dang lung sngon du btang ba 'di brtsams so
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa med pa dag la de dag mi 'byung ngo snyam du sems pa de dag la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid rab tu bstan pa'i phyir slob dpon gyis rigs pa dang lung sngon du btang ba 'di brtsams so
translated: In order to teach them the reality of dependent origination, the master composed this treatise, which is based on reasoning and scripture.

original: // gzhan yang gang kho na'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bshad cing rab tu bstan pa de kho na'i phyir slob dpon gyis rjes su rab tu bstan par 'thad kyi /
analyzed: // gzhan yang gang kho na'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bshad cing rab tu bstan pa de kho na'i phyir slob dpon gyis rjes su rab tu bstan par 'thad kyi /
translated: Moreover, it is precisely because the Tathāgata explained and taught dependent origination that it is appropriate for the master to teach it in turn.

original: ma bshad cing rab tu ma bstan par rjes su rab tu ston par 'os pa de gang zhig yin /
analyzed: ma bshad cing rab tu ma bstan par rjes su rab tu ston par 'os pa de gang zhig yin /
translated: What is it that is suitable to be taught in turn without being explained and taught?

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten pa'i bstan bcos dag kyang sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyis bshad cing rab tu bstan pas da ltar nyid kyang de rnams kyi slob ma dag rjes su smra bar byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten pa'i bstan bcos dag kyang sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyis bshad cing rab tu bstan pas da ltar nyid kyang de rnams kyi slob ma dag rjes su smra bar byed do //
translated: In this way, even the treatises of the world are explained and taught by former masters. Even now, their students continue to expound them.

original: de'i phyir slob dpon gyis @160a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir slob dpon gyis @160a * //
translated: Therefore, it is fitting for the master

original: rjes su rab tu bstan par rigs so //
analyzed: rjes su rab tu bstan par rigs so //
translated: to teach them in this way.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say:

original: ci'i phyir 'gag pa la sogs pa brgyad po de dag 'gog par byed /🔽'gag pa med pa skye med pa //
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'gag pa la sogs pa brgyad po de dag 'gog par byed / 'gag pa med pa skye med pa //
translated: Why do you refute those eight, such as cessation?🔽It is not necessary to do more than just say,🔽“There is no cessation, no arising,

original: chad pa med pa rtag med pa //
analyzed: chad pa med pa rtag med pa //
translated: no annihilation, no permanence,

original: zhes bya ba de tsam zhig byas pas mi chog gam /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de tsam zhig byas pas mi chog gam /
translated: and so on.”

original: bshad pa / dngos po'i ngo bo nyid smra ba dag phal cher tha snyad kyi dbang gis bstan pa 'gag pa la sogs pa brjod pa brgyad po de dag gis dngos po yod pa nyid du ston par byed pas de'i phyir 'gag pa la sogs pa brgyad po de dag nyid
analyzed: bshad pa / dngos po'i ngo bo nyid smra ba dag phal cher tha snyad kyi dbang gis bstan pa 'gag pa la sogs pa brjod pa brgyad po de dag gis dngos po yod pa nyid du ston par byed pas de'i phyir 'gag pa la sogs pa brgyad po de dag nyid
translated: In response to this, we say: Most proponents of the intrinsic reality of things teach the existence of things by means of the eight expressions such as cessation that are taught by the power of convention. Therefore, those eight, such as cessation,

original: dgag pa mdzad do //
analyzed: dgag pa mdzad do //
translated: are refuted.

original: de bzhin du de kho na sems par byed pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du de kho na sems par byed pa'am /
translated: Likewise, it is the one who thinks of reality.🔽

original: 'gyed pa rtsom par byed pa gang dag ci yang rung ba de dag kyang 'gag pa la sogs pa'i don de dag la brten nas sems pa dang rtsom par byed de /
analyzed: 'gyed pa rtsom par byed pa gang dag ci yang rung ba de dag kyang 'gag pa la sogs pa'i don de dag la brten nas sems pa dang rtsom par byed de /
translated: In the same way, those who reflect on reality or who engage in debate reflect and engage in debate on the basis of the meaning of cessation, etc.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: re zhig kha cig na re dngos po thams cad ni skye ba dang 'gag pa'i chos can skad cig ma ste rgyun gyis rgyun du 'byung ngo //🔽zhes zer ro //
analyzed: re zhig kha cig na re dngos po thams cad ni skye ba dang 'gag pa'i chos can skad cig ma ste rgyun gyis rgyun du 'byung ngo // zhes zer ro //
translated: some say that all things are momentary, having the nature of arising and ceasing, and that they occur in a continuum.

original: gzhan dag na re sa la sogs pa rdzas dgu po dag rtag ces zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re sa la sogs pa rdzas dgu po dag rtag ces zer ro //
translated: Others say that the nine substances, earth, etc., are permanent.

original: yang gzhan dag ni chos dang chos ma yin pa dang / gang zag nam mkha' dang / dus dang gang zag dang srog ces bya ba rdzas drug po dag rtag ces brjod do //
analyzed: yang gzhan dag ni chos dang chos ma yin pa dang / gang zag nam mkha' dang / dus dang gang zag dang srog ces bya ba rdzas drug po dag rtag ces brjod do //
translated: Others say that six substances are permanent: virtue, nonvirtue, space, time, the self and life.

original: de bzhin du phal cher srog dang lus gnyis /
analyzed: de bzhin du phal cher srog dang lus gnyis /
translated: In the same way, most say that life and the body are two,

original: me dang bud shing gnyis /
analyzed: me dang bud shing gnyis /
translated: fire and fuel are two,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis /
translated: cause and effect are two,

original: yon tan dang yon can gnyis /
analyzed: yon tan dang yon can gnyis /
translated: and the possessor of the qualities and the qualities are two.

original: yan lag dang yan lag can gnyis ni de nyid dang gzhan nyid ces bya ba 'gyed par byed do //
analyzed: yan lag dang yan lag can gnyis ni de nyid dang gzhan nyid ces bya ba 'gyed par byed do //
translated: The two, part and whole, are disputed as to whether they are identical or different.

original: de bzhin du kha cig na re yon tan bya ba dang ldan pa rnams dang rtag 'khor lo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du kha cig na re yon tan bya ba dang ldan pa rnams dang rtag 'khor lo zhes zer ro //
translated: Similarly, some say that the qualities are endowed with activity, and that they are always in motion.

original: gzhan dag na re rdul phran dang yid gnyis ni mi 'gro'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rdul phran dang yid gnyis ni mi 'gro'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that the two, the atom and the mind, do not move.

original: gzhan dag ni srog dang gang zag gnyis 'gro ba dang ldan zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni srog dang gang zag gnyis 'gro ba dang ldan zhes brjod do //
translated: Others say that the two, life and the person, are endowed with going.

original: grub nas gang du 'gro bar yang 'dod do //
analyzed: grub nas gang du 'gro bar yang 'dod do //
translated: And they assert that, having been established, they go somewhere.

original: de'i phyir de kho na sems pa dang 'gyed pa rtsom pa'i dbang gis 'gag pa la sogs pa brgyad po dgag par mdzad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de kho na sems pa dang 'gyed pa rtsom pa'i dbang gis 'gag pa la sogs pa brgyad po dgag par mdzad do //
translated: Therefore, he refutes the eight, cessation, etc., by the power of initiating the dispute of just that.

original: 'dir smras pa /🔽'o na ci'i phyir 'gag pa sngar bkag pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / 'o na ci'i phyir 'gag pa sngar bkag pa /
translated: Here, someone says:🔽But why is cessation refuted first, and arising refuted later?

original: skye ba phyis bkag / skye ba med pa sngar brjod par bya ba'i rigs snyam na //
analyzed: skye ba phyis bkag / skye ba med pa sngar brjod par bya ba'i rigs snyam na //
translated: It is reasonable that non-arising should be stated first.🔽In response, it is said:

original: bshad pa / de ni klan kar mi rung ste //
analyzed: bshad pa / de ni klan kar mi rung ste //
translated: That is not a proper objection.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yi ge la mkhas pa rnams ni bsdu ba la sbyor ba ltag 'og nges pa yod kyi /
analyzed: yi ge la mkhas pa rnams ni bsdu ba la sbyor ba ltag 'og nges pa yod kyi /
translated: Those who are skilled in letters know that the order of the words in the compound is fixed,

original: gzhan la ni nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la ni nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but for others there is no fixed order.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: de lta na yang @160b skye ba yod na 'gag par 'gyur gyi med na mi 'gyur ba go rims bzhin du sngar skye ba med pa zhes brjod par bya ba kho nar 'gyur ro //🔽bshad pa / grogs po 'di ltar skye ba snga la 'gag pa 'phyi'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang @160b skye ba yod na 'gag par 'gyur gyi med na mi 'gyur ba go rims bzhin du sngar skye ba med pa zhes brjod par bya ba kho nar 'gyur ro // bshad pa / grogs po 'di ltar skye ba snga la 'gag pa 'phyi'o //
translated: Even if that were so, if arising exists, ceasing would exist, but if it does not exist, it would not exist. Thus it would be correct to say that arising does not exist first.🔽Nāgārjuna responds:🔽Friend, please give an example of how arising occurs first and ceasing occurs later, so that we can believe it.

original: zhes bya bar gang gis kho bo cag yid ches par 'gyur ba'i dpe 'ga' zhig je gyis shig smras pa thams cad kyang dpe yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya bar gang gis kho bo cag yid ches par 'gyur ba'i dpe 'ga' zhig je gyis shig smras pa thams cad kyang dpe yin te /
translated: You say, “Everything is an example.”

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?🔽Arising is meaningless because if arising exists,🔽then the enemies of aging, death,

original: re zhig skye 'di don med gang phyir skye ba yod na rga shi dang // nad dang sdug bsngal bsang dang bcings la sogs pa'i dgra dag yod //🔽ces bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: re zhig skye 'di don med gang phyir skye ba yod na rga shi dang // nad dang sdug bsngal bsang dang bcings la sogs pa'i dgra dag yod //🔽ces bya ba bzhin no //
translated: sickness, suffering, and bondage exist.

original: bshad pa / gang la 'chi ba yod pa'i skye ba gang yin pa de la yang 'chi ba sngon du 'gro ba kho na yin pa snyam /
analyzed: bshad pa / gang la 'chi ba yod pa'i skye ba gang yin pa de la yang 'chi ba sngon du 'gro ba kho na yin pa snyam /
translated: death must precede it.

original: gal te de 'chi ba sngon du 'gro ba ma yin na ni 'khor ba la thog ma yod par thal bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: gal te de 'chi ba sngon du 'gro ba ma yin na ni 'khor ba la thog ma yod par thal bar 'gyur bas /
translated: If it did not precede it, then it would follow that cyclic existence would have a beginning.

original: de yang mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de yang mi 'dod de /
translated: But that is unacceptable.

original: de'i phyir 'khor ba la thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i phyir skye ba snga la 'chi ba 'phyi ba 'am 'chi ba snga la skye ba 'phyi'o zhes bya bar brjod par mi nus so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khor ba la thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i phyir skye ba snga la 'chi ba 'phyi ba 'am 'chi ba snga la skye ba 'phyi'o zhes bya bar brjod par mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, because cyclic existence has no beginning or end, it cannot be said that birth occurs earlier and death later, or that death occurs earlier and birth later.

original: 'og nas kyang //
analyzed: 'og nas kyang //
translated: And later it says:

original: gal te skye ba snga gyur la //
analyzed: gal te skye ba snga gyur la //
translated: If birth occurred earlier

original: rga shi 'phyi ba yin na ni //🔽rga shi med par skye ba dang // ma shi bar yang skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rga shi 'phyi ba yin na ni // rga shi med par skye ba dang // ma shi bar yang skye bar 'gyur //
translated: and aging and death later,🔽then birth would occur without aging and death,

original: zhes 'byung ngo //🔽smras pa 'o na /
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo // smras pa 'o na /
translated: and one would be born without dying.

original: gal te 'jig med skye ba med na don med de mi 'byung //
analyzed: gal te 'jig med skye ba med na don med de mi 'byung //
translated: Objection: But if there is no death, then birth is pointless.

original: shing skyes med na nags med rlung gis sgyel bar mi 'gyur bzhin //
analyzed: shing skyes med na nags med rlung gis sgyel bar mi 'gyur bzhin //
translated: If a tree did not grow, a forest would not exist and would not be destroyed by wind.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni dpe gzhan yin na //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni dpe gzhan yin na //
translated: This is another example.

original: bshad pa / 'di la khyad par ci yod /
analyzed: bshad pa / 'di la khyad par ci yod /
translated: Response: What is the difference here?

original: smras pa / khyad par ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / khyad par ni 'di yin te /
translated: Objection: The difference is this:

original: gang gi phyir 'di la 'gag pa sngon du 'gro ba'i skye ba med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di la 'gag pa sngon du 'gro ba'i skye ba med do //
translated: Because here there is no arising that is preceded by cessation.

original: 'di ltar shing lon pa gzhan du 'gags la 'dir skyes pa med pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: 'di ltar shing lon pa gzhan du 'gags la 'dir skyes pa med pa'i phyir ro//
translated: Because a tree that is cut down does not cease elsewhere and arise here.

original: bshad pa // 'di la yang sa bon 'gag pa sngon du 'gro ba las skye bas de yang 'gag pa sngon du 'gro ba kho na las skye ba yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa // 'di la yang sa bon 'gag pa sngon du 'gro ba las skye bas de yang 'gag pa sngon du 'gro ba kho na las skye ba yin no //
translated: Response: Here also, arising is preceded by the cessation of the seed. Therefore, arising is also preceded by cessation.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, it is said:

original: de ni mi 'dra ste /
analyzed: de ni mi 'dra ste /
translated: That is not similar.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzhan kho na 'gags la gzhan kho na skye ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan kho na 'gags la gzhan kho na skye ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because one thing ceases and another thing arises.

original: 'di ltar 'di la sa bon 'gags la myu gu skye'i myu gu nyid 'gags la myu gu nyid mi skye bas de'i phyir de ni mi 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di la sa bon 'gags la myu gu skye'i myu gu nyid 'gags la myu gu nyid mi skye bas de'i phyir de ni mi 'dra'o //
translated: In this way, a seed ceases and a sprout arises. But a sprout does not cease and a sprout does not arise. Therefore, that is not similar.

original: bshad pa / de ni 'dra ba kho na ste /
analyzed: bshad pa / de ni 'dra ba kho na ste /
translated: Response: That is similar.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar skye ba dang 'chi ba gnyis kyang gang kho na shi ba de nyid skye ba ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar skye ba dang 'chi ba gnyis kyang gang kho na shi ba de nyid skye ba ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Thus, both birth and death are not the same, because the one who dies is not the one who is born.

original: gal te gang kho na 'chi ba de nyid skye bar 'gyur na ni de lta na rtag pa'i skyon du thal bar @161a * //
analyzed: gal te gang kho na 'chi ba de nyid skye bar 'gyur na ni de lta na rtag pa'i skyon du thal bar @161a * //
translated: If the one who dies is the one who is born, then the error of eternalism would ensue.

original: 'gyur te / lha gang yin pa de yang lha kho nar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'gyur te / lha gang yin pa de yang lha kho nar 'gyur la /
translated: For example, the god would be the god alone,

original: dud 'gro gang yin pa de yang dud 'gro kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dud 'gro gang yin pa de yang dud 'gro kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: and the animal would be the animal alone.

original: de lta yin na las dang nyon mongs pas byas pa'i skye ba dang 'gro ba 'khrul pa med par 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de lta yin na las dang nyon mongs pas byas pa'i skye ba dang 'gro ba 'khrul pa med par 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod de /
translated: If that were so, then birth and the confusion of the life-cycle created by karma and afflictions would be without error, but that is unacceptable.

original: de nas gang kho na 'chi ba de nyid skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas gang kho na 'chi ba de nyid skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the one who dies is the one who is born.

original: zhes bya ba de brjod par mi nus pas de'i phyir de'i 'dra ba kho na'o //🔽'di la gzhan kho na 'gag /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de brjod par mi nus pas de'i phyir de'i 'dra ba kho na'o // 'di la gzhan kho na 'gag /
translated: Since that cannot be expressed, therefore it is just like that.

original: gzhan kho na skye'o zhes pa gang yin pa de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: gzhan kho na skye'o zhes pa gang yin pa de yang mi rigs te /
translated: Here, it is not reasonable to say that the one who dies is the one who is born,🔽because the one who dies is one, and the one who is born is another.

original: gal te sa bon dang myu gu gnyis gzhan nyid yin par gyur na de gnyis la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tha snyad kyang med par 'gyur ba zhig na tha snyad yod pas de'i phyir de gnyis gzhan nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te sa bon dang myu gu gnyis gzhan nyid yin par gyur na de gnyis la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tha snyad kyang med par 'gyur ba zhig na tha snyad yod pas de'i phyir de gnyis gzhan nyid ma yin no //
translated: If seeds and sprouts were different, then even the conventions of cause and effect would not exist. But since the conventions do exist, therefore those two are not different.

original: gzhan yang 'di na smra ba po dag sa bon btab nas bdag gis shing ljon pa 'di btsugs /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di na smra ba po dag sa bon btab nas bdag gis shing ljon pa 'di btsugs /
translated: Moreover, here speakers say, “I planted the seed, so I planted the tree.”

original: bdag gis bu 'di bskyed de /
analyzed: bdag gis bu 'di bskyed de /
translated: “I raised this child.”

original: shing ljon pa 'di ni bdag gi'o //
analyzed: shing ljon pa 'di ni bdag gi'o //
translated: “This tree is mine.”

original: bu 'di ni bdag gi'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bu 'di ni bdag gi'o zhes zer ro //
translated: “This child is mine.”

original: de la gal te sa bon dang shing ljon pa dang bu dag gzhan nyid yin par gyur na 'jig rten gyi tha snyad de dag mi srid par 'gyur ba zhig na srid pas de'i phyir sa bon dang myu gu gnyis gzhan nyid du brjod par mi nus te
analyzed: de la gal te sa bon dang shing ljon pa dang bu dag gzhan nyid yin par gyur na 'jig rten gyi tha snyad de dag mi srid par 'gyur ba zhig na srid pas de'i phyir sa bon dang myu gu gnyis gzhan nyid du brjod par mi nus te
translated: In that regard, if seeds, trees, and children were different, then those conventions of the world would be impossible. But since they are possible, therefore it is not possible to say that seeds and sprouts are different.

original: / 'og nas kyang /
analyzed: / 'og nas kyang /
translated: And later:

original: gzhan ni gzhan las brten te gzhan //
analyzed: gzhan ni gzhan las brten te gzhan //
translated: The other is dependent on the other;

original: gzhan med gzhan las gzhan mi 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan med gzhan las gzhan mi 'gyur //
translated: without the other, the other would not occur.

original: gang las brten te gang yin pa //
analyzed: gang las brten te gang yin pa //
translated: How could it be dependent on that?

original: de ni de las gzhan mi 'thad //
analyzed: de ni de las gzhan mi 'thad //
translated: It is not tenable that it is different from that.

original: cis 'byung ngo //
analyzed: cis 'byung ngo //
translated: How could it arise?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: de lta na yang sa bon yod pa nyid yin na 'gag par 'gyur gyis med na mi 'gyur bas 'di yang skye ba snga la 'gag pa 'phyi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang sa bon yod pa nyid yin na 'gag par 'gyur gyis med na mi 'gyur bas 'di yang skye ba snga la 'gag pa 'phyi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, if the seed exists, it would cease, but if it does not exist, it would not. Therefore, arising would be earlier and ceasing would be later.🔽In response Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / 'di ltar sa bon de la yang sa bon 'gag pa sngon du 'gro ba nyid yod de /
analyzed: bshad pa / 'di ltar sa bon de la yang sa bon 'gag pa sngon du 'gro ba nyid yod de /
translated: In that case, the seed would also be preceded by the cessation of the seed.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar myu gu las kyang shing ljon pa gzhan ma yin la shing ljon pa las kyang sa bon gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir sa bon 'gag pa sngon du 'gro ba las myu gu skye la /
analyzed: 'di ltar myu gu las kyang shing ljon pa gzhan ma yin la shing ljon pa las kyang sa bon gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir sa bon 'gag pa sngon du 'gro ba las myu gu skye la /
translated: Because the sprout arises from the seed that is preceded by the cessation of the seed, and the seed arises from the sprout that is not different from the tree.

original: sa bon yang sa bon 'gag pa sngon du 'gro ba las skye ste ;
analyzed: sa bon yang sa bon 'gag pa sngon du 'gro ba las skye ste ;
translated: And the seed arises from the seed that is preceded by the cessation of the seed.

original: de ltar slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang //
analyzed: de ltar slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang //
translated: In this way Master Āryadeva also says:

original: sa bon dpe ni ji lta bar //
analyzed: sa bon dpe ni ji lta bar //
translated: Just as the example of the seed,

original: de la thog ma yod ma yin //
analyzed: de la thog ma yod ma yin //
translated: it has no beginning.

original: de ltar rgyu dang mi ldan las //
analyzed: de ltar rgyu dang mi ldan las //
translated: In that way, from that which lacks a cause,

original: skye ba'ang srid par mi 'gyur ro //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: skye ba'ang srid par mi 'gyur ro // zhes gsungs so //
translated: And it would not be possible for it to arise.

original: de'i phyir skye ba dang 'gag pa gnyis la snga phyi'i rnam par bzhag pa med pas ci'i phyir @161b 'gag pa sngar bkag la skye ba phyis bkag ces bya ba de klan kar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba dang 'gag pa gnyis la snga phyi'i rnam par bzhag pa med pas ci'i phyir @161b 'gag pa sngar bkag la skye ba phyis bkag ces bya ba de klan kar mi rung ngo //
translated: Thus, since arising and ceasing do not have sequential status, why is it improper to object, “Why did you refute ceasing first and then arising?”

original: de gnyis la snga phyi'i rnam par bzhag pa med pa de nyid rab tu bstan pa'i phyir slob dpon gyis 'dir 'gag pa sngar gzung ba mdzad la skye ba phyis brtags so //
analyzed: de gnyis la snga phyi'i rnam par bzhag pa med pa de nyid rab tu bstan pa'i phyir slob dpon gyis 'dir 'gag pa sngar gzung ba mdzad la skye ba phyis brtags so //
translated: In order to clearly demonstrate that these two do not have sequential status, the master Nāgārjuna first took ceasing and then later examined arising.

original: 'dir smras pa /🔽re zhig ji ltar skye bar brjod pa tha snyad tsam yin pa de ltar rab tu ston cig /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / re zhig ji ltar skye bar brjod pa tha snyad tsam yin pa de ltar rab tu ston cig /
translated: Here, someone might say:🔽First demonstrate how it is that arising is merely a conventional expression.

original: bshad pa te por bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: bshad pa te por bstan par bya'o //
translated: The response to that is as follows:

original: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
analyzed: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
translated: Not from itself, not from another,

original: gnyis las ma yin rgyu med min //🔽dngos po gang dag gang na yang //
analyzed: gnyis las ma yin rgyu med min // dngos po gang dag gang na yang //
translated: not from both, not without cause,🔽Things do not arise anywhere

original: skye ba nam yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: skye ba nam yang yod ma yin //
translated: at any time in any way whatsoever.

original: 'di la gal te dngos po 'ga' zhig skye bar gyur na /
analyzed: 'di la gal te dngos po 'ga' zhig skye bar gyur na /
translated: Here, if any thing whatsoever were to arise,

original: dngos po de'i skye ba de bdag las sam /
analyzed: dngos po de'i skye ba de bdag las sam /
translated: Is the arising of that thing from itself?

original: gzhan las sam /🔽bdag dang gzhan gnyis las sam /
analyzed: gzhan las sam / bdag dang gzhan gnyis las sam /
translated: Or from another?🔽Or from both itself and another?

original: rgyu med pa las 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: rgyu med pa las 'gyur grang na /
translated: Or is it causeless?

original: brtags nas rnam pa thams cad las mi 'thad do //
analyzed: brtags nas rnam pa thams cad las mi 'thad do //
translated: When analyzed, it is not tenable in any way.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: bdag las zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽de la re zhig dngos po rnams bdag gi bdag nyid las skye ba med de /
analyzed: bdag las zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de la re zhig dngos po rnams bdag gi bdag nyid las skye ba med de /
translated: “From itself” means from its own self.

original: de dag gi skye ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / skye ba thug pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi skye ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / skye ba thug pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In that regard, things do not arise from their own selves because their arising would be pointless and there would be an infinite regress of arising.

original: 'di ltar dngos po bdag gi bdag nyid du yod pa rnams la yang skye ba dgos pa med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po bdag gi bdag nyid du yod pa rnams la yang skye ba dgos pa med do //
translated: Thus, for things that exist in their own selves, arising is pointless.

original: gal te yod kyang yang skye na nam yang mi skye bar mi 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod de /
analyzed: gal te yod kyang yang skye na nam yang mi skye bar mi 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod de /
translated: If, although they exist, they arose again, they would never not arise. But that is unacceptable.

original: de'i phyir re zhig dngos po rnams bdag las skye ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir re zhig dngos po rnams bdag las skye ba med do //
translated: Therefore, first, things do not arise from themselves.

original: gzhan las kyang skye ba med de /
analyzed: gzhan las kyang skye ba med de /
translated: They do not arise from another.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: thams cad las thams cad skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad las thams cad skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it follows that everything would arise from everything.

original: bdag dang gzhan gnyis las kyang skye ba med de ;
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gnyis las kyang skye ba med de ;
translated: Nor do things arise from both self and other,

original: gnyi ga'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the errors of both positions would follow.

original: rgyu med pa las kyang skye ba med de /
analyzed: rgyu med pa las kyang skye ba med de /
translated: Nor do things arise causelessly,

original: rtag tu thams cad las thams cad skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / rtsom pa thams cad don med pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu thams cad las thams cad skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / rtsom pa thams cad don med pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it follows that everything would always arise from everything, and the error would arise that all endeavor would be pointless.

original: de ltar gang gi phyir dngos po skye ba rnam pa thams cad du mi 'thad pas de'i phyir skye ba med pas skye bar brjod pa ni tha snyad tsam yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gang gi phyir dngos po skye ba rnam pa thams cad du mi 'thad pas de'i phyir skye ba med pas skye bar brjod pa ni tha snyad tsam yin no //
translated: Thus, because the arising of things is untenable in any way, therefore, because there is no arising, the statement “Things arise” is mere convention.

original: smras pa / dngos po rnams bdag las skye ba med de /
analyzed: smras pa / dngos po rnams bdag las skye ba med de /
translated: Objection: Things do not arise from self.

original: 'di ltar myu gu de nyis las ji ltar skye zhes bshad pa gang yin pa dang / bdag las skye ba med na bdag dang gzhan gnyis las skye ba de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar myu gu de nyis las ji ltar skye zhes bshad pa gang yin pa dang / bdag las skye ba med na bdag dang gzhan gnyis las skye ba de yang mi rigs te /
translated: If there is no arising from self, then arising from both self and other is also illogical,🔽because one part of the thesis would be defective.

original: @162a * // phyogs gcig nyams pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / 'di ltar rgyu med pa las skye'o zhes bya ba'i phyogs de ni tha chad yin pas de dag ni re zhig khas mi len to //
analyzed: @162a * // phyogs gcig nyams pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / 'di ltar rgyu med pa las skye'o zhes bya ba'i phyogs de ni tha chad yin pas de dag ni re zhig khas mi len to //
translated: And since the position that things arise without a cause is the most inferior, it is not accepted.

original: dngos po rnams gzhan las skye ba med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: dngos po rnams gzhan las skye ba med pa kho na'o //
translated: Things do not arise from other.

original: zhes bya ba de nges par gzung ste bshad pa gang yin pa de la smra bar bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de nges par gzung ste bshad pa gang yin pa de la smra bar bya ste /
translated: This is the thesis that is asserted and explained.

original: rkyen rnams bzhi ste rgyu dang ni //
analyzed: rkyen rnams bzhi ste rgyu dang ni //
translated: The conditions are four: causal,

original: dmigs pa dang ni de ma thag / bdag po yang ni de bzhin te //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang ni de ma thag / bdag po yang ni de bzhin te //
translated: objective, immediate, and dominant.

original: rkyen lnga pa ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: rkyen lnga pa ni yod ma yin //
translated: There is no fifth condition.

original: lnga pa yod pa ma yin zhes bya bas ni slob dpon kha cig gis rkyen bzhi po 'di las gzhan gang dag tha snyad du brjod pa de dag thams cad kyang rkyen bzhi po 'di dag tu 'dus so //🔽zhes nges par 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: lnga pa yod pa ma yin zhes bya bas ni slob dpon kha cig gis rkyen bzhi po 'di las gzhan gang dag tha snyad du brjod pa de dag thams cad kyang rkyen bzhi po 'di dag tu 'dus so // zhes nges par 'dzin par byed do //
translated: The fifth line, “They do not exist,” indicates that some masters assert that all things that are conventionally expressed are included in these four conditions.

original: de rab tu bstan pa'i phyir rgyu la sogs pa rkyen bzhi po de dag dngos po rnams skyed pa'i rkyen du bstan te /
analyzed: de rab tu bstan pa'i phyir rgyu la sogs pa rkyen bzhi po de dag dngos po rnams skyed pa'i rkyen du bstan te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, the four conditions, such as the causal condition, are taught as the conditions that generate things.

original: rkyen bzhi po de dag las dngos po rnams skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rkyen bzhi po de dag las dngos po rnams skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Things arise from these four conditions.

original: gang gi phyir rkyen bzhi po gzhan du gyur pa de dag las dngos po rnams skye bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir dngos po rnams gzhan las skye ba med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rkyen bzhi po gzhan du gyur pa de dag las dngos po rnams skye bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir dngos po rnams gzhan las skye ba med pa kho na'o //
translated: Since things arise from these four conditions that have transformed, therefore things do not arise from other things.

original: zhes bya ba de bzang po ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de bzang po ma yin no //
translated: This is not good.

original: bshad pa / gal te khyod kyis rgyu la sogs pa rkyen bzhi po gang dag gzhan yin par tha snyad btags pa de dag dngos po rnams las gzhan yin par gyur na ni dngos po rnams gzhan las skye bar yang 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: bshad pa / gal te khyod kyis rgyu la sogs pa rkyen bzhi po gang dag gzhan yin par tha snyad btags pa de dag dngos po rnams las gzhan yin par gyur na ni dngos po rnams gzhan las skye bar yang 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: If the four conditions, such as the cause, That you designate as different Were different from things, Things would arise from what is different.

original: de dag ni gzhan yin par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de dag ni gzhan yin par mi 'thad do //
translated: But it is untenable that they are different.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ni //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ni //
translated: The nature of things

original: rkyen la sogs la yod ma yin //
analyzed: rkyen la sogs la yod ma yin //
translated: Does not exist in the conditions and so on.

original: bdag gi dngos po yod min na //
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po yod min na //
translated: If their own nature does not exist,

original: gzhan gyi dngos po yod ma yin /🔽'di la dngos po yod pa rnams gcig la gcig ltos nas gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba ni dper na tsee tra las gub ta gzhan du 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po yod ma yin / 'di la dngos po yod pa rnams gcig la gcig ltos nas gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba ni dper na tsee tra las gub ta gzhan du 'gyur la /
translated: The nature of others does not exist.

original: gub ta las kyang tsee tra gzhan du 'gyur ba lta bu yin na /
analyzed: gub ta las kyang tsee tra gzhan du 'gyur ba lta bu yin na /
translated: Here, things that exist would be different from each other in mutual dependence, just as, for example, a guñja berry is different from a citron, and a citron is different from a guñja berry.

original: gnas skabs gang na sa bon la sogs rkyen rnams yod pa'i gnas skabs de na myu gu la sogs pa dngos po rnams yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gnas skabs gang na sa bon la sogs rkyen rnams yod pa'i gnas skabs de na myu gu la sogs pa dngos po rnams yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But in whatever situation the conditions such as the seed exist, in that situation things such as the sprout do not exist.

original: de'i phyir rgyu la sogs pa rkyen rnams yod pa na myu gu la sogs pa dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu la sogs pa rkyen rnams yod pa na myu gu la sogs pa dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, when causes and so on, the conditions, exist, the intrinsic reality of things such as sprouts does not exist.

original: de rnams kyi bdag gi dngos po yod pa ma yin na rgyu la sogs pa dag ji ltar gzhan du 'gyur /
analyzed: de rnams kyi bdag gi dngos po yod pa ma yin na rgyu la sogs pa dag ji ltar gzhan du 'gyur /
translated: If their intrinsic reality does not exist, how could causes and so on be different?

original: de lta bas na rgyu la sogs @162b pa rkyen rnams myu gu la sogs pa dngos po rnams las gzhan nyid yin par mi 'thad do //🔽de'i phyir gzhan gyi dngos po med pa kho na'i phyir dngos po rnams gzhan las skye'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na rgyu la sogs @162b pa rkyen rnams myu gu la sogs pa dngos po rnams las gzhan nyid yin par mi 'thad do // de'i phyir gzhan gyi dngos po med pa kho na'i phyir dngos po rnams gzhan las skye'o //
translated: Thus it is not tenable that causes and so on, the conditions, are different from things such as sprouts.

original: zhes bya ba de 'thad pa ma yin no //🔽rkyen la sogs la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de 'thad pa ma yin no // rkyen la sogs la /
translated: Therefore, because they do not exist as different, it is not tenable to say, “Things arise from other.”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ni gzhan gyi gzhung lugs kyang nges par gzung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ni gzhan gyi gzhung lugs kyang nges par gzung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Here, the phrase “and so on” refers to other systems as well.

original: des na gzhan gyi gzhung lugs dag la yang dngos po rnams skye ba mi 'thad par rab tu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des na gzhan gyi gzhung lugs dag la yang dngos po rnams skye ba mi 'thad par rab tu bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is taught that the arising of things is untenable in other systems as well.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: gzugs la sogs pa rkyen rnams yod na rnam par shes pa skye ba ma yin nam bshad pa /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rkyen rnams yod na rnam par shes pa skye ba ma yin nam bshad pa /
translated: But isn’t it the case that consciousness arises when such conditions as form exist?

original: ma yin te dngos po rnams kyi skye ba 'di brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: ma yin te dngos po rnams kyi skye ba 'di brtag par bya'o //
translated: We reply: No. The arising of things should be investigated.

original: khyod rnam par shes pa ma skyes pa rkyen gzhan du gyur pa dag las skye bar 'dod na /
analyzed: khyod rnam par shes pa ma skyes pa rkyen gzhan du gyur pa dag las skye bar 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that unarisen consciousness arises from conditions that are other,

original: rnam par shes pa ma skyes pa la bdag gi dngos po ga la yod /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ma skyes pa la bdag gi dngos po ga la yod /
translated: how could unarisen consciousness have its own intrinsic reality?

original: bdag gi dngos po med na gzhan gyi dngos po yang ga la yod /
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po med na gzhan gyi dngos po yang ga la yod /
translated: If it does not have its own intrinsic reality, how could it have the intrinsic reality of being other?

original: gzhan gyi dngos po med na de myu gu la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po med na de myu gu la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: If it does not have the intrinsic reality of being other, it is similar to a sprout and so on.

original: yang na 'di ni don gzhan yin te /
analyzed: yang na 'di ni don gzhan yin te /
translated: Or, this is the meaning of the other passage.

original: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ni rkyen rnams la yang yod pa ma yin /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ni rkyen rnams la yang yod pa ma yin /
translated: The intrinsic reality of things does not exist in conditions,

original: rkyen rnams las gzhan pa la yod pa ma yin /
analyzed: rkyen rnams las gzhan pa la yod pa ma yin /
translated: nor does it exist in what is other than conditions,

original: gnyi ga la yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga la yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: nor does it exist in both.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: skye ba'i rkyen du brtag pa don med pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: skye ba'i rkyen du brtag pa don med pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because the error of purposelessness would arise in the investigation of the conditions of arising.

original: 'di ltar gal te dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin rkyen rnams la 'am rkyen rnams las gzhan pa la 'am /🔽gnyi ga la yod par gyur na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin rkyen rnams la 'am rkyen rnams las gzhan pa la 'am / gnyi ga la yod par gyur na /
translated: As such, if the intrinsic reality of things were to exist in conditions, or in that which is other than conditions, or in both,

original: yod pa la skye ba ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: yod pa la skye ba ci zhig bya ste /
translated: then what would be the use of the arising of that which exists?

original: dngos po rang bzhin gyis yod pa rnams la yang skye bar brtag pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po rang bzhin gyis yod pa rnams la yang skye bar brtag pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be pointless to imagine that things that exist by intrinsic reality arise.

original: yod pa la rkyen rnams kyis kyang ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: yod pa la rkyen rnams kyis kyang ci zhig bya ste /
translated: And what would conditions do for that which exists?

original: rkyen du brtag pa yang don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rkyen du brtag pa yang don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be pointless to imagine conditions.

original: de lta bas na //
analyzed: de lta bas na //
translated: Thus:

original: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ni //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ni //
translated: The intrinsic reality of things

original: rkyen la sogs la yod ma yin //🔽gang rkyen la sogs pa la yod pa ma yin pa de ni bdag gi dngos po yod pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: rkyen la sogs la yod ma yin // gang rkyen la sogs pa la yod pa ma yin pa de ni bdag gi dngos po yod pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: Does not exist in conditions and so on.

original: de dag las gzhan du yongs su brtag tu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag las gzhan du yongs su brtag tu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which does not exist in conditions and so on does not intrinsically exist, because it cannot be imagined to be other than them.

original: bdag gi dngos po yod min na //
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po yod min na //
translated: If intrinsic reality does not exist,

original: gzhan gyi dngos po yod ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po yod ma yin //
translated: Extrinsic reality does not exist.

original: gzhan gyi dngos po med na su zhig dngos po rnams gzhan las skye ba'o zhes smra bar rigs /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po med na su zhig dngos po rnams gzhan las skye ba'o zhes smra bar rigs /
translated: If other things do not exist, how could anyone say that things arise from others?

original: 'dir smras pa /🔽dngos po rnams @163a * //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / dngos po rnams @163a * //
translated: Objection:🔽What is the point of saying that things

original: bdag dang gzhan la sogs pa las skye'o zhes bya ba 'dis kho bo cag la ci bya ste /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la sogs pa las skye'o zhes bya ba 'dis kho bo cag la ci bya ste /
translated: arise from self, from other, and so on?

original: 'di ltar mig la sogs pa ni rnam par shes pa skye bar bya ba'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar mig la sogs pa ni rnam par shes pa skye bar bya ba'i rkyen yin no //
translated: Because the eye and so on are conditions for the arising of consciousness.

original: de yang ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: 'di la skye ba'i bya ba ni skyed pa dang skye ba dang 'byung ba ste gtso cher rnam par shes pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: 'di la skye ba'i bya ba ni skyed pa dang skye ba dang 'byung ba ste gtso cher rnam par shes pa la 'jug go //
translated: Here the action of arising is the primary cause of generation, arising, and origination, which is consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa ni skye ba yin no //🔽'di ltar mig la sogs pa ni rnam par shes pa skye ba'i bya ba de sgrub par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni skye ba yin no // 'di ltar mig la sogs pa ni rnam par shes pa skye ba'i bya ba de sgrub par byed pa yin te /
translated: Consciousness is that which arises.

original: sgrub par byed pa yin pa'i phyir rkyen yin no //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa yin pa'i phyir rkyen yin no //
translated: Because the eye and so on are the accomplishes of the action of arising of consciousness, they are conditions because they are accomplishes.

original: dper na btso ba'i bya ba ni 'tshed pa dang btsed  pa ste gtso cher 'bras chan la 'jug cing ;
analyzed: dper na btso ba'i bya ba ni 'tshed pa dang btsed  pa ste gtso cher 'bras chan la 'jug cing ;
translated: For example, the action of cooking is the primary cause of cooking, which is rice.

original: 'bras chan ni btso ba yin la /
analyzed: 'bras chan ni btso ba yin la /
translated: Rice is cooked.

original: mi dang snod dang chu dang me dang thab la sogs pa rang rang gi bya ba byed pa dag ni btso ba'i bya ba de sgrub par byed pa'i rkyen dag yin par mthong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mi dang snod dang chu dang me dang thab la sogs pa rang rang gi bya ba byed pa dag ni btso ba'i bya ba de sgrub par byed pa'i rkyen dag yin par mthong ba bzhin no //
translated: And one sees that the individual actions of the rice, the pot, the water, the fire, the stove, etc., are the conditions for the accomplishment of the action of cooking.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: bya ba rkyen dang ldan ma yin /🔽'di la khyed na re mig la sogs pa ni rnam par shes pa skye ba'i bya ba sgrub par byed pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i rkyen yin la /
analyzed: bya ba rkyen dang ldan ma yin / 'di la khyed na re mig la sogs pa ni rnam par shes pa skye ba'i bya ba sgrub par byed pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i rkyen yin la /
translated: Action does not possess conditions.🔽You say that the eye, etc., are conditions of consciousness because they accomplish the action of generating consciousness, and that action itself engages consciousness.

original: de nyid kyang rnam par shes pa la 'jug go zhes zer ba ni bya ba brtags na mi 'thad pas mig la sogs pa dag de sgrub par byed pa yin par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de nyid kyang rnam par shes pa la 'jug go zhes zer ba ni bya ba brtags na mi 'thad pas mig la sogs pa dag de sgrub par byed pa yin par ga la 'gyur /
translated: But since action is untenable when examined, how could the eye, etc., accomplish it?

original: gal te ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar zhe na /
translated: If you ask how,

original: de'i phyir bshad pa 'di la skye ba'i bya ba ni rnam par shes pa ma skyes pa 'am skyes pa la 'jug par 'gyur grong na /
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa 'di la skye ba'i bya ba ni rnam par shes pa ma skyes pa 'am skyes pa la 'jug par 'gyur grong na /
translated: we reply: Here the action of arising would engage either in the nonarisen consciousness or in the arisen consciousness.

original: de la re zhig ma skyes pa la ni mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig ma skyes pa la ni mi 'jug ste /
translated: First, the activity of arising does not occur in relation to that which has not yet arisen.

original: gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not endure.

original: 'di ltar skye ba'i bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i gnas la 'jug gi / gnas med pa la mi 'jug pas rnam par shes pa ma skyes pa de yang med pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar skye ba'i bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i gnas la 'jug gi / gnas med pa la mi 'jug pas rnam par shes pa ma skyes pa de yang med pa yin la /
translated: Thus, the activity of arising occurs in relation to the endurance of consciousness, but not in relation to that which does not endure. Therefore, that consciousness which has not yet arisen does not exist.

original: de med na skye ba'i bya ba de la gnas pa yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de med na skye ba'i bya ba de la gnas pa yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: If it does not exist, how could the activity of arising occur in relation to it?

original: rnam par shes pa skyes pa la yang skye ba'i bya ba mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skyes pa la yang skye ba'i bya ba mi 'jug ste /
translated: Also, the activity of arising does not occur in relation to that which has already arisen.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: rnam par shes pa skyes zin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skyes zin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because consciousness has already arisen.

original: 'di ltar skyes zin pa la ni yang skye ba med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes zin pa la ni yang skye ba med do //
translated: Thus, that which has already arisen does not arise again.

original: de la 'di snyam du rnam par shes pa skye bzhin pa la skye ba'i bya ba yod par sems na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du rnam par shes pa skye bzhin pa la skye ba'i bya ba yod par sems na /
translated: If you think that the activity of arising occurs in relation to consciousness that is in the process of arising,

original: de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: de yang mi rung ste /
translated: that is also not tenable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: skyes pa dang ma skyes pa ma gtogs par skye bzhin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes pa dang ma skyes pa ma gtogs par skye bzhin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which is in the process of arising does not exist apart from that which has already arisen and that which has not yet arisen.

original: skye ba dang ma skyes pa gnyis la skye ba'i bya ba mi 'jug par ni bstan @163b zin pas de'i phyir skye ba'i bya ba med do //
analyzed: skye ba dang ma skyes pa gnyis la skye ba'i bya ba mi 'jug par ni bstan @163b zin pas de'i phyir skye ba'i bya ba med do //
translated: Since it has been demonstrated that the action of arising does not engage with respect to both that which has arisen and that which has not arisen, therefore the action of arising does not exist.

original: 'dis btso ba'i bya ba yang bsal te /
analyzed: 'dis btso ba'i bya ba yang bsal te /
translated: This also refutes the action of cooking.

original: de lta bas na bya ba rkyen dang ldan pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na bya ba rkyen dang ldan pa mi 'thad do //
translated: Thus the action that possesses conditions is untenable.

original: de la 'di snyam du rkyen dang mi ldan pa'i bya ba yod par sems na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du rkyen dang mi ldan pa'i bya ba yod par sems na /
translated: But if you think that the action that does not possess conditions exists,

original: bshad pa / rkyen dang mi ldan bya ba med //
analyzed: bshad pa / rkyen dang mi ldan bya ba med //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: The action that does not possess conditions does not exist.

original: 'di ltar rkyen dang mi ldan pa'i bya ba med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar rkyen dang mi ldan pa'i bya ba med do //
translated: Thus the action that does not possess conditions does not exist.

original: gal te yod par gyur na rtag tu thams cad las thams cad skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yod par gyur na rtag tu thams cad las thams cad skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it existed, then everything would always arise from everything.

original: de lta yin na rtsom pa thams cad don med pa nyid du 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de lta yin na rtsom pa thams cad don med pa nyid du 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod de /
translated: If that were the case, all endeavors would be pointless. But that is unacceptable.

original: de'i phyir rkyen dang mi ldan pa'i bya ba yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rkyen dang mi ldan pa'i bya ba yang mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore the action that does not possess conditions is also untenable.

original: 'dir smras pa /🔽re zhig rkyen rnams ni yod do //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / re zhig rkyen rnams ni yod do //
translated: Here, someone might say this:🔽First, conditions exist.

original: de dag yod pas dngos po 'grub bo //
analyzed: de dag yod pas dngos po 'grub bo //
translated: Since they exist, things are established.

original: de grub pas skye ba 'grub bo //
analyzed: de grub pas skye ba 'grub bo //
translated: and since that is established, arising is established.

original: bshad pa / bya ba mi ldan rkyen ma yin //
analyzed: bshad pa / bya ba mi ldan rkyen ma yin //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: A condition that does not possess activity is not a condition.

original: gang dag la bya ba med pa de dag ni rkyen ma yin no //
analyzed: gang dag la bya ba med pa de dag ni rkyen ma yin no //
translated: Those that do not possess activity are not conditions.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: mig la sogs pa ni skye ba'i bya ba sgrub par byed pas rnam par shes pa'i rkyen du 'gyur na /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ni skye ba'i bya ba sgrub par byed pas rnam par shes pa'i rkyen du 'gyur na /
translated: If the eyes and so on are conditions of consciousness because they accomplish the activity of arising,

original: skye ba'i bya ba de mi 'thad par ni sngar rab tu bstan zin to //
analyzed: skye ba'i bya ba de mi 'thad par ni sngar rab tu bstan zin to //
translated: then the activity of arising is untenable. This has been clearly demonstrated earlier.

original: de med pa'i phyir de sgrub par byed pa yod par gal 'gyur /
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir de sgrub par byed pa yod par gal 'gyur /
translated: Since that does not exist, how could that which accomplishes it exist?

original: de sgrub par byed pa med pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa skye bar bya ba'i rkyen ma yin no //
analyzed: de sgrub par byed pa med pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa skye bar bya ba'i rkyen ma yin no //
translated: Since that which accomplishes it does not exist, the eyes and so on are not conditions of the activity of arising.

original: skye bar bya ba'i rkyen ma yin na ji ltar rkyen du 'gyur /
analyzed: skye bar bya ba'i rkyen ma yin na ji ltar rkyen du 'gyur /
translated: If they are not conditions of the activity of arising, how could they be conditions?

original: ci ste 'gyur na ni thams cad kyang thams cad kyi rkyen du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste 'gyur na ni thams cad kyang thams cad kyi rkyen du 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were, then everything would be the condition of everything.

original: de lta yin na thams cad las thams cad skye bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de lta yin na thams cad las thams cad skye bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If that were the case, everything would arise from everything.

original: de ltar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: But that is not the case.

original: de'i phyir bya ba dang mi ldan pa rnams rkyen ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bya ba dang mi ldan pa rnams rkyen ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, those that do not possess activity are not conditions.

original: smras pa / ci kho bo rkyen rnams bya ba dang mi ldan no zhes smra 'am /
analyzed: smras pa / ci kho bo rkyen rnams bya ba dang mi ldan no zhes smra 'am /
translated: Objection: Do I say that conditions do not possess activity?

original: 'di ltar rkyen rnams ni bya ba dang ldan pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rkyen rnams ni bya ba dang ldan pa kho na yin no //
translated: In this way, conditions definitely possess activity.🔽In response, Nāgārjuna explains:🔽Do they possess activity or not?

original: bshad pa / bya ba ldan nam 'on te nam yin zhes bya ba'i skabs de dang sbyar te rkyen rnams bya ba dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa / bya ba ldan nam 'on te nam yin zhes bya ba'i skabs de dang sbyar te rkyen rnams bya ba dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: This is the context. Conditions do not possess activity.

original: bya ba rkyen dang ldan pa ma yin pa dang rkyen dang mi ldan pa med pa de ni sngar rab tu bstan pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: bya ba rkyen dang ldan pa ma yin pa dang rkyen dang mi ldan pa med pa de ni sngar rab tu bstan pa kho na yin no //
translated: It has been clearly demonstrated earlier that activity does not possess conditions and that that which does not possess conditions does not exist.

original: bya ba med na ji ltar rkyen rnams bya ba dang ldan par 'gyur /
analyzed: bya ba med na ji ltar rkyen rnams bya ba dang ldan par 'gyur /
translated: If activity does not exist, how could conditions possess activity?

original: de ltar na gang gi phyir bya ba dang mi ldan pa'i rkyen kyang mi 'thad la /
analyzed: de ltar na gang gi phyir bya ba dang mi ldan pa'i rkyen kyang mi 'thad la /
translated: In that case, since conditions that do not possess activity are untenable,

original: bya ba dang ldan pa yang med pas de'i phyir rkyen du rnam par brtag pa ni don med pa nyid do //
analyzed: bya ba dang ldan pa yang med pas de'i phyir rkyen du rnam par brtag pa ni don med pa nyid do //
translated: and since those that possess activity do not exist, therefore it is pointless to conceive of them as conditions.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say this:

original: ci'i rkyen rnams bya ba dang mi ldan no zhe 'am /
analyzed: ci'i rkyen rnams bya ba dang mi ldan no zhe 'am /
translated: Or do you assert that conditions are devoid of activity?

original: bya ba dang @164a * //
analyzed: bya ba dang @164a * //
translated: Or why is it that you do not need to state whether conditions are or are not associated with activity?

original: ldan no zhes bya ba mi dgos pa bsam pa 'dis ci bya /
analyzed: ldan no zhes bya ba mi dgos pa bsam pa 'dis ci bya /
translated: What is the point of this thought?

original: gang gi phyir rnam pa thams cad du rgyu la sogs pa'i rkyen bzhi po de dag la brten nas dngos po rnams skye bas de'i phyir de dag dngos po'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam pa thams cad du rgyu la sogs pa'i rkyen bzhi po de dag la brten nas dngos po rnams skye bas de'i phyir de dag dngos po'i rkyen yin no //
translated: Because things arise in dependence on those four conditions, such as the cause, therefore they are the conditions of things.

original: bshad pa / ci khyod nam mkha' la khu tshur dag gis brdeg gam /
analyzed: bshad pa / ci khyod nam mkha' la khu tshur dag gis brdeg gam /
translated: Response: Do you strike space with your fists?

original: gang gi tshe skye ba'i bya ba med pa kho na ste de med pa'i phyir rkyen rnams mi 'thad do zhes sngar bstan pa'i tshe de dag la brten nas dngos po rnams skye ba zhes bya ba de ji ltar smra bar 'thad /
analyzed: gang gi tshe skye ba'i bya ba med pa kho na ste de med pa'i phyir rkyen rnams mi 'thad do zhes sngar bstan pa'i tshe de dag la brten nas dngos po rnams skye ba zhes bya ba de ji ltar smra bar 'thad /
translated: When it is shown that the activity of arising does not exist at all, and because it does not exist, conditions are untenable, then how could it be tenable to state, “Things arise in dependence on them”?

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: 'di dag la brten skye bas na //
analyzed: 'di dag la brten skye bas na //
translated: Because things arise in dependence on them,

original: de phyir 'di dag rkyen zhes grags //
analyzed: de phyir 'di dag rkyen zhes grags //
translated: Therefore they are known as conditions.

original: ji srid mi skye de srid du //
analyzed: ji srid mi skye de srid du //
translated: As long as they do not arise,

original: 'di dag rkyen min ji ltar min //
analyzed: 'di dag rkyen min ji ltar min //
translated: Why are they not nonconditions?

original: gal te 'di dag la brten nas skye bas rkyen yin no zhes de ltar rtog na /
analyzed: gal te 'di dag la brten nas skye bas rkyen yin no zhes de ltar rtog na /
translated: If you think that they are conditions because things arise in dependence on them,🔽why don’t you also think that as long as they do not give rise to things, they are not conditions?

original: ji srid du mi skye ba de srid du rkyen ma yin no zhes bya bar yang ci'i phyir mi brtag / ci ste sngar rkyen du ma gyur pa phyis rkyen du 'gyur bar sems na /
analyzed: ji srid du mi skye ba de srid du rkyen ma yin no zhes bya bar yang ci'i phyir mi brtag / ci ste sngar rkyen du ma gyur pa phyis rkyen du 'gyur bar sems na /
translated: If you think that which was not a condition previously becomes a condition later,

original: de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: that also is not tenable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: thams cad kyi rkyen du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de yang mi 'dod do //
analyzed: thams cad kyi rkyen du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de yang mi 'dod do //
translated: Because it follows that everything would be a condition of everything, but that is unacceptable.

original: ci ste rkyen ma yin pa dag kyang gzhan 'ga' zhig la ltos nas rkyen du 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste rkyen ma yin pa dag kyang gzhan 'ga' zhig la ltos nas rkyen du 'gyur te /
translated: If you think that which is not a condition becomes a condition in dependence on something else,🔽then, since everything would be a condition in dependence on something else,

original: des na thams cad kyi rkyen du thams cad thal bar mi 'gyur bar sems na /🔽de la yang de nyid do ;
analyzed: des na thams cad kyi rkyen du thams cad thal bar mi 'gyur bar sems na / de la yang de nyid do ;
translated: the error of everything being a condition of everything would not occur.

original: / gang yang rung ba la ltos nas rkyen ma yin pa yang rkyen nyid du 'gyur na /
analyzed: / gang yang rung ba la ltos nas rkyen ma yin pa yang rkyen nyid du 'gyur na /
translated: If that which is not a condition becomes a condition in dependence on something else,

original: rkyen nyid de la yang rkyen yod par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: rkyen nyid de la yang rkyen yod par 'gyur zhing /
translated: then that condition would also have a condition,

original: de la yang de ltar bsam dgos so //
analyzed: de la yang de ltar bsam dgos so //
translated: and you would have to think in the same way about that.

original: thug pa med pa'i skyon du yang 'gyur to /
analyzed: thug pa med pa'i skyon du yang 'gyur to /
translated: The error of infinite regress would also ensue.
