original: gal te gzhan yang gzhan 'ga' zhig la ltos nas rkyen nyid du 'gyur na ;
analyzed: gal te gzhan yang gzhan 'ga' zhig la ltos nas rkyen nyid du 'gyur na ;
translated: If, moreover, a condition were to become a condition in reliance on some other,

original: de yang gzhan la ltos la de yang gzhan la ltos pas thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de yang gzhan la ltos la de yang gzhan la ltos pas thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod do //
translated: then since that would rely on another, and that would rely on another, the error of infinite regress would ensue. Therefore, that is unacceptable.

original: de'i phyir rkyen rnams mi 'thad pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rkyen rnams mi 'thad pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, conditions are untenable.

original: yang gzhan yang /🔽med dam yod pa'i don la yang //
analyzed: yang gzhan yang / med dam yod pa'i don la yang //
translated: Moreover:🔽Conditions are not tenable

original: rkyen ni rung ba ma yin no //🔽med na gang gi rkyen du 'gyur //
analyzed: rkyen ni rung ba ma yin no // med na gang gi rkyen du 'gyur //
translated: For a nonexistent or existent object.🔽If nonexistent, what would be a condition?

original: yod na rkyen gyis ci zhig bya //
analyzed: yod na rkyen gyis ci zhig bya //
translated: If existent, what would a condition do?

original: 'di la brten nas 'di skye'o zhes pa'i 'brel pa 'di sa don 'di'i rkyen 'di'o zhes zer na /
analyzed: 'di la brten nas 'di skye'o zhes pa'i 'brel pa 'di sa don 'di'i rkyen 'di'o zhes zer na /
translated: If you say that this connection “In dependence on this, that arises” is a condition of this object,

original: 'di'o 'di'o zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa de yang don med pa'am yod pa'i rkyen nyid du brtag grang na /
analyzed: 'di'o 'di'o zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa de yang don med pa'am yod pa'i rkyen nyid du brtag grang na /
translated: then that connection “This is this” would be a condition of a nonexistent or existent object.

original: don med pa dang yod pa'i rkyen 'di'o zhes bya bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: don med pa dang yod pa'i rkyen 'di'o zhes bya bar mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not tenable to say “This is this” is a condition of a nonexistent or existent object.

original: @164b ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: @164b ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: med na gang gi rkyen du 'gyur //🔽yod na rkyen gyis ci zhig bya //
analyzed: med na gang gi rkyen du 'gyur // yod na rkyen gyis ci zhig bya //
translated: If it does not exist, what would be the condition?🔽If it does exist, what would the condition do?

original: dngos po med pa'i rkyen du brtags na rkyen 'di gang gi zhes zer ba la ji skad brjod par bya /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i rkyen du brtags na rkyen 'di gang gi zhes zer ba la ji skad brjod par bya /
translated: If you imagine a condition of a non-existent thing, what would this condition be of?

original: 'di ltar snam bu med pa'i rkyen rgyu spun dag yin no zhes bstan par mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar snam bu med pa'i rkyen rgyu spun dag yin no zhes bstan par mi rigs so //
translated: Thus, it is not tenable to say, “The conditions of a non-existent cloth are the threads.”

original: smras pa / rgyu spun dag las snam bu 'byung bas phyis 'byung ba'i tshul gyis rgyu spun dag snam bu'i rkyen yin par bstan du rung ngo //
analyzed: smras pa / rgyu spun dag las snam bu 'byung bas phyis 'byung ba'i tshul gyis rgyu spun dag snam bu'i rkyen yin par bstan du rung ngo //
translated: Objection: Since a cloth arises from threads, it is tenable to say that the threads are the conditions of the cloth in the sense that they arise later.

original: bshad pa / ci khyod bum 'byung ba'i nor gyis bu'i ma kha drangs par 'dod dam /
analyzed: bshad pa / ci khyod bum 'byung ba'i nor gyis bu'i ma kha drangs par 'dod dam /
translated: Response: Do you wish to entice the mother of a child with the wealth of the child’s birth?

original: dngos po med pa'i rkyen mi 'thad do zhes smras te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i rkyen mi 'thad do zhes smras te /
translated: You said, “It is not tenable that a condition is a non-existent thing.”

original: rkyen mi 'thad pas dngos po skye ba bkag bzhin du khyod ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po skye bas rkyen nyid bsgrub par 'dod do //
analyzed: rkyen mi 'thad pas dngos po skye ba bkag bzhin du khyod ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po skye bas rkyen nyid bsgrub par 'dod do //
translated: You say that since it is not tenable that a condition is a non-existent thing, the arising of a thing is refuted, but you assert that a condition is established because a future thing arises.

original: gang gi tshe gang du dus la lar yang /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gang du dus la lar yang /
translated: When and where

original: dngos po skye ba med pa la //
analyzed: dngos po skye ba med pa la //
translated: a thing does not arise at all,

original: med na gang gi rkyen du 'gyur //
analyzed: med na gang gi rkyen du 'gyur //
translated: If it does not exist, then what would be the condition?

original: zhes bya ba 'di nye bar gnas pa de'i tshe dngos po phyis skye bar 'gyur ba de la ltos nas khyed kyi rkyen 'grub par 'gyur ba gang la yod /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di nye bar gnas pa de'i tshe dngos po phyis skye bar 'gyur ba de la ltos nas khyed kyi rkyen 'grub par 'gyur ba gang la yod /
translated: When that which is to be arisen later exists, then in dependence on that, your condition would be established. But how could that be?

original: de lta bas na de ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na de ni gyi na'o //
translated: Therefore, this is just babbling.

original: de la 'di snyam du yod pa'i rkyen du 'gyur sems na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du yod pa'i rkyen du 'gyur sems na /
translated: But if you think that it is a condition of that which exists,

original: bshad pa / yod na rkyen gyis ci zhig bya //
analyzed: bshad pa / yod na rkyen gyis ci zhig bya //
translated: then Nāgārjuna explains: If it exists, what would a condition do?

original: dngos po yod pa la rkyen mi 'thad do //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa la rkyen mi 'thad do //
translated: It is untenable that a condition is of an existent thing.

original: 'di ltar yod pa la yang rkyen gyis ci zhig bya ste /🔽snam bu grub cing yod pa'i rkyen rgyu spun dag yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar yod pa la yang rkyen gyis ci zhig bya ste / snam bu grub cing yod pa'i rkyen rgyu spun dag yin no //
translated: In that case, what would a condition do for that which exists?

original: zhes bstan par mi rigs so //
analyzed: zhes bstan par mi rigs so //
translated: It is untenable to say, “The cause, thread, is a condition of the cloth that is established and exists.”

original: smras pa / kho bo skyes pa la yang rkyen gyi bya ba yod do zhes mi smra ste 'on kyang snam bu yod pa'i rkyen rgyu spun yin par tha snyad 'dogs par byed pas snam bu de'i rkyen rgyu spun dag yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / kho bo skyes pa la yang rkyen gyi bya ba yod do zhes mi smra ste 'on kyang snam bu yod pa'i rkyen rgyu spun yin par tha snyad 'dogs par byed pas snam bu de'i rkyen rgyu spun dag yin no //
translated: Objection: I do not say that the action of a condition exists for that which has arisen, but since we impute the convention “The cause, thread, is a condition of the cloth that exists,” the cause, thread, is a condition of that cloth.

original: bshad pa / ci khyod rang gi chung ma ma blangs par bu'i chung ma blang bar sems sam /🔽dngos po yod pa skye ba'i rkyen mi 'thad pas dngos po skye ba bkag bzhin du khyod snam bu skyes pa'i rkyen ston par byed 'dod go /'o na ni dngos po skye ba sgrub pa'i phyir je sgrims shig dang de'i 'og tu 'di'i rkyen 'di'o //
analyzed: bshad pa / ci khyod rang gi chung ma ma blangs par bu'i chung ma blang bar sems sam / dngos po yod pa skye ba'i rkyen mi 'thad pas dngos po skye ba bkag bzhin du khyod snam bu skyes pa'i rkyen ston par byed 'dod go /'o na ni dngos po skye ba sgrub pa'i phyir je sgrims shig dang de'i 'og tu 'di'i rkyen 'di'o //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: Do you think that you can take a son’s wife without taking your own wife?🔽Since it is untenable that a thing that exists arises, while you are refuting the arising of a thing, you wish to demonstrate the conditions of the arising of a cloth.

original: zhes bya ba de 'thad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de 'thad par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if that is so, then in order to establish the arising of a thing, you should first be attentive, and then it would be tenable to say, “This is the condition of that.”

original: de lta bas na de yang gyi na'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na de yang gyi na'o //
translated: But since that is not the case, that is also untenable.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say this:

original: 'di la dngos po rnams ni mtshan nyid la 'grub la /
analyzed: 'di la dngos po rnams ni mtshan nyid la 'grub la /
translated: Things are established from their characteristics.

original: rgyu ni sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: And the definition of a cause is that which establishes.

original: zhes rgyu'i mtshan nyid kyang bstan pas de ltar mtshan nyid yod pa'i rgyu yod de /🔽bshad pa / gang tshe chos ni yod pa dang// @165a * //
analyzed: zhes rgyu'i mtshan nyid kyang bstan pas de ltar mtshan nyid yod pa'i rgyu yod de / bshad pa / gang tshe chos ni yod pa dang// @165a * //
translated: Since the definition of a cause is also taught, in that way a cause that exists has a characteristic.

original: med dang yod med mi 'grub pas //
analyzed: med dang yod med mi 'grub pas //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: Since a thing is not established As existent, nonexistent, or both existent and nonexistent,

original: ji ltar sgrub byed rgyu zhes bya //
analyzed: ji ltar sgrub byed rgyu zhes bya //
translated: How could a cause that establishes

original: de ltar yin na mi rigs so //
analyzed: de ltar yin na mi rigs so //
translated: Be tenable if it were like that?

original: 'di la chos gang rgyus sgrub par gyur na de yod pa'am med pa'am yod med cig sgrub par 'gyur grang na /🔽rnam pa thams cad mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'di la chos gang rgyus sgrub par gyur na de yod pa'am med pa'am yod med cig sgrub par 'gyur grang na / rnam pa thams cad mi 'thad do //
translated: If a cause establishes an existent, non-existent, or existent and non-existent thing,

original: de la re zhig yod pa ni sgrub par mi byed de /
analyzed: de la re zhig yod pa ni sgrub par mi byed de /
translated: then in no way is it tenable.

original: skyes zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: First, an existent is not established because it has already arisen.

original: 'di ltar skyes pa la yang skye bas ci bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes pa la yang skye bas ci bya ste /
translated: What would the arising of that which has already arisen accomplish?

original: ci ste yod kyang yang skye ba ni nam yang mi skye bar mi 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod do //
analyzed: ci ste yod kyang yang skye ba ni nam yang mi skye bar mi 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod do //
translated: If that which exists were to arise again, then it would never not arise. But that is unacceptable.

original: rgyur bstan du yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: rgyur bstan du yang mi 'thad de /
translated: It is also not tenable to say that it is taught as a cause.

original: 'di ltar yod pa la rgyus ci bya /
analyzed: 'di ltar yod pa la rgyus ci bya /
translated: What would a cause do for that which exists?

original: 'di ltar re zhig yod pa ni sgrub par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig yod pa ni sgrub par mi byed do //
translated: Thus, first, an existent is not established.

original: da ni med pa yang sgrub par mi byed de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ni med pa yang sgrub par mi byed de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Now, a non-existent is also not established because it does not exist.

original: ci ste med kyang skye na ni ri bong gi rva yang skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste med kyang skye na ni ri bong gi rva yang skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if that which does not exist were to arise, then even the horn of a donkey would arise.

original: gal te dngos po ni rgyu las skye'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po ni rgyu las skye'o zhe na /
translated: But if you think that a thing arises from a cause,

original: mi rung ste /
analyzed: mi rung ste /
translated: that is not possible.

original: rgyu mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a cause is untenable.

original: 'di ltar dngos po med na gang gi rgyur ci 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po med na gang gi rgyur ci 'gyur /
translated: Thus, if a thing does not exist, what would be the cause of what?

original: yang na ci zhig byas na rgyu'i rgyu nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: yang na ci zhig byas na rgyu'i rgyu nyid du 'gyur /
translated: Or, what would be done so that it would be the cause of a cause?

original: 'di ltar thams cad du dngos po med /🔽de la 'di ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar thams cad du dngos po med / de la 'di ni rgyu'o //
translated: Thus, in every way, a thing does not exist.🔽How could it be said that this is the cause of that,

original: 'di ni ma yin no zhes bye brag bstan pa de yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ni ma yin no zhes bye brag bstan pa de yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: and that is not?

original: de lta bas na med pa yang sgrub par mi byed do //
analyzed: de lta bas na med pa yang sgrub par mi byed do //
translated: Therefore, an existent is not established.

original: da ni yod med kyang sgrub par mi byed de /
analyzed: da ni yod med kyang sgrub par mi byed de /
translated: Now, an existent and nonexistent is not established,

original: yod pa dang med pa gnyis lhan cig 'byung ba 'gal ba'i phyir dang / skyon snga mar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa gnyis lhan cig 'byung ba 'gal ba'i phyir dang / skyon snga mar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is contradictory for an existent and a nonexistent to occur together, and because the previously mentioned error would ensue.

original: de ltar na yod med kyang sgrub par mi byed do //
analyzed: de ltar na yod med kyang sgrub par mi byed do //
translated: Thus, an existent and nonexistent is not established.

original: de'i phyir de ltar brtags na gang gi tshe dngos po grub pa ji ltar yang mi 'thad pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar brtags na gang gi tshe dngos po grub pa ji ltar yang mi 'thad pa de'i tshe /
translated: Therefore, when a thing is not tenable in any way, when it is investigated in this way,

original: ji ltar sgrub byed rgyu zhes bya //
analyzed: ji ltar sgrub byed rgyu zhes bya //
translated: How could it be the cause of an established thing?

original: de ltar yin na mi rigs so //
analyzed: de ltar yin na mi rigs so //
translated: If it were so, it would not be tenable.

original: de ltar yin na sgrub par byed rgyu zhes bya ba de mi rigs so //
analyzed: de ltar yin na sgrub par byed rgyu zhes bya ba de mi rigs so //
translated: If it were so, it would not be tenable to call it “the cause of an established thing.”

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone says:

original: dmigs pa ni yod de /
analyzed: dmigs pa ni yod de /
translated: An object exists,

original: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the basis of consciousness and so on.🔽In response, Aryadeva says:

original: bshad pa / yin pa'i chos ni dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: bshad pa / yin pa'i chos ni dmigs pa ni /
translated: An existent phenomenon is said

original: med pa kho nar nye bar bstan //
analyzed: med pa kho nar nye bar bstan //
translated: to be only without an object.

original: 'di la dmigs pa dang bcas par zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: 'di la dmigs pa dang bcas par zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: Here the phrase “with an object” is left incomplete.

original: yin pa'i chos 'di dmigs pa kho na las dmigs pa dang bcas par nye bar bstan to //
analyzed: yin pa'i chos 'di dmigs pa kho na las dmigs pa dang bcas par nye bar bstan to //
translated: This existent phenomenon is said to be “with an object” only in relation to an object.

original: yin pa'i chos 'di dmigs pa med pa kho na las khyod kyis rang gi blo dmigs pa dang bcas pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: yin pa'i chos 'di dmigs pa med pa kho na las khyod kyis rang gi blo dmigs pa dang bcas pa zhes brjod do //
translated: You say that this existent phenomenon is “with an object” only in relation to an object that does not exist!

original: ji lta zhe @165b na 'di la dmigs pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa yod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji lta zhe @165b na 'di la dmigs pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa yod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: How is this so? Here “with an object” means “with an existent object.”

original: chos yod pa ni dmigs pa dang bcas par 'gyur gyi med pa ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos yod pa ni dmigs pa dang bcas par 'gyur gyi med pa ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: An existent phenomenon becomes “with an object,” but not one that does not exist.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i sngon rol na dmigs pa med pas de ni dmigs pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i sngon rol na dmigs pa med pas de ni dmigs pa med pa yin no //
translated: Before it is “with an object,” it is without an object. Therefore, it is without an object.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: dper na nor yod pa ni nor dang bcas pa ste nor can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dper na nor yod pa ni nor dang bcas pa ste nor can zhes bya'o //
translated: For example, one who has wealth is said to be “endowed with wealth,” or “wealthy.”

original: 'ga' zhig yod na nor dang bcas par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig yod na nor dang bcas par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If one has some wealth, one is endowed with wealth.

original: med na mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med na mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not have any wealth, one is not endowed with wealth.

original: nor dang bcas pa'i sngon rol na nor med pas de ni nor med pa yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: nor dang bcas pa'i sngon rol na nor med pas de ni nor med pa yin pa bzhin no //
translated: Prior to being endowed with wealth, one does not have wealth, and so one is not endowed with wealth.

original: de'i phyir dmigs pa med pa kho na yin pa'i chos 'di la khyed rang gi rnam par rtog pas dmigs pa dang bcas par rtog par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir dmigs pa med pa kho na yin pa'i chos 'di la khyed rang gi rnam par rtog pas dmigs pa dang bcas par rtog par byed do //
translated: Therefore, you imagine that this dharma, which is devoid of an object, is endowed with an object due to your own imagination.

original: de la kho bos bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la kho bos bshad par bya ste /
translated: We will explain this.

original: de ltar chos ni dmigs med na //
analyzed: de ltar chos ni dmigs med na //
translated: If a dharma is devoid of an object,

original: dmigs pa yod par ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: dmigs pa yod par ga la 'gyur //
translated: how could an object exist?

original: de ltar zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dri ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dri ba'o //
translated: The word “if” indicates a question.

original: ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: “How could” indicates the presentation of a reason.

original: de ltar chos dmigs pa med par grub na ci'i phyir don med pa'i dmigs pa la rtog par byed /
analyzed: de ltar chos dmigs pa med par grub na ci'i phyir don med pa'i dmigs pa la rtog par byed /
translated: If a dharma is established as devoid of an object, why imagine an object that does not exist?

original: smras pa / khyod nyid gzhung lugs khong du ma chud pa kho nas log par rtog gi / kho bo ni dmigs pa yod pa ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa ste nor dang bcas pa bzhin no zhes mi smra'o //
analyzed: smras pa / khyod nyid gzhung lugs khong du ma chud pa kho nas log par rtog gi / kho bo ni dmigs pa yod pa ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa ste nor dang bcas pa bzhin no zhes mi smra'o //
translated: Objection: You yourself, not understanding the textual system, have a wrong conception. I do not say that that which has an object has an object, just as one who has wealth has wealth.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te chos grub pa ni gzhi gang gis sgrub par byed pa de ni de'i dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te chos grub pa ni gzhi gang gis sgrub par byed pa de ni de'i dmigs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: A phenomenon that is established is established by some basis, and that is its object.

original: des na de dmigs pa dang bcas pa zhes nye bar ston te //
analyzed: des na de dmigs pa dang bcas pa zhes nye bar ston te //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that it has an object.

original: bshad pa / de mi 'thad de /
analyzed: bshad pa / de mi 'thad de /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: That is untenable.

original: de la yang bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de la yang bshad par bya'o //
translated: That should be explained.

original: de ltar chos ni dmigs med na //
analyzed: de ltar chos ni dmigs med na //
translated: If a phenomenon does not have an object,

original: dmigs pa yod par ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: dmigs pa yod par ga la 'gyur //
translated: How could an object exist?

original: de ltar chos dmigs pa med de yod pa ma yin zhing mngon par ma grub na dmigs pa yod par 'thad par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar chos dmigs pa med de yod pa ma yin zhing mngon par ma grub na dmigs pa yod par 'thad par ga la 'gyur /
translated: If a phenomenon does not have an object, does not exist, and is not established, how could an object exist?

original: chos kyi dmigs pa zhes bya ba de yang mngon par ma grub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dmigs pa zhes bya ba de yang mngon par ma grub pa kho na'o //
translated: That which is called the object of a phenomenon is also just not established.

original: mngon par ma grub cing med pa de la dmigs pa yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub cing med pa de la dmigs pa yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: How could an object exist for that which is not established and does not exist?

original: dmigs pa med na ji ltar dmigs pas chos sgrub par byed /
analyzed: dmigs pa med na ji ltar dmigs pas chos sgrub par byed /
translated: If there is no object, how can one practice the Dharma by objectifying it?

original: de'i phyir dmigs pa yang yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir dmigs pa yang yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, the object does not exist.

original: chos kyang dmigs pa dang bcas pa ma yin pa kho na'o //🔽'dir smras pa /
analyzed: chos kyang dmigs pa dang bcas pa ma yin pa kho na'o // 'dir smras pa /
translated: The Dharma is not objectified.

original: dngos po gzhan 'gags ma thag pa ni dngos po gzhan skye ba'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: dngos po gzhan 'gags ma thag pa ni dngos po gzhan skye ba'i rkyen yin no //
translated: Objection: The thing that has just ceased is the condition of the arising of another thing.

original: de ni de ma thag pa zhes bya ba @166a * //
analyzed: de ni de ma thag pa zhes bya ba @166a * //
translated: That is called “immediately antecedent”

original: ste de yod do //
analyzed: ste de yod do //
translated: and it exists.🔽In response, Aryadeva says:

original: bshad pa / chos rnams skyes pa ma yin na //
analyzed: bshad pa / chos rnams skyes pa ma yin na //
translated: If things have not arisen,

original: 'gag pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gag pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Their cessation is not tenable.🔽Therefore, the immediately antecedent condition

original: de phyir de ma thag mi rigs //
analyzed: de phyir de ma thag mi rigs //
translated: Makes no sense.

original: 'gags na rkyen yang gang zhig yin //
analyzed: 'gags na rkyen yang gang zhig yin //
translated: If it has ceased, what can be a condition?

original: de la rtsa ba 'og ma gnyis //
analyzed: de la rtsa ba 'og ma gnyis //
translated: The last two lines

original: 'gags na rkyen yang gang zhig yin //
analyzed: 'gags na rkyen yang gang zhig yin //
translated: If it has ceased, what can be a condition?🔽Therefore, the immediately antecedent condition

original: de phyir de ma thag mi rigs //🔽zhes ba snor bar blta bar bya'o //🔽zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dir ma skyes pa la ltos par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de phyir de ma thag mi rigs // zhes ba snor bar blta bar bya'o // zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dir ma skyes pa la ltos par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Makes no sense.🔽should be applied here.🔽The word “also” should be understood as referring to “non-arisen.”

original: de yang ma skyes pa'i sgra la ltos nas /
analyzed: de yang ma skyes pa'i sgra la ltos nas /
translated: Moreover, it should be understood as referring to the word “non-arisen.”

original: 'gags na rkyen yang gang zhig yin //
analyzed: 'gags na rkyen yang gang zhig yin //
translated: If it ceases, what would be the condition?

original: ma skyes pa'i rkyen gang zhig yin //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i rkyen gang zhig yin //
translated: What would be the condition of what has not arisen?

original: zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is to be supplied.

original: de gnyis ni tshigs su bcad pa sbyar ba'i phyir go rims bzhin ma byas so //
analyzed: de gnyis ni tshigs su bcad pa sbyar ba'i phyir go rims bzhin ma byas so //
translated: These two are not in the same order because they are applied to the verse.

original: dngos po gzhan 'gag ma thag pa ni dngos po gzhan skye ba'i rkyen yin no zhes smras pa gang yin pa de mi 'thad do //
analyzed: dngos po gzhan 'gag ma thag pa ni dngos po gzhan skye ba'i rkyen yin no zhes smras pa gang yin pa de mi 'thad do //
translated: It is not tenable to say that the cessation of one thing, an entity, is the condition of the arising of another, an entity.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not tenable?🔽Because it is said:

original: 'di ltar / chos rnams skyes pa ma yin na //
analyzed: 'di ltar / chos rnams skyes pa ma yin na //
translated: If things have not arisen,

original: 'gag pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gag pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: cessation is not tenable.

original: 'gags na rkyen yang gang zhig yin //
analyzed: 'gags na rkyen yang gang zhig yin //
translated: If it ceases, what would be the condition?🔽What would be the condition of cessation?

original: 'gag pa zhes bya ba ni med pa ste /
analyzed: 'gag pa zhes bya ba ni med pa ste /
translated: Cessation is nonexistence.

original: de la gal te myu gu skye ba'i sngon rol du sa bon 'gag par 'gyur na ni sa bon 'gags te med na myu gu skye bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de'i rkyen yang gang zhig yin /
analyzed: de la gal te myu gu skye ba'i sngon rol du sa bon 'gag par 'gyur na ni sa bon 'gags te med na myu gu skye bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de'i rkyen yang gang zhig yin /
translated: If the seed ceases and does not exist prior to the arising of the sprout, what would be the condition of the sprout that arises when the seed has ceased and does not exist?

original: yang na sa bon 'gag pa'i rkyen yang gang zhig yin /
analyzed: yang na sa bon 'gag pa'i rkyen yang gang zhig yin /
translated: Or what would be the condition of the cessation of the seed?

original: sa bon 'gags te med pa yang ji ltar myu gu skye ba'i rkyen du 'gyur /
analyzed: sa bon 'gags te med pa yang ji ltar myu gu skye ba'i rkyen du 'gyur /
translated: Also, how could a seed that has ceased and is nonexistent become the condition for the arising of a sprout?

original: myu gu ma skyes pa'i rkyen du sa bon 'gag pa ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: myu gu ma skyes pa'i rkyen du sa bon 'gag pa ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could a seed that has ceased become the condition for a sprout that has not yet arisen?

original: de lta bas na sa bon 'gags nas myu gu skye bar rtog na de gnyi ga rgyu med par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bas na sa bon 'gags nas myu gu skye bar rtog na de gnyi ga rgyu med par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, if you imagine that a sprout arises after a seed has ceased, it follows that both would be without a cause.

original: rgyu med par ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: rgyu med par ni mi 'dod do //
translated: But you do not assert that they are without a cause.

original: smras pa / gal te myu gu skyes ma thag tu sa bon 'gag par 'gyur na /
analyzed: smras pa / gal te myu gu skyes ma thag tu sa bon 'gag par 'gyur na /
translated: Objection: If a seed ceases immediately after a sprout arises,

original: de lta na yang de ma thag 'grub ste /
analyzed: de lta na yang de ma thag 'grub ste /
translated: in that case, it is established that it is an antecedent condition.

original: 'di ltar myu gu skyes ma thag tu sa bon 'gag pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar myu gu skyes ma thag tu sa bon 'gag pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In that case, immediately after a sprout arises, it becomes the condition for the cessation of a seed.

original: bshad pa / de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: bshad pa / de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: Response: That also is untenable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: skyes na'ang rkyen du ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: skyes na'ang rkyen du ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: If it arises, how could it be a condition?

original: gal te myu gu skye zhing myu gu skye ba'i bya ba mthar thug pa'i tshe sa bon 'gag par 'gyur na 'gag pa de'i rkyen yang gang zhig yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te myu gu skye zhing myu gu skye ba'i bya ba mthar thug pa'i tshe sa bon 'gag par 'gyur na 'gag pa de'i rkyen yang gang zhig yin par 'gyur /
translated: If a sprout arises and the activity of the arising of a sprout is completed, then at that time the seed ceases. What would be the condition for that cessation?

original: myu gu skye ba'i rkyen yang gang zhig yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: myu gu skye ba'i rkyen yang gang zhig yin par 'gyur te /
translated: What would be the condition of the arising of the sprout?

original: de'i phyir de lta na yang de gnyi ga snga ma bzhin du rgyu med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de lta na yang de gnyi ga snga ma bzhin du rgyu med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, in this way also, both are consequence-free, as before.

original: ci ste sa bon 'gag bzhin pa na myu gu skye bas des na rgyu med @166b pa'i rkyen du mi 'gyur bar sems na /
analyzed: ci ste sa bon 'gag bzhin pa na myu gu skye bas des na rgyu med @166b pa'i rkyen du mi 'gyur bar sems na /
translated: But if you think that since the sprout arises when the seed is in the process of ceasing, therefore it is not a consequence-free condition,

original: de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te /
translated: that also is illogical.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gang 'gag pa dang gang skye ba de gnyi ga yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang 'gag pa dang gang skye ba de gnyi ga yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Because neither that which is ceasing nor that which is arising exists.

original: ma 'gag pa'i phyir dang / skyes zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'gag pa'i phyir dang / skyes zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has not ceased and because it has already arisen.

original: dngos po gnyis yod na /
analyzed: dngos po gnyis yod na /
translated: If two things exist,

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid du ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid du ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: how could they be the condition of the immediately preceding condition?

original: skye ba dang 'gag pa gnyis dus gcig tu rtog na yang de ma thag pa mi 'thad de /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gag pa gnyis dus gcig tu rtog na yang de ma thag pa mi 'thad de /
translated: If you imagine that arising and ceasing are simultaneous, then the immediately preceding condition is untenable,

original: dus mnyam pa'i phyir ro //🔽de'i phyir de ma thag mi rigs /
analyzed: dus mnyam pa'i phyir ro // de'i phyir de ma thag mi rigs /
translated: because they are simultaneous.🔽Therefore, the immediately preceding condition is untenable.

original: de ltar gang gi phyir rnam pa thams cad du brtags na de ma thag pa mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de ltar gang gi phyir rnam pa thams cad du brtags na de ma thag pa mi 'thad de /
translated: Thus, in every way, if one examines the immediately preceding condition, it is untenable.

original: de'i phyir de ma thag pa'i rkyen yod do zhes smras pa gang yin pa de mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ma thag pa'i rkyen yod do zhes smras pa gang yin pa de mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable to state, “The immediately preceding condition exists.”

original: yang na 'di ni don gzhan yin te /
analyzed: yang na 'di ni don gzhan yin te /
translated: Or, this is another point:

original: 'di la dngos po rnams ma skyes pa zhes bya ba de ni sngar bsgrubs zin te /
analyzed: 'di la dngos po rnams ma skyes pa zhes bya ba de ni sngar bsgrubs zin te /
translated: Here, the non-arising of things has already been established.

original: de'i phyir dngos po rnams skye ba med pa de grub par byas nas //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po rnams skye ba med pa de grub par byas nas //
translated: Therefore, having established that things do not arise,🔽Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / chos rnams skyes pa ma yin na //
analyzed: bshad pa / chos rnams skyes pa ma yin na //
translated: If things have not arisen,

original: 'gag pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gag pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Their cessation is untenable.

original: dngos po rnams skyes pa ma yin zhing med na 'gag pa 'thad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams skyes pa ma yin zhing med na 'gag pa 'thad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If things have not arisen and do not exist, their cessation is untenable.

original: med pa la ci zhig 'gag par 'gyur /
analyzed: med pa la ci zhig 'gag par 'gyur /
translated: What could cease of that which does not exist?

original: de phyir de ma thag mi rigs //
analyzed: de phyir de ma thag mi rigs //
translated: Therefore, the immediately preceding condition is illogical.

original: de ltar gang gi phyir dngos po 'gag pa nyid mi 'thad pa de'i phyir de ma thag pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: de ltar gang gi phyir dngos po 'gag pa nyid mi 'thad pa de'i phyir de ma thag pa mi rigs so //
translated: Thus, because the cessation of things is untenable, the immediately preceding condition is illogical.

original: de ni 'gag par rtog na yang de ma thag pa mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni 'gag par rtog na yang de ma thag pa mi rigs te /
translated: Moreover, if you imagine cessation, the immediately preceding condition is illogical.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: 'gags na rkyen yang gang zhig yin /
analyzed: 'gags na rkyen yang gang zhig yin /
translated: If ceased, what would be the condition?

original: skyes na'ang rkyen du ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: skyes na'ang rkyen du ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: But if it does arise, how could it be a condition?

original: de'i don ni sngar rnam par bshad zin to //
analyzed: de'i don ni sngar rnam par bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of this has already been explained above.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone says:

original: bdag po nyid ni yod do //
analyzed: bdag po nyid ni yod do //
translated: The state of being a dominant condition exists.

original: bdag po'i dngos po ni bdag po nyid de /
analyzed: bdag po'i dngos po ni bdag po nyid de /
translated: The state of being a dominant condition is the state of being a dominant condition.

original: de yang mdor bsdu na gang yod na gang 'byung ba dang / gang med na gang mi 'byung ba de ni de'i bdag po nyid do //
analyzed: de yang mdor bsdu na gang yod na gang 'byung ba dang / gang med na gang mi 'byung ba de ni de'i bdag po nyid do //
translated: Moreover, in brief, if something exists, then something else arises, and if something does not exist, then something else does not arise. That is the state of being a dominant condition.🔽Nāgārjuna responds:

original: bshad pa / dngos po rang bzhin med rnams kyi //
analyzed: bshad pa / dngos po rang bzhin med rnams kyi //
translated: Since things that lack intrinsic reality

original: yod pa gang phyir yod mi man //
analyzed: yod pa gang phyir yod mi man //
translated: Do not exist, how could they be existent?🔽The statement,

original: 'di yod pas na 'di 'byung zhes //
analyzed: 'di yod pas na 'di 'byung zhes //
translated: “Because this exists, that arises,”

original: bya ba de ni 'thad ma yin /
analyzed: bya ba de ni 'thad ma yin /
translated: Is not tenable.

original: 'di la dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin med pa nyid ni sngar yang kun tu bstan cing phyis kyang rgya cher ston to ;
analyzed: 'di la dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin med pa nyid ni sngar yang kun tu bstan cing phyis kyang rgya cher ston to ;
translated: Here, the absence of intrinsic reality of things was already taught above and will be extensively taught later.

original: / de'i phyir de rab tu grub par byas nas dngos po rang bzhin med pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: / de'i phyir de rab tu grub par byas nas dngos po rang bzhin med pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, having established that, he says, “Things that lack intrinsic reality.”

original: ji ltar gang gi phyir dngos po rang bzhin med pa rnams kyis yod pa zhes bya ba yod pa'i dngos po mi 'thad pa de'i phyir gang yod na 'di yod pas zhes brjod par nus pa'i dngos @167a * //🔽po de nyid med do //
analyzed: ji ltar gang gi phyir dngos po rang bzhin med pa rnams kyis yod pa zhes bya ba yod pa'i dngos po mi 'thad pa de'i phyir gang yod na 'di yod pas zhes brjod par nus pa'i dngos @167a * // po de nyid med do //
translated: Since things that lack intrinsic reality are not tenable as existent, therefore, that very thing which is able to be said to exist when this exists does not exist.

original: 'di yod pas zhes bya ba 'di la med na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba de 'thad par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di yod pas zhes bya ba 'di la med na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba de 'thad par ga la 'gyur /
translated: If this does not exist, how could it be tenable to say “that arises when this exists”?

original: 'di yod pas 'di 'byung zhes bya ba 'di la mi 'thad na gang gi bdag po nyid du ji zhig 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di yod pas 'di 'byung zhes bya ba 'di la mi 'thad na gang gi bdag po nyid du ji zhig 'gyur /
translated: If it is not tenable to say “that arises when this exists,” then what would be the state of being a dominant condition?

original: de'i phyir bdag po nyid kyang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag po nyid kyang mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, the state of being a dominant condition is also not tenable.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say:

original: rkyen gyi dngos po rnams 'di ltar grub par byed do zhes bya ba de smra bar mi nus mod kyi /
analyzed: rkyen gyi dngos po rnams 'di ltar grub par byed do zhes bya ba de smra bar mi nus mod kyi /
translated: Although it is not possible to say “conditions cause this to be established,”

original: 'on kyang rkyen rnams ni yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rkyen rnams ni yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: nonetheless, conditions certainly exist.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: de dag las 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dag las 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because effects arise from them.

original: 'di na sa bon la sogs pa rkyen rnams las myu gu la sogs pa 'bras bu skye bar mthong ste /
analyzed: 'di na sa bon la sogs pa rkyen rnams las myu gu la sogs pa 'bras bu skye bar mthong ste /
translated: Here, a result such as a sprout is seen to arise from conditions such as seeds.

original: de'i phyir de dag las 'bras bu skye bar mthong nas 'bras bu'i rkyen ni 'di dag go zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag las 'bras bu skye bar mthong nas 'bras bu'i rkyen ni 'di dag go zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: Therefore, since a result is seen to arise from them, it is understood that these are the conditions of the result.

original: bshad pa / rkyen rnams so so 'dus pa las //
analyzed: bshad pa / rkyen rnams so so 'dus pa las //
translated: In response, Aryadeva says:

original: 'bras bu de ni med pa nyid //🔽rkyen rnams la ni gang med pa //
analyzed: 'bras bu de ni med pa nyid // rkyen rnams la ni gang med pa //
translated: The result does not exist in the assembly🔽of conditions individually or collectively.🔽How can something that does not exist in conditions

original: de ni rkyen las ji ltar skye //
analyzed: de ni rkyen las ji ltar skye //
translated: arise from conditions?

original: nyid ces bya ba'i sgra ni kho na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyid ces bya ba'i sgra ni kho na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word “only” means “exclusively.”

original: so so bdag la yang med pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: so so bdag la yang med pa kho na yin la /
translated: It does not exist in the individual conditions exclusively.

original: 'dus pa dag la yang med pa kho na'o zhes bya'o //🔽khyod kyis rkyen rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir 'bras bu skye bar bstan pa gang yin pa de nyid mi 'thad na /
analyzed: 'dus pa dag la yang med pa kho na'o zhes bya'o // khyod kyis rkyen rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir 'bras bu skye bar bstan pa gang yin pa de nyid mi 'thad na /
translated: It does not exist in the collective conditions exclusively.🔽Since the very teaching that a result arises in order to establish the conditions is untenable, how can the conditions be established?

original: rkyen 'grub par ga la 'gyur ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: rkyen 'grub par ga la 'gyur ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gang gi phyir rkyen rnams so so ba dang 'dus pa la 'bras bu de med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rkyen rnams so so ba dang 'dus pa la 'bras bu de med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the effect does not exist in the individual conditions or in their assembly.

original: rkyen rnams so so ba dang 'dus pa la med pa nyid gang yin pa de ji ltar de dag las skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rkyen rnams so so ba dang 'dus pa la med pa nyid gang yin pa de ji ltar de dag las skye bar 'gyur /
translated: How could that which does not exist in the individual conditions and in their assembly arise from them?

original: 'bras bu skye ba med na khyod kyis rkyen 'grub par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: 'bras bu skye ba med na khyod kyis rkyen 'grub par ga la 'gyur /
translated: If the effect does not arise, how could you establish conditions?

original: de la 'di snyam du rkyen rnams las 'bras bu yod pa kho nar sems na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du rkyen rnams las 'bras bu yod pa kho nar sems na /
translated: But if you think that the effect exists in conditions,

original: de lta na yang rkyen 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang rkyen 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: in that case also conditions are not tenable.

original: 'di ltar yod pa la rkyen gyis bya ba med de skyes zin pa yang skyed mi dgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar yod pa la rkyen gyis bya ba med de skyes zin pa yang skyed mi dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because conditions have no function with respect to that which exists, because that which has already arisen does not need to arise again.

original: yang gzhan yang gal te rkyen rnams la 'bras bu de yod par gyur na /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang gal te rkyen rnams la 'bras bu de yod par gyur na /
translated: Moreover, if the effect exists in conditions,

original: rkyen du ma'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de rkyen re re la yongs su rdzogs par yod pa'am /
analyzed: rkyen du ma'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de rkyen re re la yongs su rdzogs par yod pa'am /
translated: then the effect of many conditions would either exist completely in each condition

original: cha shas cig yod par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: cha shas cig yod par 'gyur grang na /
translated: or it would exist in part in each condition.

original: de la re zhig gal te re re la yongs su rdzogs pa yod par brtags na ni rkyen du mar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la re zhig gal te re re la yongs su rdzogs pa yod par brtags na ni rkyen du mar mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if you imagine that each condition has the whole effect, then they would not be many conditions.

original: re re la yang yod pa'i phyir mi ltos par re re las kyang 'bras bu skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: re re la yang yod pa'i phyir mi ltos par re re las kyang 'bras bu skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because each condition would have the whole effect, it follows that the effect would arise from each condition without depending on the others.

original: ci ste rkyen rnams la @167b 'bras bu'i cha shas yod par brtags na ni /
analyzed: ci ste rkyen rnams la @167b 'bras bu'i cha shas yod par brtags na ni /
translated: But if you imagine that the effect has parts, and that each condition has a part of the effect,

original: de lta na yang mi ltos par re re las 'bras bu'i cha shas skye bar thal bar 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de lta na yang mi ltos par re re las 'bras bu'i cha shas skye bar thal bar 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod de /
translated: then it follows that the effect would arise from each part of the conditions without depending on the others. But that is unacceptable.

original: de'i phyir rkyen rnams so so ba dang 'dus pa la 'bras bu de yod par mi 'thad do //🔽ci ste rkyen rnams la 'bras bu med kyang rkyen rnams las skye ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rkyen rnams so so ba dang 'dus pa la 'bras bu de yod par mi 'thad do // ci ste rkyen rnams la 'bras bu med kyang rkyen rnams las skye ste /
translated: Therefore, it is untenable that the effect exists in the individual or the assembly of conditions.🔽But if you think that although the effect does not exist in the conditions, it arises from the conditions,

original: 'bras bu skye ba la ltos nas kho bo'i rkyen rab tu 'grub bo snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'bras bu skye ba la ltos nas kho bo'i rkyen rab tu 'grub bo snyam du sems na /
translated: and that the conditions are established in dependence on the arising of the effect,

original: de la bshad par bya ste /🔽ci ste de ni med par yang //
analyzed: de la bshad par bya ste / ci ste de ni med par yang //
translated: then Nāgārjuna explains:🔽If it arises from those conditions

original: rkyen de dag las skye 'gyur na //
analyzed: rkyen de dag las skye 'gyur na //
translated: Even though it does not exist,

original: rkyen min las kyang 'bras bu ni //
analyzed: rkyen min las kyang 'bras bu ni //
translated: And from nonconditions, effects would arise.🔽

original: ci'i phyir zhe na skye mi 'gyur //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na skye mi 'gyur //
translated: And why would an effect not arise from that which is not a condition?

original: 'di la 'bras bu yod pa las rkyen dang rkyen ma yin pa'i bye brag tu 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'di la 'bras bu yod pa las rkyen dang rkyen ma yin pa'i bye brag tu 'gyur na /
translated: Here, the distinction between a condition and that which is not a condition is due to the existence of an effect.

original: 'bras bu de yang rkyen dang rkyen ma yin pa dag la med do //
analyzed: 'bras bu de yang rkyen dang rkyen ma yin pa dag la med do //
translated: But that effect does not exist in conditions or in that which is not a condition.

original: de dag la med bzhin du gal te rkyen rnams las 'bras bu skye na ni rkyen ma yin pa rnams las kyang ci'i phyir mi skye ste /
analyzed: de dag la med bzhin du gal te rkyen rnams las 'bras bu skye na ni rkyen ma yin pa rnams las kyang ci'i phyir mi skye ste /
translated: If an effect arises from conditions while it does not exist in them, then why would it not arise from that which is not a condition?

original: 'di ltar rkyen dang rkyen ma yin pa rnams la 'bras bu med par mtshungs pa las /
analyzed: 'di ltar rkyen dang rkyen ma yin pa rnams la 'bras bu med par mtshungs pa las /
translated: In this way, since the effect is the same in not existing in conditions and in that which is not a condition,

original: rkyen rnams las ni 'bras bu skye la rkyen ma yin pa rnams las ni mi skye ba zhes bya ba de ni yid la bsams pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: rkyen rnams las ni 'bras bu skye la rkyen ma yin pa rnams las ni mi skye ba zhes bya ba de ni yid la bsams pa tsam du zad do //
translated: the statement “An effect arises from conditions but not from that which is not a condition” is mere idle speculation.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu skye ba mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu skye ba mi 'thad de /
translated: Therefore, the arising of an effect is untenable.

original: 'bras bu skye ba med na rkyen 'grub par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: 'bras bu skye ba med na rkyen 'grub par ga la 'gyur /
translated: If the arising of an effect does not exist, how could conditions be established?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: rkyen rnams la 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa'i rkyen rnams las skye'o //
analyzed: rkyen rnams la 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa'i rkyen rnams las skye'o //
translated: Conditions are conditions of that which is existent and nonexistent.🔽

original: zhes ni mi smra'o //
analyzed: zhes ni mi smra'o //
translated: We do not say that effects arise from conditions that exist or do not exist.🔽We say that effects arise from conditions that are empty of intrinsic reality.

original: 'bras bu ni rkyen rnams las gyur pa'i rkyen gyi bdag nyid rkyen las byung ba yin no //🔽zhes smra'o // de lta yin ni snam bu ni rgyu spun gyi bdag nyid las byung ba yin pas /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rkyen rnams las gyur pa'i rkyen gyi bdag nyid rkyen las byung ba yin no // zhes smra'o // de lta yin ni snam bu ni rgyu spun gyi bdag nyid las byung ba yin pas /
translated: Since an effect arises from conditions, it is the identity of conditions.

original: rgyu spun dag ni snam bu'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: rgyu spun dag ni snam bu'i rkyen yin no //
translated: Since a cloth arises from thread as its cause, thread is the condition of a cloth.

original: bshad pa / 'bras bu rkyen las byung yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa / 'bras bu rkyen las byung yin no //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: An effect arises from conditions.

original: rkyen rnams rang las byung ma yin //🔽rang byung min las 'bras bu gang //
analyzed: rkyen rnams rang las byung ma yin // rang byung min las 'bras bu gang //
translated: Conditions do not arise from themselves.🔽How could an effect arise from conditions

original: de ni ji ltar rkyen las byung //
analyzed: de ni ji ltar rkyen las byung //
translated: That do not arise from themselves?

original: 'bras bu rkyen las gyur pa rkyen gyi bdag nyid las byung ba ma yin par brtags na /
analyzed: 'bras bu rkyen las gyur pa rkyen gyi bdag nyid las byung ba ma yin par brtags na /
translated: If you imagine that an effect arises from conditions, it arises from the identity of conditions.

original: rkyen de rnams ni rang las gyur pa ma yin /🔽rang nyid rab tu grub pa ma yin /🔽rang nyid bdag nyid ma yin /
analyzed: rkyen de rnams ni rang las gyur pa ma yin / rang nyid rab tu grub pa ma yin / rang nyid bdag nyid ma yin /
translated: Those conditions do not arise from themselves.🔽They are not established from themselves.🔽They are not their own identity.

original: rang las byung ba ma yin te ngo bo nyid med pa yin no //
analyzed: rang las byung ba ma yin te ngo bo nyid med pa yin no //
translated: They do not arise from themselves. They are essenceless.

original: rkyen rang las gyur pa ma yin pa /🔽rang nyid rab tu grub pa ma yin pa /🔽rang gi bdag nyid ma yin pa /
analyzed: rkyen rang las gyur pa ma yin pa / rang nyid rab tu grub pa ma yin pa / rang gi bdag nyid ma yin pa /
translated: They are not conditions that arise from themselves.🔽They are not established from themselves.🔽They are not their own nature.

original: rang las byung ba ma yin pa ngo bo nyid med pa de dag @168a * //
analyzed: rang las byung ba ma yin pa ngo bo nyid med pa de dag @168a * //
translated: They do not arise from themselves.🔽If you conceive that effects arise from them,

original: las 'bras bu byung bar rtog na ji ltar rkyen las byung bar nye bar brtags na /
analyzed: las 'bras bu byung bar rtog na ji ltar rkyen las byung bar nye bar brtags na /
translated: then how could you impute that they arise from conditions?

original: 'di ltar gal te rgyu spun dag rang nyid rab tu grub na ni rang las byung bar yang 'gyur bas /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te rgyu spun dag rang nyid rab tu grub na ni rang las byung bar yang 'gyur bas /
translated: In that case, if the threads that are the cause were established from themselves, they would arise from themselves.

original: des na snam bu rgyu spun dag las byung ba zhes bya ba de yang 'thad par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: des na snam bu rgyu spun dag las byung ba zhes bya ba de yang 'thad par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: Therefore, it would be tenable to say, “The cloth arises from the threads that are its cause.”

original: gang gi tshe rgyu dag rang nyid rab tu ma grub pa rang las byung ba ma yin pa ngo bo nyid med pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rgyu dag rang nyid rab tu ma grub pa rang las byung ba ma yin pa ngo bo nyid med pa ste /
translated: But when the cause is not established from itself, it does not arise from itself, and it has no essence.

original: rgyu dag las gyur pa rgyu dag gi bdag nyid rgyu las byung ba yin pa de'i tshe /🔽snam bu rgyu spun dag las byung ngo //
analyzed: rgyu dag las gyur pa rgyu dag gi bdag nyid rgyu las byung ba yin pa de'i tshe / snam bu rgyu spun dag las byung ngo //
translated: It arises from the cause, and it has the nature of the cause.

original: zhes bya ba de ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur /
translated: At that time, how could it be tenable to say,🔽“The cloth arises from the threads that are its cause”?

original: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang //
analyzed: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang //
translated: Master Āryadeva also says:

original: snam bu rgyu las grub yin na //
analyzed: snam bu rgyu las grub yin na //
translated: If cloth is established from causes,

original: rgyu yang gzhan las grub pa yin //
analyzed: rgyu yang gzhan las grub pa yin //
translated: causes are also established from other.

original: gang la rang las grub med pa //
analyzed: gang la rang las grub med pa //
translated: If something is not established from itself,

original: de yis gzhan ni ji ltar bskyed //🔽ces gsungs so //🔽de ltar gang gi phyir rkyen rnams rang nyid rab tu ma grub rang las byung ba ma yin zhing ngo bo nyid med pa /
analyzed: de yis gzhan ni ji ltar bskyed // ces gsungs so // de ltar gang gi phyir rkyen rnams rang nyid rab tu ma grub rang las byung ba ma yin zhing ngo bo nyid med pa /
translated: how could it produce another?

original: de'i phyir rkyen byung ma yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir rkyen byung ma yin /
translated: Thus, because conditions are not established from themselves, they do not arise from themselves, and they do not have intrinsic reality.

original: 'bras bu rkyen las byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu rkyen las byung ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, an effect does not arise from conditions.

original: de la 'di snyam du 'bras bu rkyen ma yin pa las byung bar sems na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du 'bras bu rkyen ma yin pa las byung bar sems na /
translated: If you think an effect arises from nonconditions,

original: bshad pa / rkyen min las byung 'bras bu ni //🔽yod min / gang gi tshe snam bu rgyu spun las byung bar mi 'thad pa de'i tshe snam bu rtsi rkyang las byung ngo //
analyzed: bshad pa / rkyen min las byung 'bras bu ni // yod min / gang gi tshe snam bu rgyu spun las byung bar mi 'thad pa de'i tshe snam bu rtsi rkyang las byung ngo //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: An effect that arises from nonconditions🔽does not exist.

original: zhes bya ba 'jig rten dang 'gal ba 'di ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'jig rten dang 'gal ba 'di ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur /
translated: When it is untenable that cloth arises from thread as its cause, then this statement that cloth arises from grass as its condition contradicts the world. How could that be tenable?

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu rkyen ma yin pa las byung ba yang med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu rkyen ma yin pa las byung ba yang med do //
translated: Therefore, an effect that arises from conditions and nonconditions does not exist.

original: smras pa / rkyen rnams ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / rkyen rnams ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Objection: Conditions surely exist.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: rkyen dang rkyen ma yin pa nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rkyen dang rkyen ma yin pa nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because conditions and nonconditions are ascertained.

original: 'di na rkyen dang rkyen ma yin pa nges pa mthong ste /🔽'bru dag las 'bru mar kho na 'byung gi mar mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di na rkyen dang rkyen ma yin pa nges pa mthong ste / 'bru dag las 'bru mar kho na 'byung gi mar mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Here conditions and nonconditions are seen to be ascertained.🔽Only oil comes from sesame seeds, not butter.🔽Only butter comes from milk, not oil.

original: zho las ni mar kho na 'byung gi 'bru mar mi 'byung ngo //🔽bye ma dag las ni de gnyi ga mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zho las ni mar kho na 'byung gi 'bru mar mi 'byung ngo // bye ma dag las ni de gnyi ga mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Neither comes from sand.

original: 'di ltar gang gi phyir 'di dag ni 'di'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi phyir 'di dag ni 'di'i rkyen yin no //
translated: Thus, because it is said, “These are its conditions,”

original: 'di dag ni 'di'i rkyen ma yin no zhes bya ba de yod pas de'i phyir rkyen 'grub po ;
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'di'i rkyen ma yin no zhes bya ba de yod pas de'i phyir rkyen 'grub po ;
translated: and “These are not its conditions,” therefore conditions are established.

original: / bshad pa /
analyzed: / bshad pa /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds:

original: 'bras bu med pas na //
analyzed: 'bras bu med pas na //
translated: Since effects do not exist,

original: rkyan min rkyen du ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: rkyan min rkyen du ga la 'gyur //
translated: How could nonconditions be conditions?

original: 'di la khyod kyis 'bru ma ral sogs pa 'bras bu 'byung ba dang / mi 'byung ba rkyen dang rkyen ma yin par nges pa'i rgyur smras pa ni 'bras bu skye ba mi 'thad do zhes sngar bstan zin te /
analyzed: 'di la khyod kyis 'bru ma ral sogs pa 'bras bu 'byung ba dang / mi 'byung ba rkyen dang rkyen ma yin par nges pa'i rgyur smras pa ni 'bras bu skye ba mi 'thad do zhes sngar bstan zin te /
translated: But it has already been demonstrated that the arising of the effect is untenable.

original: 'bras bu de med na @168b 'di dag ni 'di'i rkyen ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu de med na @168b 'di dag ni 'di'i rkyen ma yin no //
translated: If the effect does not exist, how could these be ascertained as the conditions and non-conditions of that?🔽How could it be tenable to say, “These are the conditions of that,”

original: 'di dag ni 'di'i rkyen yin no //🔽zhes bya ba de 'thad par gal 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'di'i rkyen yin no // zhes bya ba de 'thad par gal 'gyur /
translated: and “These are not the conditions of that”?

original: 'bras bu la ltos nas de gnyis su 'gyur na 'bras bu de yang med do //
analyzed: 'bras bu la ltos nas de gnyis su 'gyur na 'bras bu de yang med do //
translated: If they were to become those two in reliance on the effect, that effect would not exist.

original: 'bras bu med pas na rkyen ma yin pa dang rkyen du ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: 'bras bu med pas na rkyen ma yin pa dang rkyen du ga la 'gyur /
translated: Since the effect does not exist, how could they be non-conditions and conditions?

original: de ltar bas na 'bras bu yang mi 'thad la rkyen dang rkyen ma yin pa dag kyang med do //
analyzed: de ltar bas na 'bras bu yang mi 'thad la rkyen dang rkyen ma yin pa dag kyang med do //
translated: Thus, since the effect is untenable, conditions and non-conditions do not exist.

original: 'bras bu dang rkyen dang rkyen ma yin pa dag med pas skye bar brjod pa ni tha snyad tsam du grub po //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rkyen dang rkyen ma yin pa dag med pas skye bar brjod pa ni tha snyad tsam du grub po //
translated: Since the effect, conditions, and non-conditions do not exist, the statement “arising” is established as mere convention.

original: rkyen brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa dang po'o /
analyzed: rkyen brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa dang po'o /
translated: This is the first chapter, called Critique of Conditions.

original: // / smras pa /
analyzed: // / smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: khyed kyis skye ba med pa'i rigs pa 'di rjes su rab tu bstan pas kho bo'i yid stong pa nyid nyan pa la ngo mtshar snying po can du byas kyis /
analyzed: khyed kyis skye ba med pa'i rigs pa 'di rjes su rab tu bstan pas kho bo'i yid stong pa nyid nyan pa la ngo mtshar snying po can du byas kyis /
translated: Since you have taught this reasoning of nonarising, my mind is amazed and astonished to listen to emptiness.

original: ji ltar 'jig rten gyis mngon sum gyi 'gro ba dang 'ong ba mi 'thad pa de je smros shig / bshad pa /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten gyis mngon sum gyi 'gro ba dang 'ong ba mi 'thad pa de je smros shig / bshad pa /
translated: Therefore, please explain how it is untenable that going and coming are directly perceived in the world.

original: re zhig song la 'gro med de //
analyzed: re zhig song la 'gro med de //
translated: Response: First, there is no going where one has gone.

original: ma song ba la'ang 'gro ba med //
analyzed: ma song ba la'ang 'gro ba med //
translated: Nor is there going where one has not gone.

original: 'di la gal te 'gro ba zhig yod par gyur na /🔽de song ba la 'am /
analyzed: 'di la gal te 'gro ba zhig yod par gyur na / de song ba la 'am /
translated: If going exists,🔽it would exist where one has gone

original: ma song pa la yod par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: ma song pa la yod par 'gyur grang na /
translated: or where one has not gone.

original: de la re zhig song ba la ni 'gro ba med do //
analyzed: de la re zhig song ba la ni 'gro ba med do //
translated: First, there is no going where one has gone

original: 'gro ba'i bya ba 'das zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bya ba 'das zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the action of going has already ceased.

original: ma song ba la yang 'gro ba med de /
analyzed: ma song ba la yang 'gro ba med de /
translated: Nor is there going where one has not gone

original: 'gro ba'i bya ba ma brtsams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bya ba ma brtsams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the action of going has not yet begun.

original: smras pa / de ni de bzhin te /
analyzed: smras pa / de ni de bzhin te /
translated: Objection: That is so.

original: song ba dang ma song ba la 'gro ba med mod kyi /
analyzed: song ba dang ma song ba la 'gro ba med mod kyi /
translated: There is no going where one has gone or where one has not gone.

original: 'on kyang bgom pa la 'gro ba yod do //
analyzed: 'on kyang bgom pa la 'gro ba yod do //
translated: But going exists on that being gone over.🔽Nāgārjuna responds:

original: bshad pa // song dang ma song ma gtogs par //
analyzed: bshad pa // song dang ma song ma gtogs par //
translated: Apart from where one has gone and not gone,

original: bgom pa shes par mi 'gyur ro /
analyzed: bgom pa shes par mi 'gyur ro /
translated: going is not discerned.

original: song ba dang ma song ba ma gtogs par bgom pa ci zhig yod do //
analyzed: song ba dang ma song ba ma gtogs par bgom pa ci zhig yod do //
translated: Apart from where one has gone and not gone, what is the being gone over?

original: shes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not discerned.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it not discerned?

original: 'di ltar / shes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar / shes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not discerned.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This means

original: gzung du med pas te mi 'thad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzung du med pas te mi 'thad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: that it is not apprehended, and that is not tenable.

original: de ltar gang gi phyir song ba dang ma song ba ma gtogs par bsgom gzung du med pa kho na ste mi 'thad pa de'i phyir med pa kho na yin pas 'gro ba med do //
analyzed: de ltar gang gi phyir song ba dang ma song ba ma gtogs par bsgom gzung du med pa kho na ste mi 'thad pa de'i phyir med pa kho na yin pas 'gro ba med do //
translated: Thus, because apart from where one has gone and not gone, the being gone over is not apprehended, it is not tenable, and therefore it does not exist. Consequently, going does not exist.

original: smras pa / bgom pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / bgom pa kho na yin te /
translated: Objection: But the being gone over exists,

original: de la 'gro ba yod do //
analyzed: de la 'gro ba yod do //
translated: and going exists on it.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gang na g-yo ba nge  na 'gro //🔽de yang gang gi bgom pa la //
analyzed: gang na g-yo ba nge  na 'gro // de yang gang gi bgom pa la //
translated: Where there is movement, there is going.

original: g-yo ba song min ma song min //
analyzed: g-yo ba song min ma song min //
translated: And that movement is neither where one has gone nor where one has not gone.

original: de phyir bgom la 'gro ba yod /
analyzed: de phyir bgom la 'gro ba yod /
translated: Therefore, going exists on the being gone over.

original: 'di la khyod kyi 'gro ba med pa'i gtan tshigs su 'gro ba'i bya ba 'das zin pa dang ma brtsams pa bstan pa de'i phyir //🔽gang @169a * //
analyzed: 'di la khyod kyi 'gro ba med pa'i gtan tshigs su 'gro ba'i bya ba 'das zin pa dang ma brtsams pa bstan pa de'i phyir // gang @169a * //
translated: this is how it would go.

original: na g-yo ba de na 'gro //
analyzed: na g-yo ba de na 'gro //
translated: If you say, “Where there is movement, there is going,”

original: zhes bya ba 'di 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: this is how it would go.

original: de yang gang gi bgom pa la g-yo ba de dmigs pa na'o //
analyzed: de yang gang gi bgom pa la g-yo ba de dmigs pa na'o //
translated: If you say, “Where there is movement, there is going,”🔽this is how it would go.🔽If you say, “Where there is movement, there is going,”🔽this is how it would go.🔽If you say, “Where there is movement, there is going,”🔽this is how it would go.

original: gang gi zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba po'i zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang gi zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba po'i zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If you say, “Where there is movement, there is going,”🔽this is how it would go.

original: de ltar gang gi phyir g-yo ba ni song ba la med /
analyzed: de ltar gang gi phyir g-yo ba ni song ba la med /
translated: If you say, “Where there is movement, there is going,”🔽this is how it would go.🔽If you say, “Where there is movement, there is going,”🔽this is how it would go.🔽If you say, “Where there is movement, there is going,”🔽this is how it would go.

original: ma song ba la yang med kyi bgom pa la yod pa de'i phyir gang na g-yo ba yod pa de na 'gro ba yod do //
analyzed: ma song ba la yang med kyi bgom pa la yod pa de'i phyir gang na g-yo ba yod pa de na 'gro ba yod do //
translated: If you say, “Where there is movement, there is going,”🔽this is how it would go.🔽If you say, “Where there is movement, there is going,”

original: de ltar 'gro ba yod pas bgom pa la 'gro ba yod do //
analyzed: de ltar 'gro ba yod pas bgom pa la 'gro ba yod do //
translated: this is how it would go.

original: bshad pa / bgom la 'gro ba yod par ni //
analyzed: bshad pa / bgom la 'gro ba yod par ni //
translated: If you say, “Where there is movement, there is going,”

original: ji lta bur na 'thad par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji lta bur na 'thad par 'gyur /
translated: this is how it would go.

original: gang tshe 'gro ba med pa yi /🔽bgom pa 'thad pa med phyir ro //
analyzed: gang tshe 'gro ba med pa yi /🔽bgom pa 'thad pa med phyir ro //
translated: If you say, “Where there is movement, there is going,”🔽this is how it would go.🔽If you say, “Where there is movement, there is going,”🔽this is how it would go.🔽If you say, “Where there is movement, there is going,”🔽this is how it would go.🔽If you say, “Where there is movement, there is going,”🔽this is how it would go.🔽If you say, “Where there is movement, there is going,”🔽this is how it would go.🔽If you say, “Where there is movement, there is going,”🔽this is how it would go.

original: 'di la khyod 'gro ba dang ldan pas bgom par 'dod la de la 'gro ba yod do zhes zer na 'di la 'gro ba'i bya ba ni gcig tu zad la /
analyzed: 'di la khyod 'gro ba dang ldan pas bgom par 'dod la de la 'gro ba yod do zhes zer na 'di la 'gro ba'i bya ba ni gcig tu zad la /
translated: Here, since you assert that going exists on that being gone over because it possesses going, then in this regard the action of going is exhausted.

original: de ni bgom pa zhes bya ba de la nye bar sbyar bas de'i phyir 'gro ba zhes bya ba de ni 'gro ba'i bya ba dang bral bas 'gro ba med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni bgom pa zhes bya ba de la nye bar sbyar bas de'i phyir 'gro ba zhes bya ba de ni 'gro ba'i bya ba dang bral bas 'gro ba med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is applied to that called “that being gone over,” therefore that called “going” is devoid of the action of going, and so it follows that it would not go.

original: de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: But that is untenable.

original: 'di ltar 'gro ba med par ji ltar 'gro bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'gro ba med par ji ltar 'gro bar 'gyur /
translated: Because how could it go without going?

original: de la gang gi tshe 'gro ba zhes bya ba de 'gro ba'i bya ba dang bral bas mi 'thad pas de'i tshe bgom pa la 'gro ba yod par ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur /
analyzed: de la gang gi tshe 'gro ba zhes bya ba de 'gro ba'i bya ba dang bral bas mi 'thad pas de'i tshe bgom pa la 'gro ba yod par ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur /
translated: Since it is untenable that that called “going” is devoid of the action of going, then how could it be tenable that going exists on that being gone over?

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,🔽Nāgārjuna responds:

original: bshad pa / gang gi bgom la 'gro yod pa //🔽de yi bgom la 'gro med par //
analyzed: bshad pa / gang gi bgom la 'gro yod pa // de yi bgom la 'gro med par //
translated: If going exists on that being gone over,🔽then it follows that going would not exist

original: thal bar 'gyur te gang gi phyir //
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur te gang gi phyir //
translated: on that being gone over,

original: bgom pa khong du chud phyir ro //
analyzed: bgom pa khong du chud phyir ro //
translated: because going is understood on that being gone over.

original: gang gi blo la skyon der gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pas 'gro ba zhes bya ba de 'gro ba dang ldan pas 'gro bar sems pa de'i yang 'gro ba 'gro ba zhes bya ba de la nye bar sbyar ba byas pas bgom pa ni 'gro ba med
analyzed: gang gi blo la skyon der gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pas 'gro ba zhes bya ba de 'gro ba dang ldan pas 'gro bar sems pa de'i yang 'gro ba 'gro ba zhes bya ba de la nye bar sbyar ba byas pas bgom pa ni 'gro ba med
translated: If you think it is not suitable for that error to occur in your mind, then for you who think that one who is called a goer goes because of possessing going, going is applied to that called a goer.🔽

original: pa 'gro ba dang bral ba grong dang grong khyer lta bur thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: pa 'gro ba dang bral ba grong dang grong khyer lta bur thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: But if you think it is not suitable for that error to arise, then if you think that which is called going possesses going, then also in that which is called going, going, since it is applied, it follows that that being gone over would be without going, that is, devoid of going, like a town or city.

original: dper na grong 'gro zhes bya ba de bzhin du bgom pa yang thal bar 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod de /🔽de'i phyir bgom pa la 'gro ba yod do //
analyzed: dper na grong 'gro zhes bya ba de bzhin du bgom pa yang thal bar 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod de / de'i phyir bgom pa la 'gro ba yod do //
translated: For example, just as it is said, “A town goes,” so it follows that the being gone over would be like that. But that also is unacceptable.

original: zhes bya ba de ji ltar yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de ji ltar yang mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable in any way to say, “Going exists on that being gone over.”

original: ci ste skyon der gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pas 'gro zhes bya ba de dang bgom pa zhes bya ba de gnyis ka yang 'gro ba dang ldan par sems na /
analyzed: ci ste skyon der gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pas 'gro zhes bya ba de dang bgom pa zhes bya ba de gnyis ka yang 'gro ba dang ldan par sems na /
translated: But if you think it is not suitable for that error to arise, and you think that both that which is called going and that which is called the being gone over possess going,

original: de la skyon 'di yod de /
analyzed: de la skyon 'di yod de /
translated: then this error arises.🔽Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bshad pa // bgom la 'gro ba yod na ni //
analyzed: bshad pa // bgom la 'gro ba yod na ni //
translated: If going exists on that being gone over,

original: 'gro ba gnyis su thal 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'gro ba gnyis su thal 'gyur te //
translated: going would be twofold.

original: gang gis bgom pa de dang ni //
analyzed: gang gis bgom pa de dang ni //
translated: And that being gone over,

original: de la 'gro ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'gro ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: and the going on it.

original: bgom pa 'gro ba dang ldan @169b pa la 'gro bar brtags na /
analyzed: bgom pa 'gro ba dang ldan @169b pa la 'gro bar brtags na /
translated: If you imagine that the path being gone over has going,

original: 'gro ba gnyis su thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gro ba gnyis su thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then the error of two goings would ensue.

original: 'gro ba dang ldan pas bgom pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ba dang / de la 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i 'gro ba gnyis par brtag pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang ldan pas bgom pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ba dang / de la 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i 'gro ba gnyis par brtag pa'o //
translated: The path being gone over would be called “that upon which one goes” because it has going, and the second going would be called “going on it.”

original: 'gro ba gnyis su ni mi 'dod pas de'i phyir de yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'gro ba gnyis su ni mi 'dod pas de'i phyir de yang mi 'thad do //
translated: But since two goings are not accepted, therefore that is untenable.

original: de la skyon gzhan 'di yang yod do //
analyzed: de la skyon gzhan 'di yang yod do //
translated: Moreover, this error would ensue.🔽Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bshad pa // 'gro ba gnyis su thal 'gyur na //
analyzed: bshad pa // 'gro ba gnyis su thal 'gyur na //
translated: If two goings ensue,

original: 'gro ba po yang gnyis su 'gyur //
analyzed: 'gro ba po yang gnyis su 'gyur //
translated: then the goer would also be twofold.

original: gang phyir 'gro po med par ni //
analyzed: gang phyir 'gro po med par ni //
translated: Because without a goer,

original: 'gro ba 'thad par mi 'gyur phyir //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'thad par mi 'gyur phyir //
translated: going is not tenable.

original: 'gro ba gnyis su thal bar 'gyur na 'gro ba po yang gnyis su thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gro ba gnyis su thal bar 'gyur na 'gro ba po yang gnyis su thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If two goings ensue, then the error of two goers would ensue.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽gang phyir 'gro po med par ni //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / gang phyir 'gro po med par ni //
translated: Why?🔽Because without a goer,

original: 'gro ba 'thad par mi 'gyur phyir //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'thad par mi 'gyur phyir //
translated: going is not tenable.

original: gang gi phyir 'gro ba po yod na 'gro ba yang yod kyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'gro ba po yod na 'gro ba yang yod kyi /
translated: Because if the goer exists, then going also exists.

original: 'gro ba po spangs na 'gro ba med pa de'i phyir 'gro ba gnyis su thal bar 'gyur na 'gro ba po yang gnyis su thal bar 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod de /
analyzed: 'gro ba po spangs na 'gro ba med pa de'i phyir 'gro ba gnyis su thal bar 'gyur na 'gro ba po yang gnyis su thal bar 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod de /
translated: But if the goer is relinquished, then going does not exist. Therefore, since it follows that going would be twofold, it also follows that the goer would be twofold. But that is unacceptable.

original: de'i phyir de ltar skyon du ma yod pas bgom pa la 'gro ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar skyon du ma yod pas bgom pa la 'gro ba med pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, since in this way many errors ensue, going does not exist on that being gone over.

original: gang gi phyir song ba dang ma song ba dang bgom pa la 'gro ba mi 'thad pa de'i phyir 'gro ba med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir song ba dang ma song ba dang bgom pa la 'gro ba mi 'thad pa de'i phyir 'gro ba med pa kho na'o //
translated: Because going is untenable on that gone over, on that not yet gone over, and on that being gone over, therefore going does not exist.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: song ba dang ma song ba dang bgom pa la 'gro ba mi 'thad du zin kyang /
analyzed: song ba dang ma song ba dang bgom pa la 'gro ba mi 'thad du zin kyang /
translated: Even though it is untenable that going exists on that gone over, on that not yet gone over, and on that being gone over,

original: 'gro ba po la brten pa'i 'gro ba yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'gro ba po la brten pa'i 'gro ba yod pa nyid de /
translated: going that is based on the goer does exist.

original: 'di ltar 'gro ba po la 'gro ba dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'gro ba po la 'gro ba dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because going is observed in dependence on the goer.🔽Nāgārjuna responds:

original: bshad pa / gal te 'gro po med gyur na //
analyzed: bshad pa / gal te 'gro po med gyur na //
translated: If the goer does not exist,

original: 'gro ba 'thad par mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'thad par mi 'gyur te //
translated: Going is not tenable.

original: 'gro po med par gyur na 'gro ba 'thad par mi 'gyur bar ni sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: 'gro po med par gyur na 'gro ba 'thad par mi 'gyur bar ni sngar bstan zin to //
translated: It has been explained earlier that if the goer does not exist, going is not tenable.

original: gal te 'gro ba po med par gyur na 'gro ba 'thad par mi 'gyur na gang 'gro ba po la brten cing 'gro ba po la 'jug pa'i 'gro ba de gang yin /
