analyzed: gal te 'gro ba po med par gyur na 'gro ba 'thad par mi 'gyur na gang 'gro ba po la brten cing 'gro ba po la 'jug pa'i 'gro ba de gang yin /
translated: If the goer does not exist, going is not tenable, then what is that going that is dependent on the goer and engages the goer?

original: smras pa / gang 'gro ba po la 'jug pa'i 'gro ba gzhan 'gro ba po las tha dad du gyur pa yod do zhes ni mi smra'o //
analyzed: smras pa / gang 'gro ba po la 'jug pa'i 'gro ba gzhan 'gro ba po las tha dad du gyur pa yod do zhes ni mi smra'o //
translated: Objection: I do not say that there is another going that is different from the goer and engages the goer.

original: 'di ltar 'gro ba gang dang ldan pas 'gro ba po zhes bya bar 'gyur ba de yod do zhes smra'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'gro ba gang dang ldan pas 'gro ba po zhes bya bar 'gyur ba de yod do zhes smra'o //
translated: I say that the goer exists in virtue of possessing going.

original: 'dir bshad pa //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa //
translated: Here Nāgārjuna explains:

original: 'gro ba med na 'gro ba po //
analyzed: 'gro ba med na 'gro ba po //
translated: If going does not exist,

original: yod pa nyid du ga la 'gyur /🔽gal te rten cung zad kyang med pa'i 'gro ba zhig rab tu grub par gyur na ni de dang 'gro ba po'am /
analyzed: yod pa nyid du ga la 'gyur / gal te rten cung zad kyang med pa'i 'gro ba zhig rab tu grub par gyur na ni de dang 'gro ba po'am /
translated: how could the goer exist?

original: 'gro ba po ma yin pa ldan par yang 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: 'gro ba po ma yin pa ldan par yang 'gyur grang na /
translated: If going that is not dependent on anything were established, then it would be connected with the goer or the nongoer.

original: tha dad par gyur ba rten med pa'i @170a * //
analyzed: tha dad par gyur ba rten med pa'i @170a * //
translated: But going that is not dependent on anything is not established.

original: 'gro ba ni 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: 'gro ba ni 'ga' yang med de /
translated: Going does not exist at all.

original: des na tha dad par grub pa'i 'gro ba med par khyod kyis 'gro ba ldan pas 'gro ba por 'gyur ba yod pa nyid du ga la 'gyur 'gro ba po med na yang su yi 'gro bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na tha dad par grub pa'i 'gro ba med par khyod kyis 'gro ba ldan pas 'gro ba por 'gyur ba yod pa nyid du ga la 'gyur 'gro ba po med na yang su yi 'gro bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, since going that is established as distinct does not exist, how could the goer exist as one who possesses going? But if the goer does not exist, whose going would it be?

original: de bas na 'gro ba med do //
analyzed: de bas na 'gro ba med do //
translated: Therefore, going does not exist.

original: smras pa / spros pa 'dis ci bya /🔽gang la ltos nas 'gro'o //
analyzed: smras pa / spros pa 'dis ci bya / gang la ltos nas 'gro'o //
translated: Objection: What is the point of this elaboration?

original: zhes bya ba de 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de 'gro ba yin no //
translated: That which is called “going” exists in dependence on the goer.🔽That which is called “going” exists in dependence on the goer.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gal te 'gro po zhes bya ba de nyid rab tu grub par gyur na ni des na 'gro ba yang rab tu 'grub par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: gal te 'gro po zhes bya ba de nyid rab tu grub par gyur na ni des na 'gro ba yang rab tu 'grub par 'gyur grang na /
translated: If the so-called goer were established, then going would be established.

original: de rab tu mi 'grub pas 'gro ba rab tu 'grub par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de rab tu mi 'grub pas 'gro ba rab tu 'grub par ga la 'gyur /
translated: But since that is not established, how could going be established?

original: ji ltar zhe na /🔽'di la 'gro ba zhig yod na 'gro ba po 'am /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / 'di la 'gro ba zhig yod na 'gro ba po 'am /
translated: How so?

original: 'gro ba po ma yin pa 'gro grang na /
analyzed: 'gro ba po ma yin pa 'gro grang na /
translated: If going exists here, then either the goer goes or the nongoer goes.

original: 'dir bshad pa /🔽re zhig 'gro po mi 'gro ste //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / re zhig 'gro po mi 'gro ste //
translated: Here we say:🔽The goer does not go.

original: 'gro ba po min 'gro po min //
analyzed: 'gro ba po min 'gro po min //
translated: The nongoer does not go.

original: 'gro po 'gro po min las gzhan //
analyzed: 'gro po 'gro po min las gzhan //
translated: Apart from the goer and the nongoer,

original: gsum pa gang zhig 'gro bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gsum pa gang zhig 'gro bar 'gyur //
translated: What third party could there be that goes?

original: de bas na 'gro'o zhes bya ba nyid mi 'grub po //
analyzed: de bas na 'gro'o zhes bya ba nyid mi 'grub po //
translated: Therefore, “going” is not established.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is untenable.

original: ji ltar zhe na ;
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na ;
translated: How is it untenable?🔽First, how could it be tenable

original: re zhig 'gro po 'gro'o zhes //🔽ji ltar 'thad pa nyid du 'gyur //🔽'gro ba med na 'gro ba po //
analyzed: re zhig 'gro po 'gro'o zhes // ji ltar 'thad pa nyid du 'gyur // 'gro ba med na 'gro ba po //
translated: To say that the goer goes?🔽If there is no going,

original: nam yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //🔽'di la 'gro ba po 'gro'o //
analyzed: nam yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro // 'di la 'gro ba po 'gro'o //
translated: The goer is never tenable.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here, in the statement “The goer goes,”🔽since the single action of going is applied to that called “going,”

original: 'gro ba'i bya ba gcig pu zhig yod pa de ni 'gro zhes bya ba de la nye bar sbyar bas des na 'gro ba po ni 'gro ba dang bral te /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bya ba gcig pu zhig yod pa de ni 'gro zhes bya ba de la nye bar sbyar bas des na 'gro ba po ni 'gro ba dang bral te /
translated: therefore the goer would be devoid of going.

original: gub ta dang tsee tra bzhin du ming tsam du gyur par thal bar 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod do //
analyzed: gub ta dang tsee tra bzhin du ming tsam du gyur par thal bar 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod do //
translated: Since it would follow that he would be a mere name, like Gupta and Citra, that also is unacceptable.

original: de'i tshe gang gi tshe 'gro ba med na 'gro ba po nam yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe 'gro ba po 'gro'i zhes bya ba de ji ltar 'thad pa nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshe gang gi tshe 'gro ba med na 'gro ba po nam yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe 'gro ba po 'gro'i zhes bya ba de ji ltar 'thad pa nyid du 'gyur /
translated: But when going does not exist, then at that time, since the goer is never tenable, how could it be tenable to say “the goer goes”?

original: yang gzhan yang bshad pa /🔽gang gi phyogs la 'gro ba po //
analyzed: yang gzhan yang bshad pa / gang gi phyogs la 'gro ba po //
translated: Moreover, Nāgārjuna explains:🔽In the system where the goer

original: 'gro ba de la 'gro med pa'i //
analyzed: 'gro ba de la 'gro med pa'i //
translated: goes, it follows that the goer

original: 'gro po yin par thal 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'gro po yin par thal 'gyur te //
translated: would be without going,

original: 'gro po 'gro bar 'dod phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro po 'gro bar 'dod phyir ro //
translated: because the goer is asserted to go.

original: gang gi phyogs la skyon der gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pas 'gro ba po 'gro ba dang ldan pas 'gro po snyam pa de la yang 'gro ba po zhes bya ba de 'gro ba'i bya ba nye bar sbyar ba byas pas 'gro ba med pa'i 'gro ba🔽po yin par thal bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyogs la skyon der gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pas 'gro ba po 'gro ba dang ldan pas 'gro po snyam pa de la yang 'gro ba po zhes bya ba de 'gro ba'i bya ba nye bar sbyar ba byas pas 'gro ba med pa'i 'gro ba po yin par thal bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: In the system where it is not suitable for that error to arise, the goer is asserted to go because the goer possesses going. But in that system, it follows that the so-called goer would be without going because the goer is engaged in the act of going.🔽It follows that the goer would go without going,

original: 'gro ba po 'gro bar 'dod pa'i phyir 'gro ba med par 'gro'o zhes bya ba der thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba po 'gro bar 'dod pa'i phyir 'gro ba med par 'gro'o zhes bya ba der thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because the goer is asserted to go.

original: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de ni mi 'thad de /
translated: That is untenable.

original: 'gro'o zhes bya ba de /
analyzed: 'gro'o zhes bya ba de /
translated: How could it be said that “he goes”

original: 'gro ba med par ji ltar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba med par ji ltar 'gyur ro //
translated: if he is not going?

original: ci ste @170b skyon der gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pas 'gro ba po zhes bya ba dang / 'gro ba po zhes bya ba de gnyi ga yang 'gro ba dang ldan no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste @170b skyon der gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pas 'gro ba po zhes bya ba dang / 'gro ba po zhes bya ba de gnyi ga yang 'gro ba dang ldan no zhe na /
translated: But if you think that it is not tenable that this error occurs, and that the goer and the nongoer both possess going,

original: de la yang skyon 'di yod de /
analyzed: de la yang skyon 'di yod de /
translated: then this error would also occur for you.🔽Nāgārjuna responds:

original: bshad pa / gal te 'gro po 'gro 'gyur na //
analyzed: bshad pa / gal te 'gro po 'gro 'gyur na //
translated: If the goer were to go,

original: 'gro ba gnyis su thal 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'gro ba gnyis su thal 'gyur te //
translated: it would follow that there would be two goings:🔽That by which the goer is manifest

original: gang gis 'gro por mngon pa dang // 'gro por gyur nas gang 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis 'gro por mngon pa dang // 'gro por gyur nas gang 'gro ba'o //
translated: and the going of the one who is the goer.

original: 'gro ba po 'gro ba dang ldan pa la 'gro bar brtags na 'gro ba gnyis su thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gro ba po 'gro ba dang ldan pa la 'gro bar brtags na 'gro ba gnyis su thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If you imagine that the goer who possesses going goes, it follows that there would be two goings:

original: 'gro ba gang dag ldan pas 'gro ba po zhes bya bar mngon pa dang / de 'gro ba gang la ltos nas 'gro'o zhes bya bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba gang dag ldan pas 'gro ba po zhes bya bar mngon pa dang / de 'gro ba gang la ltos nas 'gro'o zhes bya bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: the going by means of which the goer is manifest and the going in dependence on which it is said, “He goes.”

original: 'gro ba gnyis su ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'gro ba gnyis su ni mi 'thad de /
translated: But it is untenable that there are two goings.

original: 'gro ba gnyis su thal bar gyur na snga ma bzhin du 'gro ba po yang gnyis su thal bar 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod de de lta bas 'gro ba po 'gro'o zhes bya ba de mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'gro ba gnyis su thal bar gyur na snga ma bzhin du 'gro ba po yang gnyis su thal bar 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod de de lta bas 'gro ba po 'gro'o zhes bya ba de mi 'thad do //
translated: If it follows that the goer is twofold, then as before, it follows that the goer is twofold. But that is unacceptable. Therefore it is not tenable to say “The goer goes.”

original: da ni 'gro ba po ma yin pa yang mi 'gro ste /🔽gang gi tshe 'gro ba po 'gro po zhes bya ba de mi 'thad pa de tshe 'gro ba po ma yin pa 'gro ba dang bral ba'ang 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: da ni 'gro ba po ma yin pa yang mi 'gro ste / gang gi tshe 'gro ba po 'gro po zhes bya ba de mi 'thad pa de tshe 'gro ba po ma yin pa 'gro ba dang bral ba'ang 'gro ba'o //
translated: Now, one who is not a goer also does not go.

original: zhes bya ba de ji ltar 'thad pa nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de ji ltar 'thad pa nyid du 'gyur /
translated: When it is not tenable to say “The goer goes,” then how could it be tenable to say “One who is not a goer goes”?

original: de lta bas na 'gro ba po ma yin pa yang mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'gro ba po ma yin pa yang mi 'gro'o //
translated: Therefore it is not tenable to say “One who is not a goer goes.”

original: de la 'di snyam du 'gro ba po yin pa dang 'gro ba po ma yin pa 'gro bar sems na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du 'gro ba po yin pa dang 'gro ba po ma yin pa 'gro bar sems na /
translated: But if you think that one who is a goer and one who is not a goer go,🔽then Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / 'gro po 'gro po min las gzhan //
analyzed: bshad pa / 'gro po 'gro po min las gzhan //
translated: Apart from the goer and the nongoer,

original: gsum po gang zhig 'gro bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gsum po gang zhig 'gro bar 'gyur //
translated: What third thing goes?

original: 'gro ba po dang 'gro ba po ma yin pa las gzhan pa gsum pa /
analyzed: 'gro ba po dang 'gro ba po ma yin pa las gzhan pa gsum pa /
translated: Apart from the goer and the nongoer,🔽what third thing goes?

original: 'gro ba po yin pa dang 'gro ba po ma yin pa gang 'gro'o zhes bya bar 'thad pa zhig gang zhig yin /
analyzed: 'gro ba po yin pa dang 'gro ba po ma yin pa gang 'gro'o zhes bya bar 'thad pa zhig gang zhig yin /
translated: goer or one who is not an goer goes?

original: de lta bas na med pa'i kho na'i phyir 'gro ba po ma yin pa dang 'gro ba po ma yin pa yang mi 'gro'o //🔽de ltar gang gi phyir 'gro ba po dang / 'gro ba po ma yin pa dang / 'gro ba po yin pa dang / 'gro ba po ma yin pa 'gro'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na med pa'i kho na'i phyir 'gro ba po ma yin pa dang 'gro ba po ma yin pa yang mi 'gro'o // de ltar gang gi phyir 'gro ba po dang / 'gro ba po ma yin pa dang / 'gro ba po yin pa dang / 'gro ba po ma yin pa 'gro'o //
translated: Therefore, because they do not exist, one who is not an goer and one who is not a non-goer do not go.

original: zhes bya ba de mi 'thad pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de mi 'thad pa de'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because it is not tenable to say that one who is an goer, one who is not an goer, one who is both an goer and a non-goer, and one who is neither an goer nor a non-goer goes,🔽therefore

original: 'gro'o zhes bya ba de rab tu mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: 'gro'o zhes bya ba de rab tu mi 'grub bo //
translated: it is not established that “he goes.”

original: 'gro'o zhes bya ba de med na 'gro ba rab tu 'grub par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: 'gro'o zhes bya ba de med na 'gro ba rab tu 'grub par ga la 'gyur /
translated: If “he goes” is not established, how could “going” be established?

original: 'dir smras pa /🔽'gro ba po dang ; 'gro ba po yin pa dang / 'gro ba po ma yin pa 'gro'o //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / 'gro ba po dang ; 'gro ba po yin pa dang / 'gro ba po ma yin pa 'gro'o //
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: zhes bya ba mi 'thad du zin kyang /🔽gub ta 'gro'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba mi 'thad du zin kyang / gub ta 'gro'o //
translated: although it is not tenable to say that one who is an goer, one who is not an goer, and one who is both an goer and a non-goer goes,🔽nevertheless,🔽it is tenable to say that Gupta goes,

original: tsee tra 'gro'o zhes bya ba de la 'gro'o zhes bya ba 'thad do //
analyzed: tsee tra 'gro'o zhes bya ba de la 'gro'o zhes bya ba 'thad do //
translated: and Cetrī goes.

original: bshad pa / des ni ci yang smras pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa / des ni ci yang smras pa ma yin te /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: He does not say anything at all.

original: gub ta la brten na ci gub ta 'gro ba por gyur nas 'gro'am /
analyzed: gub ta la brten na ci gub ta 'gro ba por gyur nas 'gro'am /
translated: If one relies on a stick, does the stick, having become a goer, go?

original: @171a * // 'on te 'gro ba po ma yin 'gro'am /
analyzed: @171a * // 'on te 'gro ba po ma yin 'gro'am /
translated: Or does the stick, not being a goer, go?

original: 'on te 'gro ba po yin pa dang / 'gro ba po ma yin pa zhig 'gro zhes bya ba 'di gsal ba ma byas sam /
analyzed: 'on te 'gro ba po yin pa dang / 'gro ba po ma yin pa zhig 'gro zhes bya ba 'di gsal ba ma byas sam /
translated: Or does that which is a goer and that which is not a goer go?

original: de lta bas na 'di ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni gyi na'o //
translated: Thus this is nonsense.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: 'gro ba ni yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba ni yod pa kho na'o //
translated: Going surely exists.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'gro ba'i bya ba rtsom pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bya ba rtsom pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the activity of going is initiated.

original: 'di la song ba dang ma song ba dang bgom pa la 'gro ba yod do //
analyzed: 'di la song ba dang ma song ba dang bgom pa la 'gro ba yod do //
translated: Here, one might say, “Going exists where one has gone, where one has not gone, and on that being gone over.”

original: zhes bya ba de brjod par mi nus su zin kyang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de brjod par mi nus su zin kyang /
translated: Even though that cannot be expressed,

original: gang gi tshe sdod pa las 'gro ba de'i tshe na sdod pa'i byas pa 'das ma thag tu 'gro ba'i bya ba 'jug par 'gyur bas de lta bas na bya ba rtsom pa yod pas 'gro ba yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sdod pa las 'gro ba de'i tshe na sdod pa'i byas pa 'das ma thag tu 'gro ba'i bya ba 'jug par 'gyur bas de lta bas na bya ba rtsom pa yod pas 'gro ba yod pa kho na'o //
translated: when going is initiated from resting, at that time the activity of going engages immediately after the activity of resting has ceased. Thus, because the activity is initiated, going surely exists.

original: bshad pa / ci khyod ming gzhan du bsgyur bas sems rmongs nas rang gi bu ngo mi shes sam /🔽khyod don de nyid la blo phyi mas brjod pa gzhan gyis brjod ko 'gro ba'i bya ba rtsom pa yod par yongs su brtag pa gang yin pa de yang song ba 'am ma song ba 'am /
analyzed: bshad pa / ci khyod ming gzhan du bsgyur bas sems rmongs nas rang gi bu ngo mi shes sam / khyod don de nyid la blo phyi mas brjod pa gzhan gyis brjod ko 'gro ba'i bya ba rtsom pa yod par yongs su brtag pa gang yin pa de yang song ba 'am ma song ba 'am /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: Are you so confused by the change in names that you do not recognize your own son?🔽You have imagined that the action of going exists in the path gone over, the path not gone over, or the path being gone over.

original: bgom pa la yod grang na /
analyzed: bgom pa la yod grang na /
translated: Now, is that action of going in that which has been gone over, in that not yet gone over, or in that being gone over?

original: de la gtan tshigs sngar bstan pa dag nyid kyis bshad pa /
analyzed: de la gtan tshigs sngar bstan pa dag nyid kyis bshad pa /
translated: The reason for this has been explained above.

original: song la 'gro ba'i rtsom med de //
analyzed: song la 'gro ba'i rtsom med de //
translated: There is no beginning of going where one has gone.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'gro ba'i bya ba 'das zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bya ba 'das zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the action of going has already ceased.

original: ma song ba la'ang 'gro rtsom med //
analyzed: ma song ba la'ang 'gro rtsom med //
translated: There is no beginning of going where one has not yet gone.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'gro ba'i bya ba ma brtsams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bya ba ma brtsams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the action of going has not yet begun.

original: bgom la rtsom pa yod min na //
analyzed: bgom la rtsom pa yod min na //
translated: There is no beginning of going where one is going.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bgom pa med pa'i phyir dang / 'gro ba gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / 'gro ba po gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bgom pa med pa'i phyir dang / 'gro ba gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / 'gro ba po gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no path on which one goes, because it would follow that going would be twofold, and because it would follow that the goer would be twofold.

original: gang du 'gro ba rtsom par byed //
analyzed: gang du 'gro ba rtsom par byed //
translated: Where does one begin to go?

original: ces bya ba'i lan de pa smros shig / de lta bas na 'gro ba'i rtsom pa med do //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i lan de pa smros shig / de lta bas na 'gro ba'i rtsom pa med do //
translated: You must respond to that! Thus the beginning of going does not exist.

original: rtsom pa med na 'gro ba yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: rtsom pa med na 'gro ba yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: If the beginning of going does not exist, how could going exist?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say this:

original: 'gro ba ni yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba ni yod pa kho na'o //
translated: Going surely exists.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bgom pa dang song ba dang ma song ba yod pa'i phyir te /🔽gang gi phyir 'gro ba dang ldan pa'i phyir bgom pa zhes bya ba yin la /
analyzed: bgom pa dang song ba dang ma song ba yod pa'i phyir te / gang gi phyir 'gro ba dang ldan pa'i phyir bgom pa zhes bya ba yin la /
translated: Because the path on which one goes, that on which one has gone, and that on which one has not yet gone exist.🔽Because it possesses going, it is called “the path on which one goes.”

original: 'gro ba mthar phyin pa ni song ba zhes bya ba yin /
analyzed: 'gro ba mthar phyin pa ni song ba zhes bya ba yin /
translated: That on which one has gone is called “that on which one has gone” because one has completed going there.

original: 'gro ba'i bya ba ma song ba la ltos nas ma song ba zhes bya ba yin pas na de lta bas na bgom pa dang song ba dang / ma song ba yod pa'i phyir 'gro ba yod do //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bya ba ma song ba la ltos nas ma song ba zhes bya ba yin pas na de lta bas na bgom pa dang song ba dang / ma song ba yod pa'i phyir 'gro ba yod do //
translated: That on which one has not yet gone is called “that on which one has not yet gone” in dependence on the activity of going. Thus because the path on which one goes, that on which one has gone, and that on which one has not yet gone exist, going exists.

original: bshad pa / ci khyed nam mkha' 'di la ldang bar bskyod dam /
analyzed: bshad pa / ci khyed nam mkha' 'di la ldang bar bskyod dam /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: Do you move up into this space?

original: gang gi tshe //
analyzed: gang gi tshe //
translated: When🔽the beginning of going

original: 'gro ba rtsom pa'i snga rol na //
analyzed: 'gro ba rtsom pa'i snga rol na //
translated: is not in the beginning of going,

original: gang du 'gro ba rtsom 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gang du 'gro ba rtsom 'gyur ba //
translated: where does the beginning of going commence?

original: @171b bgom pa med cing sod ba med //
analyzed: @171b bgom pa med cing sod ba med //
translated: There is no path being traversed and no traversed.

original: 'di la 'gro ba rtsom pa'i snga rol sdod par gyur pa na gang du 'gro ba rtsom par 'gyur ba'i bgom pa yang med cing /
analyzed: 'di la 'gro ba rtsom pa'i snga rol sdod par gyur pa na gang du 'gro ba rtsom par 'gyur ba'i bgom pa yang med cing /
translated: Here, when one who is standing still prior to the beginning of going does not yet have a path being traversed where the beginning of going would commence,

original: song ba yang med do //🔽'gro ba rtsom pa med na bgom pa 'gro ba dang ldan par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: song ba yang med do // 'gro ba rtsom pa med na bgom pa 'gro ba dang ldan par ga la 'gyur /
translated: nor does one have that which has been traversed.🔽If the beginning of going does not exist, how could there be a path being traversed that possesses going?

original: 'gro ba dang ldan pa med na 'gro ba mthar phyin pa yod par yang ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: 'gro ba dang ldan pa med na 'gro ba mthar phyin pa yod par yang ga la 'gyur /
translated: If that which possesses going does not exist, how could there be the completion of going?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say this:

original: ma song ba ni yod de /
analyzed: ma song ba ni yod de /
translated: That which has not yet been traversed exists.

original: der 'gro ba rtsom par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der 'gro ba rtsom par 'gyur ro //
translated: The beginning of going commences there.

original: bshad pa / ma song 'gro ba ga la yod //
analyzed: bshad pa / ma song 'gro ba ga la yod //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: How could there be going where one has not yet gone?

original: 'di la sdod cing mi bskyod pa gang yin pa de ni ma song ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la sdod cing mi bskyod pa gang yin pa de ni ma song ba ste /
translated: Here, that which is standing still and not moving is where one has not yet gone.

original: de la ni rtsom pa med do //
analyzed: de la ni rtsom pa med do //
translated: There is no beginning of going there.

original: gang gi tshe skyod par byed pa de'i tshe na ni go skabs gang du skyod par byed pa de ma song ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe skyod par byed pa de'i tshe na ni go skabs gang du skyod par byed pa de ma song ba ma yin no //
translated: But when one is moving, then wherever one moves, that is not the not-yet-traversed.

original: de'i tshe ma song ba'i go skabs gang yin pa de la ni bskyod pa med do //
analyzed: de'i tshe ma song ba'i go skabs gang yin pa de la ni bskyod pa med do //
translated: At that time, there is no movement on the not-yet-traversed.

original: de lta bas na ma song ba la 'gro ba'i rtsom pa gang la yod //
analyzed: de lta bas na ma song ba la 'gro ba'i rtsom pa gang la yod //
translated: Thus, where is the beginning of going on the not-yet-traversed?

original: de ltar brtags na /
analyzed: de ltar brtags na /
translated: When this is investigated,

original: 'gro rtsom rnam pa thams cad du //
analyzed: 'gro rtsom rnam pa thams cad du //
translated: The beginning of going is not seen in any way.

original: snang ba med pa nyid yin na //🔽song ba ci zhig bgom pa ni ;
analyzed: snang ba med pa nyid yin na // song ba ci zhig bgom pa ni ;
translated: If the beginning of going is not seen,🔽What is the traversed, what is the not-yet-traversed, and what is the being-traversed?

original: / ma song ci zhes rnam par brtag / gang gi tshe de ltar rnam pa thams cad kyis rnam par brtag pa na 'gro ba'i rtsom pa snang ba med pa nyid yin pa de'i tshe khyod kyi song ba yang ci /🔽bgom pa yang ci /
analyzed: / ma song ci zhes rnam par brtag / gang gi tshe de ltar rnam pa thams cad kyis rnam par brtag pa na 'gro ba'i rtsom pa snang ba med pa nyid yin pa de'i tshe khyod kyi song ba yang ci / bgom pa yang ci /
translated: When the beginning of going is not seen in any way through such an investigation, then what is the traversed?🔽What is the not-yet-traversed?

original: ma song ba de yang ci /🔽zhes rnam par brtag / smras pa /
analyzed: ma song ba de yang ci / zhes rnam par brtag / smras pa /
translated: What is the being-traversed?

original: re zhig ma song ba ni yod do //
analyzed: re zhig ma song ba ni yod do //
translated: Objection: First, the not-yet-traversed exists.

original: bshad pa / ci khyod bu ma btsas par 'chi ba'i mya ngan byed dam /
analyzed: bshad pa / ci khyod bu ma btsas par 'chi ba'i mya ngan byed dam /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: Do you grieve over the death of a child that has not yet been born?

original: khyod srong ba med par ma song ba la rtog go //
analyzed: khyod srong ba med par ma song ba la rtog go //
translated: You imagine that which has not gone to be gone over.

original: 'di ltar song ba'i gnyen po ni ma song ba yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar song ba'i gnyen po ni ma song ba yin na /
translated: If the antidote to going is nongoing,

original: de la gal te song ba nyid med na khyod kyi ma song ba yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de la gal te song ba nyid med na khyod kyi ma song ba yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: then if going itself does not exist, how could your nongoing exist?

original: smras pa / gal te gnyen po med pas song ba med na 'o na /
analyzed: smras pa / gal te gnyen po med pas song ba med na 'o na /
translated: Objection: If going does not exist because its antidote does not exist,

original: 'gro ba 'grub po //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'grub po //
translated: then going is established.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mi mthun pa'i yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because its opposite exists.

original: 'di ltar 'gro ba'i mi mthun pa sdod pa yod de /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'gro ba'i mi mthun pa sdod pa yod de /
translated: Thus, since the opposite of going, resting, exists,

original: de bas na mi mthun pa yod pa'i phyir 'gro ba yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de bas na mi mthun pa yod pa'i phyir 'gro ba yod pa kho na'o //
translated: therefore going exists because its opposite exists.

original: bshad pa / gal te sdod pa yod na ni 'gro ba yang yod par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: bshad pa / gal te sdod pa yod na ni 'gro ba yang yod par 'gyur grang na /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: If going exists because resting exists,

original: sdod pa mi 'thad pas 'gro ba yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: sdod pa mi 'thad pas 'gro ba yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: how could going exist since resting is untenable?

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it so?

original: 'di la gal te sdod pa yod par gyur na /
analyzed: 'di la gal te sdod pa yod par gyur na /
translated: Here, if resting existed,

original: 'gro ba po'i 'am /
analyzed: 'gro ba po'i 'am /
translated: it would be either of a goer

original: 'gro ba po ma yin pa'i yin grang na /
analyzed: 'gro ba po ma yin pa'i yin grang na /
translated: But if it is the non-goer,🔽then in that case:

original: de la / re zhig 'gro po mi sdod de //🔽'gro ba po min sdod pa min //
analyzed: de la / re zhig 'gro po mi sdod de // 'gro ba po min sdod pa min //
translated: First, the goer does not rest.🔽The non-goer does not rest.

original: 'gro po 'gro po min las gzhan //
analyzed: 'gro po 'gro po min las gzhan //
translated: Apart from the goer and the non-goer,

original: gsum pa gang @172a * //🔽zhig sdod par 'gyur /
analyzed: gsum pa gang @172a * // zhig sdod par 'gyur /
translated: What third person rests?

original: de lta bas na sdod pa ni med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na sdod pa ni med pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore resting does not exist.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is untenable.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: bshad pa / re zhig 'gro po sdod do zhes //
analyzed: bshad pa / re zhig 'gro po sdod do zhes //
translated: It has been explained:

original: ji ltar 'thad pa nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar 'thad pa nyid du 'gyur //
translated: First, how could it be tenable🔽To say “the goer rests”?

original: 'gro ba med na 'gro ba po //
analyzed: 'gro ba med na 'gro ba po //
translated: If there is no going,

original: nam yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //🔽'di la 'gro ba dang ldan pas 'gro ba por 'gyur bas 'gro ba med na /
analyzed: nam yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro // 'di la 'gro ba dang ldan pas 'gro ba por 'gyur bas 'gro ba med na /
translated: The goer is never tenable.

original: 'gro ba por mi 'thad pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'gro ba por mi 'thad pa nyid do //
translated: Here, since one becomes a goer by possessing going, if there is no going, it is not tenable that there is a goer.

original: 'gro ba log pa ni sdod pa zhes bya ba na 'gro ba dang sdod pa mi mthun pa de gnyis gcig na lhan cig 'dug pa med do //
analyzed: 'gro ba log pa ni sdod pa zhes bya ba na 'gro ba dang sdod pa mi mthun pa de gnyis gcig na lhan cig 'dug pa med do //
translated: Since the opposite of going is called resting, since those two, going and resting, are incompatible, they do not exist simultaneously in one goer.

original: de'i phyir de ltar re zhig 'gro ba po sdod do zhes bya ba de ji ltar 'thad pa nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar re zhig 'gro ba po sdod do zhes bya ba de ji ltar 'thad pa nyid du 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could it be tenable to say “The goer rests”?

original: de ni 'gro ba po ma yin pa yang mi sdod de /
analyzed: de ni 'gro ba po ma yin pa yang mi sdod de /
translated: Also, one who is not a goer does not rest.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he does not go.

original: 'di la 'gro ba log pa ni sdod pa zhes bya ba na 'gro ba po ma yin pa ni 'gro ba dang bral ba'i phyir sdod pa nyid yin pas de la yang sdod pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: 'di la 'gro ba log pa ni sdod pa zhes bya ba na 'gro ba po ma yin pa ni 'gro ba dang bral ba'i phyir sdod pa nyid yin pas de la yang sdod pas ci zhig bya /
translated: Here, “resting” is the opposite of going. But since one who is not a goer is devoid of going, he is already resting. What need is there for him to rest again?

original: sdod pa de la yang sdod par brtag na /
analyzed: sdod pa de la yang sdod par brtag na /
translated: If you imagine that he rests again,

original: sdod pa gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ba dang / sdod pa po yang gnyis su thal bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir 'gro ba po ma yin pa yang mi sdod do //
analyzed: sdod pa gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ba dang / sdod pa po yang gnyis su thal bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir 'gro ba po ma yin pa yang mi sdod do //
translated: then it follows that resting would be twofold and the goer would also be twofold. Therefore, one who is not a goer does not rest.

original: de la 'di snyam du 'gro ba po yin pa dang / 'gro ba po ma yin pa sdod par sems na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du 'gro ba po yin pa dang / 'gro ba po ma yin pa sdod par sems na /
translated: But if you think that one who is a goer and one who is not a goer rest,🔽then Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / 'gro po 'gro po min las gzhan //
analyzed: bshad pa / 'gro po 'gro po min las gzhan //
translated: Apart from the goer and the nongoer,

original: gsum pa gang zhig sdod par 'gyur /
analyzed: gsum pa gang zhig sdod par 'gyur /
translated: What third person rests?

original: 'gro bo dang 'gro ba po ma yin pa las gzhan pa gsum pa 'gro ba po yin pa dang / 'gro ba po ma yin pa gang sdod do zhes bya bar brtags pa de gang zhig yin /🔽de lta bas na med pa kho na'i phyir 'gro ba po yin pa dang / 'gro ba po ma yin pa yang mi sdod do //
analyzed: 'gro bo dang 'gro ba po ma yin pa las gzhan pa gsum pa 'gro ba po yin pa dang / 'gro ba po ma yin pa gang sdod do zhes bya bar brtags pa de gang zhig yin / de lta bas na med pa kho na'i phyir 'gro ba po yin pa dang / 'gro ba po ma yin pa yang mi sdod do //
translated: And that which is neither a goer nor a nongoer is also at rest.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: 'gro ba log pa ni sdod pa zhes bya ba /🔽ldog pa de yang bgom pa las sam /
analyzed: 'gro ba log pa ni sdod pa zhes bya ba / ldog pa de yang bgom pa las sam /
translated: the opposite of going is called resting.🔽Does that reversal occur from that being gone over,

original: song ba las sam ma song ba las ldog par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: song ba las sam ma song ba las ldog par 'gyur grang na /
translated: or from that being gone over, or from that not yet gone over?🔽In response, Nāgārjuna explains:

original: de la / bgom las ldog par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la / bgom las ldog par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Reversal does not occur from that being gone over,

original: song dang ma song las kyang min /
analyzed: song dang ma song las kyang min /
translated: nor from that being gone over, nor from that not yet gone over.

original: bgom pa las sdod pa mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: bgom pa las sdod pa mi 'gyur te /
translated: Reversal does not occur from that being gone over.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar 'gro ba dang ldan pa'i phyir bgom pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'gro ba dang ldan pa'i phyir bgom pa yin la /
translated: Because it is that being gone over because it possesses going.

original: 'gro ba log pa ni sdod pa yin pas sdod pa dang 'gro ba mi mthun pa de gnyis cig na mi srid pas de'i phyir re zhig bgom pa las ldog par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gro ba log pa ni sdod pa yin pas sdod pa dang 'gro ba mi mthun pa de gnyis cig na mi srid pas de'i phyir re zhig bgom pa las ldog par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Since stopping is the opposite of going, these two incompatible actions are impossible in one place. Therefore, first, one does not stop while on that being gone over.

original: de ni song ba dang ma song ba las kyang sdod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni song ba dang ma song ba las kyang sdod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, one does not stop while on that being gone over, nor on that not yet gone over.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'gro ba med pa'i phyir @172b ro ;
analyzed: 'gro ba med pa'i phyir @172b ro ;
translated: Because there is no going.

original: /'di ltar 'gro ba log pa ni sdod pa yin na /
analyzed: /'di ltar 'gro ba log pa ni sdod pa yin na /
translated: In this way, stopping is the opposite of going.

original: 'gro ba ni song ba dang ma song ba la med de /🔽'gro ba med na 'gro ba ldog pa ga la yod /
analyzed: 'gro ba ni song ba dang ma song ba la med de / 'gro ba med na 'gro ba ldog pa ga la yod /
translated: Going does not exist on that being gone over and on that not yet gone over.🔽If going does not exist, how could there be stopping?

original: 'gro ba ldog pa med na sdod pa ga la yod /
analyzed: 'gro ba ldog pa med na sdod pa ga la yod /
translated: If there is no stopping, how could there be going?

original: de lta bas na song ba dang ma song ba las kyang ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na song ba dang ma song ba las kyang ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, one does not stop while on that being gone over, nor on that not yet gone over.

original: 'gro ba dang ni 'jug pa dang / ldog pa yang ni 'gro dang mtshungs /
analyzed: 'gro ba dang ni 'jug pa dang / ldog pa yang ni 'gro dang mtshungs /
translated: Engaging, disengaging, and going are similar to going.

original: ji ltar 'gro ba po mi sdod de /
analyzed: ji ltar 'gro ba po mi sdod de /
translated: Just as a goer does not rest,

original: sdod pa dang / 'gro ba gnyis mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdod pa dang / 'gro ba gnyis mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because going and resting are incompatible.

original: zhes bshad pa de bzhin du sdod pa po yang mi 'gro ste /
analyzed: zhes bshad pa de bzhin du sdod pa po yang mi 'gro ste /
translated: So too, the one who is resting does not go,

original: sdod pa dang 'gro ba gnyis mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdod pa dang 'gro ba gnyis mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because resting and going are incompatible.

original: ji ltar 'gro ba po ma yin pa mi sdod de /
analyzed: ji ltar 'gro ba po ma yin pa mi sdod de /
translated: Just as the nongoer does not rest,

original: sdod pa gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa de bzhin du sdod pa po ma yin pa yang mi 'gro ste /
analyzed: sdod pa gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa de bzhin du sdod pa po ma yin pa yang mi 'gro ste /
translated: because the error of resting twice would ensue, so too the non-rester does not go,

original: 'gro ba gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //🔽ji ltar 'gro ba po yin pa dang / ji ltar 'gro ba po ma yin pa mi sdod de /
analyzed: 'gro ba gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // ji ltar 'gro ba po yin pa dang / ji ltar 'gro ba po ma yin pa mi sdod de /
translated: because the error of going twice would ensue.🔽Just as the goer and the nongoer do not rest,

original: mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa de bzhin du sdod pa po yin pa dang ; sdod pa po ma yin pa yang mi 'gro ste /
analyzed: mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa de bzhin du sdod pa po yin pa dang ; sdod pa po ma yin pa yang mi 'gro ste /
translated: because it is impossible, so too the rester and the nonrester do not go,

original: mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible.

original: de ltar re zhig 'gro ba po'i sdod pa dang / sdod pa po'i 'gro ba mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig 'gro ba po'i sdod pa dang / sdod pa po'i 'gro ba mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus the resting of the goer and the going of the rester are similar.

original: da ni ji ltar 'gro ba'i rtsom pa song ba dang / ma song ba dang / bgom pa la mi 'thad do zhes bshad pa de bzhin du sdod pa'i 'jug pa yang bsdad pa dang ma bsdad pa dang / sdod pa la mi 'thad de /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar 'gro ba'i rtsom pa song ba dang / ma song ba dang / bgom pa la mi 'thad do zhes bshad pa de bzhin du sdod pa'i 'jug pa yang bsdad pa dang ma bsdad pa dang / sdod pa la mi 'thad de /
translated: beginning of resting is untenable in that which has rested, that which has🔽not rested, and that which is resting.

original: de ltar na 'gro ba'i rtsom pa dang sdod pa'i 'jug pa mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'gro ba'i rtsom pa dang sdod pa'i 'jug pa mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the beginning of going and the beginning of resting are similar.🔽Now, just as it was explained that the cessation of going is not tenable in🔽the gone, the not-yet-gone, and that being gone over, in the same way, the

original: da ni ji ltar 'gro ba'i ldog pa song ba dang / ma song ba dang / bgom pa las ldog par mi 'gyur zhes bshad pa de bzhin du sdod pa'i ldog pa yang gang du bsdad pa de nas mi 'gro ste /🔽'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ni ji ltar 'gro ba'i ldog pa song ba dang / ma song ba dang / bgom pa las ldog par mi 'gyur zhes bshad pa de bzhin du sdod pa'i ldog pa yang gang du bsdad pa de nas mi 'gro ste / 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: cessation of resting is not tenable in that which has rested, that which has🔽not rested, and that which is resting.

original: gang du ma bsdad pa de nas kyang mi 'gro ste /🔽'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //🔽gang du bsdad pa de nas kyang mi 'gro ste /
analyzed: gang du ma bsdad pa de nas kyang mi 'gro ste / 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro // gang du bsdad pa de nas kyang mi 'gro ste /
translated: One does not go from where one has rested, because there is no going.🔽One does not go from where one has not rested, because there is no going.

original: sdod pa dang 'gro ba gnyis mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdod pa dang 'gro ba gnyis mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One does not go from where one is resting, because going and resting are🔽incompatible.

original: de ltar na 'gro ba'i ldog pa dang / sdod pa'i ldog pa mtshungs pa yin no ;
analyzed: de ltar na 'gro ba'i ldog pa dang / sdod pa'i ldog pa mtshungs pa yin no ;
translated: Thus, the stopping of going and the stopping of staying are the same.

original: /'dir smras pa /
analyzed: /'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say:

original: 'gro ba dang 'jug pa dang / ldog pa song ba dang ma song ba dang / bgom pa la yod do zhe'am 'gro ba po dang / 'gro ba po ma yin pa dang / de las gzhan pa la yod do zhes bya ba de la brjod par mi nus su zin kyang /🔽tsee tra'i gom pa 'dor ba mthong nas /
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'jug pa dang / ldog pa song ba dang ma song ba dang / bgom pa la yod do zhe'am 'gro ba po dang / 'gro ba po ma yin pa dang / de las gzhan pa la yod do zhes bya ba de la brjod par mi nus su zin kyang / tsee tra'i gom pa 'dor ba mthong nas /
translated: Although it cannot be said that going, engaging, and stopping exist in that gone over, not gone over, and that being gone over, or that they exist in one who goes, one who does not go, or one other than those,

original: tsee tra'i 'gro @173a * //
analyzed: tsee tra'i 'gro @173a * //
translated: nevertheless, having seen Caitra’s step that is being put down,

original: ba po zhes bya bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir 'gro ba po dang 'gro ba yod do //
analyzed: ba po zhes bya bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir 'gro ba po dang 'gro ba yod do //
translated: one thinks “Caitra’s going.” Therefore, one who goes and going exist.🔽In response to this, Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / re zhig brjod par mi nus su zin kyang zhes bya ba de ni phongs pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa / re zhig brjod par mi nus su zin kyang zhes bya ba de ni phongs pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: First, the statement “although it cannot be said” is a statement of defeat.🔽Nevertheless, having seen Caitra’s step that is being put down,

original: 'on kyang gang mthong nas tsee tra 'gro ba po zhes bya bar sems pa tsee tra'i gom pa 'dor ba gang yin pa 'dor /
analyzed: 'on kyang gang mthong nas tsee tra 'gro ba po zhes bya bar sems pa tsee tra'i gom pa 'dor ba gang yin pa 'dor /
translated: one thinks “Caitra’s going.”

original: gom pa 'dor ba de dang tsee tra gcig pa nyid dam gzhan pa nyid du 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: gom pa 'dor ba de dang tsee tra gcig pa nyid dam gzhan pa nyid du 'gyur grang na /
translated: Is the act of going the same as or different from the goer?🔽In response, Aryadeva says:

original: de la / 'gro ba de dang 'gro ba po //
analyzed: de la / 'gro ba de dang 'gro ba po //
translated: The goer and the act of going

original: de nyid ces kyang byar mi rung //
analyzed: de nyid ces kyang byar mi rung //
translated: cannot be said to be the same.

original: 'gro ba dang ni 'gro ba po //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang ni 'gro ba po //
translated: The goer and the act of going

original: gzhan nyid ces kyang byar mi rung //
analyzed: gzhan nyid ces kyang byar mi rung //
translated: cannot be said to be different.

original: ji ltar zhe na /🔽gal te 'gro ba gang yin pa //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / gal te 'gro ba gang yin pa //
translated: Why?

original: de nyid 'gro po yin gyur na //
analyzed: de nyid 'gro po yin gyur na //
translated: If the goer were the act of going,

original: byed pa po dang las nyid kyang ;
analyzed: byed pa po dang las nyid kyang ;
translated: then the agent and the action

original: gcig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur //🔽gal te 'gro ba gang yin pa de nyid 'gro ba po yin par gyur na /
analyzed: gcig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur // gal te 'gro ba gang yin pa de nyid 'gro ba po yin par gyur na /
translated: would be the same.

original: de lta na byed pa po dang bya ba yang gcig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na byed pa po dang bya ba yang gcig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the goer were the act of going, then the agent and the action would be the same.

original: de ni mi 'thad do /
analyzed: de ni mi 'thad do /
translated: That is unacceptable.

original: byed pa po gang yin pa de nyid bya ba yin par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: byed pa po gang yin pa de nyid bya ba yin par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could the goer be the act of going?

original: ci ste skyon der gyur na mi rung ngo ;
analyzed: ci ste skyon der gyur na mi rung ngo ;
translated: If you think that this error is unacceptable,

original: / snyam pas byed pa po dang bya ba gnyis gzhan pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: / snyam pas byed pa po dang bya ba gnyis gzhan pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: then the goer and the act of going are different.

original: de la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bshad par bya ste /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds:

original: gal te 'gro dang 'gro ba po //
analyzed: gal te 'gro dang 'gro ba po //
translated: If going and the goer

original: gzhan pa nyid du rnam brtags na //
analyzed: gzhan pa nyid du rnam brtags na //
translated: are conceived as different,🔽then there would be going without a goer,

original: 'gro po med pa'i 'gro ba dang // 'gro ba med pa'i 'gro por 'gyur //
analyzed: 'gro po med pa'i 'gro ba dang // 'gro ba med pa'i 'gro por 'gyur //
translated: and there would be a goer without going.

original: gal te byed pa po dang / bya ba gnyis gcig pa nyid kyi skyon mthong bas 'gro ba po dang // 'gro ba gzhan pa nyid du rnam par brtags na /
analyzed: gal te byed pa po dang / bya ba gnyis gcig pa nyid kyi skyon mthong bas 'gro ba po dang // 'gro ba gzhan pa nyid du rnam par brtags na /
translated: If the error of the identity of the goer and going is seen, and going and the goer are conceived as different,

original: de lta na 'gro ba po las tha dad par gyur pa'i 'gro ba gzhi med pa rang las rab tu grub par 'gyur ba dang / 'gro ba gzhi med pa rang las rab tu grub par gyur na 'gro ba po yang 'gro ba dang bral ba mi ltos pa rang las rab tu grub par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de lta na 'gro ba po las tha dad par gyur pa'i 'gro ba gzhi med pa rang las rab tu grub par 'gyur ba dang / 'gro ba gzhi med pa rang las rab tu grub par gyur na 'gro ba po yang 'gro ba dang bral ba mi ltos pa rang las rab tu grub par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then in that case, going that is different from the goer would be baseless and established from itself, and if going that is baseless were established from itself, then the goer would also be free from going, independent, and established from itself.

original: de gnyis gang yang mi 'thad de 'gro ba po med par 'gro ba dang / 'gro ba med par 'gro ba por ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de gnyis gang yang mi 'thad de 'gro ba po med par 'gro ba dang / 'gro ba med par 'gro ba por ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: But neither of those two is tenable. How could there be going without a goer, and how could there be a goer without going?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say:

original: ci khyed gsod pa po nyid la dpar 'dzugs sam /
analyzed: ci khyed gsod pa po nyid la dpar 'dzugs sam /
translated: Do you accuse the killer himself?

original: kho bo ni byed pa po dang bya ba gnyis tha dad par 'gyur grub pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kho bo ni byed pa po dang bya ba gnyis tha dad par 'gyur grub pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the agent and action are not established as different,

original: gzhan pa nyid du yang mi 'dod la /
analyzed: gzhan pa nyid du yang mi 'dod la /
translated: we do not assert that they are different.

original: byed pa po tha dad pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid du yang mi 'dod pas de'i phyir de gnyi ga med par yang de gnyis grub po //
analyzed: byed pa po tha dad pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid du yang mi 'dod pas de'i phyir de gnyi ga med par yang de gnyis grub po //
translated: Because the agent is different, we do not assert that they are the same. Therefore, they are established as neither of those two.

original: bshad pa / kho bo ni gsod pa po nyid la dbang mi 'dzugs kyi /
analyzed: bshad pa / kho bo ni gsod pa po nyid la dbang mi 'dzugs kyi /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: We do not accuse the killer himself.

original: khyod nyid lag pa brkyang ste tshigs @173b chen por g-yob cing khong pa dbugs kyis brdzangs bzhin du smig rgyu'i chu la rkyal bar byed dam /
analyzed: khyod nyid lag pa brkyang ste tshigs @173b chen por g-yob cing khong pa dbugs kyis brdzangs bzhin du smig rgyu'i chu la rkyal bar byed dam /
translated: Do you extend your hand, waving your finger, and with your chest puffed up with breath, swim in the water of a mirage?

original: khyod de nyid dang gzhan ma gtogs pa med pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i blos gnas par byed ko //
analyzed: khyod de nyid dang gzhan ma gtogs pa med pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i blos gnas par byed ko //
translated: You should remain with a mind that is fixed on the position that excludes “the same” and “different.”

original: gang dag dngos po gcig pa dang // dngos po gzhan pa nyid du ni //
analyzed: gang dag dngos po gcig pa dang // dngos po gzhan pa nyid du ni //
translated: If one thing and another thing

original: grub par gyur ba yod min na//
analyzed: grub par gyur ba yod min na//
translated: are not established as existent,

original: de gnyis grub pa ji ltar yod //
analyzed: de gnyis grub pa ji ltar yod //
translated: how could those two be established?

original: gal te byed pa po dang bya ba gnyis gcig pa nyid dang gzhan pa nyid du grub pa med de gnyis ma gtogs par rnam pa gzhan gang gis de gnyis grub pa yod pa de je smros shig / de lta bas na de ni brtags pa tsam du
analyzed: gal te byed pa po dang bya ba gnyis gcig pa nyid dang gzhan pa nyid du grub pa med de gnyis ma gtogs par rnam pa gzhan gang gis de gnyis grub pa yod pa de je smros shig / de lta bas na de ni brtags pa tsam du
translated: Therefore, this is mere imputation.

original: zad do // 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: zad do // 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: 'jig rten mngon sum gyi don 'di gab gab kyis gnon par ji ltar nus /
analyzed: 'jig rten mngon sum gyi don 'di gab gab kyis gnon par ji ltar nus /
translated: How can you deny the meaning of the world’s direct perception?

original: yong ni gang med pas 'gro ba po ma yin no //
analyzed: yong ni gang med pas 'gro ba po ma yin no //
translated: If something does not exist, it is not a goer.

original: zhes bya ba dang / gang la ltos nas 'di 'gro ba po yin no zhes bya ba de ni 'gro ba yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / gang la ltos nas 'di 'gro ba po yin no zhes bya ba de ni 'gro ba yin la /
translated: And in dependence on that, it is said, “This is a goer.” That is going.

original: de yang 'gro ba po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang 'gro ba po zhes bya'o //
translated: And that is called a goer.

original: bshad pa / ci khyod bu 'dod la ma ning la spyod dam /
analyzed: bshad pa / ci khyod bu 'dod la ma ning la spyod dam /
translated: Response: Do you desire a son but engage in intercourse with a eunuch?

original: khyod 'gro ba po med pa la 'gro ba por rtog go //
analyzed: khyod 'gro ba po med pa la 'gro ba por rtog go //
translated: You think that a goer exists without a non-goer.

original: 'di ltar bgrod par bya ba zhig yod na ni 'gro ba por brtag tu yang rung grang na /
analyzed: 'di ltar bgrod par bya ba zhig yod na ni 'gro ba por brtag tu yang rung grang na /
translated: If that which is to be gone is established, then it would be suitable to investigate whether it is a goer.

original: gang gi tshe 'gro ba por brtags kyang bgrod par bya ba mi 'thad pa de'i tshe ci yang mi phan pa yongs su brtags pa 'dis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'gro ba por brtags kyang bgrod par bya ba mi 'thad pa de'i tshe ci yang mi phan pa yongs su brtags pa 'dis ci zhig bya /
translated: But when it is untenable that the goer is the one who traverses, then what is the use of this useless analysis?

original: bgrod par bya ba ji ltar mi 'thad ce na /🔽de ni song ba yang ma yin ma song ba yang ma yin la /
analyzed: bgrod par bya ba ji ltar mi 'thad ce na / de ni song ba yang ma yin ma song ba yang ma yin la /
translated: How is it untenable that the goer traverses?🔽It has been explained that the path is not traversed by the one who has gone, nor by the one who has not gone,

original: bgom pa ni shes par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan zin te //
analyzed: bgom pa ni shes par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan zin te //
translated: nor by the one who is in the process of going.

original: de dag tsam du de 'gro bas 'gro ba po yin grang na /
analyzed: de dag tsam du de 'gro bas 'gro ba po yin grang na /
translated: If the goer traverses that much, then the goer would be the one who traverses.

original: de ni mi 'gro bas de'i phyir 'gro ba por brtags pa ni don med pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni mi 'gro bas de'i phyir 'gro ba por brtags pa ni don med pa yin no //
translated: But since he does not traverse, therefore it is pointless to impute the goer.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say this:

original: 'gro ba po yin pas 'gro ba nyid 'gro ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba po yin pas 'gro ba nyid 'gro ste /
translated: The goer goes by virtue of going.

original: dper na smra po dag na re tshig smra'o //
analyzed: dper na smra po dag na re tshig smra'o //
translated: For example, some say that the speaker speaks by virtue of speech.

original: bya ba byed do zhes zer ba bzhin no //
analyzed: bya ba byed do zhes zer ba bzhin no //
translated: And they say that the agent performs an action by virtue of the action.

original: bshad pa / 'gro ba po'i 'gro ba la brtag na yang 'gro ba gang gis de'i 'gro ba por mngon pa'i 'gro ba de nyid dam /
analyzed: bshad pa / 'gro ba po'i 'gro ba la brtag na yang 'gro ba gang gis de'i 'gro ba por mngon pa'i 'gro ba de nyid dam /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: When the going of the goer is analyzed, does the goer go by means of that going by virtue of which he is called a goer,

original: de las gzhan pa zhig 'gro grang na /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa zhig 'gro grang na /
translated: or does he go by means of another going?

original: gnyi ga yang mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang mi mthong ngo //
translated: Neither is seen.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: 'gro ba gang gi 'gro por mngon //
analyzed: 'gro ba gang gi 'gro por mngon //
translated: The goer is manifest as the goer of that going.

original: 'gro ba de ni de 'gro min /🔽'gro ba gang dang ldan na /
analyzed: 'gro ba de ni de 'gro min / 'gro ba gang dang ldan na /
translated: That going is not the going of that goer.

original: tsee tra 'gro ba po zhes bya bar mngon pa'i 'gro ba de ni 'gro ba po de 'gro bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tsee tra 'gro ba po zhes bya bar mngon pa'i 'gro ba de ni 'gro ba po de 'gro bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The goer is manifest as the goer of that going which is called “going.” That going is not the going of that goer.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang phyir 'gro ba'i snga rol med //
analyzed: gang phyir 'gro ba'i snga rol med //
translated: Because there is no goer prior to going.

original: gang zhig gang du 'gro bar 'gyur //🔽gang gi phyir 'gro ba @174a * //
analyzed: gang zhig gang du 'gro bar 'gyur // gang gi phyir 'gro ba @174a * //
translated: Where would the goer go?🔽Because there is no goer prior to going.

original: gang gis 'gro ba po zhes bya bar mngon pa'i 'gro ba 'di snga rol ni 'gro ba'i snga rol te de'i snga rol na 'gro ba po med do //
analyzed: gang gis 'gro ba po zhes bya bar mngon pa'i 'gro ba 'di snga rol ni 'gro ba'i snga rol te de'i snga rol na 'gro ba po med do //
translated: That going by which the goer is manifest is called “going.” Prior to that going, there is no goer prior to going.

original: de dang ldan pa kho na'i phyir 'gro ba po zhes brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa kho na'i phyir 'gro ba po zhes brjod pa yin te /
translated: Because he possesses that, he is called “the goer.”

original: gang zhig gang du dper na grang dang grong khyer lta bu tha dad par gyur pas 'gro bar 'gyur ba yin na 'gro ba por gyur nas gang 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i 'gro ba de ni 'gro ba po las grong dang grong khyer lta bur tha dad par gyur🔽pa med do //
analyzed: gang zhig gang du dper na grang dang grong khyer lta bu tha dad par gyur pas 'gro bar 'gyur ba yin na 'gro ba por gyur nas gang 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i 'gro ba de ni 'gro ba po las grong dang grong khyer lta bur tha dad par gyur pa med do //
translated: But if one goes somewhere, for example, from a village to a town, then the going that is the going of the goer is not different from the goer, like the town from the village.

original: de ltar re zhig 'gro ba gang gis 'gro ba po zhes bya bar mngon pa'i 'gro ba de ni 'gro ba po 'gro bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig 'gro ba gang gis 'gro ba po zhes bya bar mngon pa'i 'gro ba de ni 'gro ba po 'gro bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, first, the going by means of which the goer is manifest is not the going that the goer performs.

original: de la 'di snyam du de las gzhan pa zhig 'gro bar sems na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du de las gzhan pa zhig 'gro bar sems na /
translated: But if you think that something other than that goes,🔽then Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / 'gro ba gang gis 'gro por mngon //
analyzed: bshad pa / 'gro ba gang gis 'gro por mngon //
translated: The goer is manifest🔽By means of that going.

original: de las gzhan pa de 'gro min //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa de 'gro min //
translated: That which is other than that does not go.

original: 'gro ba gang dang ldan na tsee tra 'gro ba po zhes bya bar mngon pa de las gzhan pa'i 'gro ba yang 'gro ba po de 'gro bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba gang dang ldan na tsee tra 'gro ba po zhes bya bar mngon pa de las gzhan pa'i 'gro ba yang 'gro ba po de 'gro bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The goer is manifest by means of that going by means of which the goer is manifest. That which is other than that going does not perform the going of the goer.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang phyir 'gro po gcig pu la //
analyzed: gang phyir 'gro po gcig pu la //
translated: Because the goer is a single person.

original: 'gro ba gnyis su mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'gro ba gnyis su mi 'thad do //
translated: Going in two ways is not tenable.

original: gang gi phyir 'gro ba po gcig pu la gang gi 'gro ba po zhes bya bar mngon pa dang 'gro por gyur nas gang 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i 'gro ba gnyis mi 'thad pa de'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i 'gro ba yang 'gro ba po 'gro bar byed pa
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'gro ba po gcig pu la gang gi 'gro ba po zhes bya bar mngon pa dang 'gro por gyur nas gang 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i 'gro ba gnyis mi 'thad pa de'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i 'gro ba yang 'gro ba po 'gro bar byed pa
translated: Because it is not tenable that a single goer has two goings: the going that is called a goer and the going that is the goer having gone. Therefore, going that is other than that is also not the goer’s going.

original: ma yin no// des na tshig smra'o //
analyzed: ma yin no// des na tshig smra'o //
translated: Therefore, the statement “The goer speaks”

original: bya ba byed do zhes bya ba yang lan btab pa yin no //
analyzed: bya ba byed do zhes bya ba yang lan btab pa yin no //
translated: is also answered.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone says:

original: 'gro ba po'i bgrod par bya ba grong dang grong khyer la sogs pa yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'gro ba po'i bgrod par bya ba grong dang grong khyer la sogs pa yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Aren’t there villages, cities, and so on that are the destinations of the goer?

original: bshad pa / de la ni lan btab zin te /
analyzed: bshad pa / de la ni lan btab zin te /
translated: In response to that, we have already answered:

original: grong dang grong khyer la brten nas /
analyzed: grong dang grong khyer la brten nas /
translated: In dependence on villages and cities,

original: ci de grong du song ba la 'gro ba yod dam ma song ba la 'gro ba yod dam bgom pa la 'gro ba yod ces bsams zin pas de'i phyir de ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: ci de grong du song ba la 'gro ba yod dam ma song ba la 'gro ba yod dam bgom pa la 'gro ba yod ces bsams zin pas de'i phyir de ni gyi na'o //
translated: we have already considered whether going exists for one who has gone to a village, for one who has not gone, or for one who is going. Therefore, that is untenable.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: 'gro po yin par gyur pa ni //
analyzed: 'gro po yin par gyur pa ni //
translated: One who is a goer

original: 'gro rnam gsum du 'gro mi byed //🔽ma yin par ni gyur de yang //
analyzed: 'gro rnam gsum du 'gro mi byed // ma yin par ni gyur de yang //
translated: One who is going does not go in any of the three ways.

original: 'gro rnam gsum du 'gro mi byed //🔽yin dang ma yin gyur pa yang //
analyzed: 'gro rnam gsum du 'gro mi byed // yin dang ma yin gyur pa yang //
translated: One who is not going does not go in any of the three ways.🔽One who is both going and not going does not go in any of the three ways.

original: 'gro rnam gsum du 'gro mi byed //
analyzed: 'gro rnam gsum du 'gro mi byed //
translated: One who is neither going nor not going does not go in any of the three ways.

original: de phyir 'gro dang 'gro po dang // bgrod par bya ba'ang yod ma yin //
analyzed: de phyir 'gro dang 'gro po dang // bgrod par bya ba'ang yod ma yin //
translated: Therefore going, one who goes, and that which is to be gone over do not exist.

original: 'gro ba po yin par gyur ba zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba po gang 'gro ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba po yin par gyur ba zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba po gang 'gro ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: One who is a goer is one who possesses going.

original: de ma yin par gyur pa yang zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba po gang 'gro ba dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de ma yin par gyur pa yang zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba po gang 'gro ba dang bral ba'o //
translated: One who is not a goer is one who does not possess going.

original: yin pa @174b dang ma yin par gyur pa yang zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba po gang 'gro ba dang ldan pa yang yin la 'gro ba dang bral ba yang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yin pa @174b dang ma yin par gyur pa yang zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba po gang 'gro ba dang ldan pa yang yin la 'gro ba dang bral ba yang yin pa'o //
translated: One who is both a goer and not a goer is one who possesses going and does not possess going.🔽One who is neither a goer nor not a goer does not possess going and does not not possess going.

original: 'gro zhes bya ba ni bgrod par bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'gro zhes bya ba ni bgrod par bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Going” means that which is to be gone over.

original: rnam gsum du zhes bya ba ni song ba dang ma song ba dang bgom par ro //
analyzed: rnam gsum du zhes bya ba ni song ba dang ma song ba dang bgom par ro //
translated: “In any of the three ways” means in that which has been gone over, in that over which one has not yet gone, and in that over which one goes.

original: de'i phyir de ltar yang dag pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i blos yongs su brtags na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar yang dag pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i blos yongs su brtags na /
translated: Therefore, when thoroughly investigated by a mind that properly follows reality,

original: 'gro ba po yin par gyur pa ni bgrod par bya ba rnam pa gsum du 'gro bar mi byed la /
analyzed: 'gro ba po yin par gyur pa ni bgrod par bya ba rnam pa gsum du 'gro bar mi byed la /
translated: one who is an active goer does not go in any of the three ways of going.

original: 'gro ba po ma yin par gyur pa yang bgrod par bya ba rnam pa gsum du 'gro bar mi byed cing /
analyzed: 'gro ba po ma yin par gyur pa yang bgrod par bya ba rnam pa gsum du 'gro bar mi byed cing /
translated: One who is not an active goer also does not go in any of the three ways of going.

original: 'gro ba po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur ba yang bgrod par bya ba rnam pa gsum du 'gro bar mi byed pa de'i phyir 'gro ba dang 'gro ba po dang bgrod par bya ba med do //
analyzed: 'gro ba po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur ba yang bgrod par bya ba rnam pa gsum du 'gro bar mi byed pa de'i phyir 'gro ba dang 'gro ba po dang bgrod par bya ba med do //
translated: One who is both an active goer and not an active goer also does not go in any of the three ways of going. Therefore going, the goer, and that gone over do not exist.

original: bya ba rnams kyi nang na 'gro ba'i bya ba gtso bo yin pas /
analyzed: bya ba rnams kyi nang na 'gro ba'i bya ba gtso bo yin pas /
translated: Since the action of going is the most important of all actions,

original: 'gro ba'i bya ba yongs su brtags te /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bya ba yongs su brtags te /
translated: the action of going is thoroughly investigated.

original: ji ltar 'gro ba mi 'thad par rab tu sgrub pa de bzhin du bya ba thams cad kyang mi 'thad par grub bo //
analyzed: ji ltar 'gro ba mi 'thad par rab tu sgrub pa de bzhin du bya ba thams cad kyang mi 'thad par grub bo //
translated: Just as it is established that going is untenable, so it is established that all actions are untenable.

original: song ba dang ma song ba dang bgom pa brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa gnyis pa'o /🔽// / dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa bud dha p'a li ta /🔽bam po gnyis pa /🔽'dir smras pa /
analyzed: song ba dang ma song ba dang bgom pa brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa gnyis pa'o / // / dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa bud dha p'a li ta / bam po gnyis pa / 'dir smras pa /
translated: This is the second chapter, called “The Examination of Going and Coming.”🔽🔽Buddhapalita’s Commentary on the Fundamental Treatise on the Middle Way🔽🔽Here, someone might say,🔽

original: khyed kyis 'gro ba mi 'thad pa de rjes su rab tu bstan pas kho bo'i yid stong pa nyid nyan pa la spro bar byas kyis /🔽de'i phyir da ni rang gi gzhung lugs la brten pa chung zhig rjes su rab tu bstan pa'i rigs so //🔽bshad pa / de ltar bya'o //🔽smras pa / lta dang nyan dang snom pa dang // myong bar byed dang reg byed yid //🔽dbang po drug po de dag gi //🔽spyod yul blta bar bya la sogs //🔽lta ba la sogs pa de dag ni dbang po drug tu bstan la /🔽de dag gi spyod yul ni gzugs la sogs pa drug po dag nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: khyed kyis 'gro ba mi 'thad pa de rjes su rab tu bstan pas kho bo'i yid stong pa nyid nyan pa la spro bar byas kyis /🔽de'i phyir da ni rang gi gzhung lugs la brten pa chung zhig rjes su rab tu bstan pa'i rigs so //🔽bshad pa / de ltar bya'o //🔽smras pa / lta dang nyan dang snom pa dang // myong bar byed dang reg byed yid //🔽dbang po drug po de dag gi //🔽spyod yul blta bar bya la sogs //🔽lta ba la sogs pa de dag ni dbang po drug tu bstan la /🔽de dag gi spyod yul ni gzugs la sogs pa drug po dag nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: Going, Not Going, and That Being Gone Over is finished.

original: de la gzugs la lta bar byed pas lta bar bstan la /
analyzed: de la gzugs la lta bar byed pas lta bar bstan la /
translated: Here, seeing is taught because it sees visible form.

original: lhag ma rnams kyang rang rang gi yul 'dzin par byed pas bstan to //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyang rang rang gi yul 'dzin par byed pas bstan to //
translated: The remaining faculties are taught because they each apprehend their own objects.

original: dngos po med na gzugs la lta bar byed pas lta ba zhes brjod par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: dngos po med na gzugs la lta bar byed pas lta ba zhes brjod par mi 'thad do //
translated: If they do not exist, it is not tenable to say that seeing is seeing because it sees visible form.

original: 'di ltar med pas ji ltar lta bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar med pas ji ltar lta bar 'gyur /
translated: If it does not exist, how could it see?

original: ci ste lta na ni ri bong gi rvas kyang rus sbal gyi spu sogs par 'gyur ba zhig na de ni mi 'thad pas de'i phyir skye mched rnams yod do //🔽bshad pa / gal te gzugs la @175a * //
analyzed: ci ste lta na ni ri bong gi rvas kyang rus sbal gyi spu sogs par 'gyur ba zhig na de ni mi 'thad pas de'i phyir skye mched rnams yod do // bshad pa / gal te gzugs la @175a * //
translated: If it sees, then even the horn of a rabbit would be able to grasp the hair of a tortoise. But that is untenable. Therefore the sense bases exist.🔽Nāgārjuna responds:🔽If it is tenable to say

original: lta bar byed pas lta'o zhes bya ba de 'thad na ni /
analyzed: lta bar byed pas lta'o zhes bya ba de 'thad na ni /
translated: “It sees because it sees visible form,”🔽then the sense bases would exist.

original: skye mched rnams yod pa 'gyur ba zhig na de ni 'thad do //
analyzed: skye mched rnams yod pa 'gyur ba zhig na de ni 'thad do //
translated: But that is untenable.🔽Why?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ltar / lta de rang gi bdag nyid na //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar / lta de rang gi bdag nyid na //
translated: Because:🔽That seeing does not see

original: de ni de la mi lta nyid //🔽gang zhig bdag la mi lta ba //
analyzed: de ni de la mi lta nyid // gang zhig bdag la mi lta ba //
translated: itself.🔽How could that which does not see itself

original: de gzhan dag la ji ltar lta //
analyzed: de gzhan dag la ji ltar lta //
translated: see others?

original: 'di la dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni rang gi bdag nyid la mthong na de dang ldan pas gzhan gyi bdag nyid la yang dmigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni rang gi bdag nyid la mthong na de dang ldan pas gzhan gyi bdag nyid la yang dmigs par 'gyur te /
translated: If the essence of things were seen in their own nature, then since it would possess that, it would also be observed in the nature of others.

original: dper na chu la rlan mthong na de dang ldan pas /
analyzed: dper na chu la rlan mthong na de dang ldan pas /
translated: For example, if wetness were seen in water, then since it would possess that, it would also be observed in earth.

original: sa la yang dmigs pa dang / me la tsha ba mthong na de dang ldan pas chu la yang dmigs pa dang / sna ma'i me tog la dri zhim pa nyid mthong na de dang ldan pas gos la yang dmigs pa lta bu yin na dngos po gang rang gi bdag nyid la mi snang ba de gzhan gyi bdag nyid la ji ltar dmigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sa la yang dmigs pa dang / me la tsha ba mthong na de dang ldan pas chu la yang dmigs pa dang / sna ma'i me tog la dri zhim pa nyid mthong na de dang ldan pas gos la yang dmigs pa lta bu yin na dngos po gang rang gi bdag nyid la mi snang ba de gzhan gyi bdag nyid la ji ltar dmigs par 'gyur te /
translated: If heat were seen in fire, then since it would possess that, it would also be observed in water. If sweet fragrance were seen in a jasmine flower, then since it would possess that, it would also be observed in cloth. But how could a thing that is not seen in its own nature be observed in the nature of others?

original: 'di ltar sna ma'i me tog la dri nga ba nyid ma mthong na gos la yang dmigs par mi 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sna ma'i me tog la dri nga ba nyid ma mthong na gos la yang dmigs par mi 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, if a jasmine flower were not seen to have a foul odor, then it would not be observed in cloth.

original: de'i phyir gal te lta ba rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar byed na ni des na gzugs la lta bar byed pas lta ba'o zhes bya ba de 'thad par 'gyur ba zhig na lta ba ni rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te lta ba rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar byed na ni des na gzugs la lta bar byed pas lta ba'o zhes bya ba de 'thad par 'gyur ba zhig na lta ba ni rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed do //
translated: Therefore, if seeing sees its own nature, then it would be tenable to say, “It is seeing because it sees form.” But seeing does not see its own nature.

original: de gang rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed pa de gzhan dag la ji ltar lta bar byed de /🔽des na gzugs la lta bar byed pas lta ba'o //
analyzed: de gang rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed pa de gzhan dag la ji ltar lta bar byed de / des na gzugs la lta bar byed pas lta ba'o //
translated: How could that which does not see its own nature see others?

original: zhes bya ba de mi 'thad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable to say, “It is seeing because it sees form.”

original: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang //
analyzed: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang //
translated: Āryadeva also says:

original: dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of all things

original: thog mar bdag la snang gyur na //🔽mig nyid la yang mig gis ni //
analyzed: thog mar bdag la snang gyur na // mig nyid la yang mig gis ni //
translated: First appears to itself.🔽If the eye🔽Does not see itself,

original: ci yi phyir na 'dzin mi 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ci yi phyir na 'dzin mi 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: How could it see others?

original: smras pa / me bzhin du lta ba la sogs pa 'grub ste /
analyzed: smras pa / me bzhin du lta ba la sogs pa 'grub ste /
translated: Objection: Seeing and so on are established like fire.

original: dper na me ni sreg par byed pa yin yang gzhan dag sreg par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: dper na me ni sreg par byed pa yin yang gzhan dag sreg par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: For example, fire burns others, but it does not burn itself.

original: rang gi bdag nyid sreg par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid sreg par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it does not burn itself.

original: de bzhin du lta ba yang lta bar byed pa yin yang gzhan dag la lta bar byed pa nyid yin gyi rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du lta ba yang lta bar byed pa yin yang gzhan dag la lta bar byed pa nyid yin gyi rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, although seeing sees, it sees other things, but it does not see itself.

original: bshad pa / lta ba rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bshad pa / lta ba rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds:

original: mi yi dpe ni nus ma yin //
analyzed: mi yi dpe ni nus ma yin //
translated: The example of a man is not capable🔽of establishing seeing.

original: nus ma yin zhes bya ba ni mi chog pa dang / mi nus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: nus ma yin zhes bya ba ni mi chog pa dang / mi nus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: “Not capable” means not sufficient, not possible.

original: khyod kyis lta ba rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir me'i dpe byas pa gang yin pa des ni lta ba rab tu bsgrub @175b par mi nus so //
analyzed: khyod kyis lta ba rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir me'i dpe byas pa gang yin pa des ni lta ba rab tu bsgrub @175b par mi nus so //
translated: The example of fire that you used to establish seeing is not capable of establishing seeing.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di la bud shing bsreg go zhes bya mod kyi /🔽bud shing las me gud na med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di la bud shing bsreg go zhes bya mod kyi / bud shing las me gud na med pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is said, “Fuel is burned.”🔽But fire is not separate from fuel.

original: de bas na me ni rang gi bdag nyid sreg par byed pa nyid yin gyi gzhan dag sreg par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na me ni rang gi bdag nyid sreg par byed pa nyid yin gyi gzhan dag sreg par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, fire burns itself, but it does not burn other things.

original: ci ste gzhan pa nyid ma yin du zin kyang bud shing ni bsreg par bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ste gzhan pa nyid ma yin du zin kyang bud shing ni bsreg par bya ba'o //
translated: But if you think that even if they are not different, fuel is that which is burned,

original: me ni sreg par byed pa'o zhes rtog na /
analyzed: me ni sreg par byed pa'o zhes rtog na /
translated: and fire is that which burns,

original: kho bos kyang bud shing ni sreg par byed pa'o //
analyzed: kho bos kyang bud shing ni sreg par byed pa'o //
translated: we also say that fuel is that which burns,

original: me ni bsreg par bya ba'o //🔽zhes smra la rag go //
