analyzed: me ni bsreg par bya ba'o // zhes smra la rag go //
translated: and fire is that which is burned.

original: yang na khyad par gyi gtan tshigs bstan pa brjod dgos so //
analyzed: yang na khyad par gyi gtan tshigs bstan pa brjod dgos so //
translated: Or else, you must state a reason for the distinction.

original: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
translated: Ācārya Āryadeva also says:

original: mes ni tsha ba nyid bsreg ste //
analyzed: mes ni tsha ba nyid bsreg ste //
translated: Fire burns heat,

original: tsha ba la yin ji ltar bsreg / des na bud shing zhes bya med //
analyzed: tsha ba la yin ji ltar bsreg / des na bud shing zhes bya med //
translated: but how can it burn heat? Therefore fuel does not exist.

original: de ma gtogs par me yang med //🔽ces gsungs so //
analyzed: de ma gtogs par me yang med // ces gsungs so //
translated: Apart from that, fire does not exist.

original: de lta bas na me'i dpes nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na me'i dpes nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus the example of fire is not tenable.

original: 'di la kha cig me ni rang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag snang bar byed do snyam du sems pa des kyang nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di la kha cig me ni rang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag snang bar byed do snyam du sems pa des kyang nus pa ma yin te /
translated: In this regard, someone might think that fire illuminates itself and another, but that is not tenable.

original: me ni ji ltar rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag snang bar byed pa de bzhin du rang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag sreg par yang byed pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: me ni ji ltar rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag snang bar byed pa de bzhin du rang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag sreg par yang byed pa'i rigs so //
translated: Just as fire illuminates itself and others, so it would be logical that fire burns itself and others.

original: 'on kyang gzhan dag sreg par byed pa nyid yin gyi rang gi bdag nyid sreg par byed pa ni ma yin no zhe na /🔽de ltar na yang mes ji ltar gzhan dag sreg par byed kyi /
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan dag sreg par byed pa nyid yin gyi rang gi bdag nyid sreg par byed pa ni ma yin no zhe na / de ltar na yang mes ji ltar gzhan dag sreg par byed kyi /
translated: But fire burns others and does not burn itself.

original: rang gi bdag nyid sreg par mi byed pa de bzhin du lta ba yang gzhan dag la lta bar byed kyi /
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid sreg par mi byed pa de bzhin du lta ba yang gzhan dag la lta bar byed kyi /
translated: If that is so, then just as fire burns others and does not burn itself, so too seeing sees others and does not see itself.

original: rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed do zhes bya ba de ji ltar rung ste /🔽mi ji ltar rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag snang bar byed pa de bzhin du lta ba yang ni gal te lta ba yin na /
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed do zhes bya ba de ji ltar rung ste / mi ji ltar rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag snang bar byed pa de bzhin du lta ba yang ni gal te lta ba yin na /
translated: How could that be possible?

original: rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag la lta bar byed do //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag la lta bar byed do //
translated: Just as a person illuminates himself and others, so too if seeing sees itself and others,

original: zhes bya ba de lta bur yang ci'i phyir mi 'gyur /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de lta bur yang ci'i phyir mi 'gyur /
translated: why wouldn’t it be logical to say that seeing sees itself and others?

original: bdag nyid bdag nyid la lta'o zhes kyang zer la /
analyzed: bdag nyid bdag nyid la lta'o zhes kyang zer la /
translated: But it is also said that “the self sees itself.”

original: de bzhin du 'jig rten na smra ba po dag bdag nyid kyis bdag nyid 'dzin to zhes kyang zer bas /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig rten na smra ba po dag bdag nyid kyis bdag nyid 'dzin to zhes kyang zer bas /
translated: And in the same way, worldly people say, “I myself hold myself.”

original: de'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid la 'jug pa'i tshig gis na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid la 'jug pa'i tshig gis na /
translated: Therefore, because of the expression “it engages itself,”

original: lta ba rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir me'i dpes nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lta ba rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir me'i dpes nus pa ma yin no //
translated: the example of fire is not able to establish seeing.

original: yang gzhan yang /🔽song dang ma song bgom pa yis //🔽de ni ltar bcas lan btab po //
analyzed: yang gzhan yang / song dang ma song bgom pa yis // de ni ltar bcas lan btab po //
translated: Moreover:

original: ltar bcas zhes bya ba ni lta ba dang bcas pa'o //🔽gang zhe na /🔽me'i @176a * //
analyzed: ltar bcas zhes bya ba ni lta ba dang bcas pa'o // gang zhe na / me'i @176a * //
translated: The reply to that is given by “gone,” “not gone,” and “that being gone over.”🔽“That” refers to the example of fire.

original: dpe ste / dpe dang lta ba de gnyi ga mtshungs par lan btab zin to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dpe ste / dpe dang lta ba de gnyi ga mtshungs par lan btab zin to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The reply is given by both the example and seeing.

original: gang gis lan btab ce na /
analyzed: gang gis lan btab ce na /
translated: What is the reply?

original: song ba dang / ma song ba dang / bgom pa dag gis te /
analyzed: song ba dang / ma song ba dang / bgom pa dag gis te /
translated: “Gone,” “not gone,” and “that being gone over.”

original: ji ltar song ba dang / bgom pa brtag par spong ba la yang 'gro ba med /
analyzed: ji ltar song ba dang / bgom pa brtag par spong ba la yang 'gro ba med /
translated: Just as it was refuted in the examination of “that being gone over,” “that not yet gone over,” and “that being traversed,” going does not exist.

original: ma song ba la yang med /
analyzed: ma song ba la yang med /
translated: Going does not exist on that being gone over.🔽Going does not exist on that not yet gone over.

original: bgom pa la yang 'gro ba med do //
analyzed: bgom pa la yang 'gro ba med do //
translated: Going does not exist on that being gone over.

original: zhes bshad pa de bzhin du mes kyang bsregs pa yang sreg par mi byed /
analyzed: zhes bshad pa de bzhin du mes kyang bsregs pa yang sreg par mi byed /
translated: Just as it is said, fire does not burn what is already burned,

original: ma bsregs pa yang sreg par mi byed /
analyzed: ma bsregs pa yang sreg par mi byed /
translated: nor does it burn what is not yet burned.

original: lta ba yang bltas pa la yang lta bar mi byed /
analyzed: lta ba yang bltas pa la yang lta bar mi byed /
translated: Nor does seeing see what is already seen,

original: ma bltas pa la yang lta bar mi byed /
analyzed: ma bltas pa la yang lta bar mi byed /
translated: nor does it see what is not yet seen.

original: lta ba la yang lta bar mi byed do //
analyzed: lta ba la yang lta bar mi byed do //
translated: Nor does seeing see seeing itself.

original: de ltar me yang sreg par mi byed la /
analyzed: de ltar me yang sreg par mi byed la /
translated: Thus, fire does not burn,

original: lta ba yang lta bar mi byed na ci zhig gang gi dper 'gyur /
analyzed: lta ba yang lta bar mi byed na ci zhig gang gi dper 'gyur /
translated: and seeing does not see. So what is the example of what?

original: de'i phyir yang lta ba rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir me'i dpes nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang lta ba rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir me'i dpes nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the example of fire is not capable of establishing seeing.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: gang tshe cung zad mi lta ba //
analyzed: gang tshe cung zad mi lta ba //
translated: When it does not see the slightest thing,

original: lta bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lta bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not seeing.🔽How could it be tenable

original: lta bas lta bar byed ces byar //🔽de ni ji ltar rigs par 'gyur //
analyzed: lta bas lta bar byed ces byar //🔽de ni ji ltar rigs par 'gyur //
translated: to say that seeing sees seeing?

original: 'di ltar khyod kyis gzugs la lta bar byed pas lta ba'o zhes smras pa ni byed pa po la bya ba'i rkyen brjod nas lta bar byed pas lta ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar khyod kyis gzugs la lta bar byed pas lta ba'o zhes smras pa ni byed pa po la bya ba'i rkyen brjod nas lta bar byed pas lta ba yin no //
translated: Thus, when you say, “It is seeing because it sees visible form,” you state the condition of seeing as the agent.

original: de'i phyir lta ba nyid na lta ba yin gyi mi lta ba ni ma yin no //🔽de'i phyir gang gi che na lta ba nyid na lta ba yin gyi mi lta ba na ma yin pa de'i tshe lta bar byed pas lta ba'o zhes bya ba de smra ba ji ltar rigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir lta ba nyid na lta ba yin gyi mi lta ba ni ma yin no // de'i phyir gang gi che na lta ba nyid na lta ba yin gyi mi lta ba na ma yin pa de'i tshe lta bar byed pas lta ba'o zhes bya ba de smra ba ji ltar rigs par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, it is seeing when it sees, but it is not seeing when it does not see.🔽Thus, when it is seeing, it is seeing, but when it is not seeing, it is not seeing. In that case, how could it be logical to say, “It is seeing because it sees”?

original: 'di la gang gis lta bar byed do //
analyzed: 'di la gang gis lta bar byed do //
translated: In this regard, how could it be logical to say, “It sees”?

original: zhes bya ba de rigs par 'gyur ba lta ba'i bya ba gnyis pa de ga la yod /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de rigs par 'gyur ba lta ba'i bya ba gnyis pa de ga la yod /
translated: How could there be a second action of seeing?

original: ci ste 'di la lta ba'i bya ba gnyis pa med bzhin du yang rab tu rtog na /
analyzed: ci ste 'di la lta ba'i bya ba gnyis pa med bzhin du yang rab tu rtog na /
translated: But if you imagine that a second action of seeing exists even though it does not,

original: de lta bas na yang lta ba gnyis su thal ba dang / lta ba po yang gnyis su thal bar 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de lta bas na yang lta ba gnyis su thal ba dang / lta ba po yang gnyis su thal bar 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod do //
translated: then it follows that there would be two seeings and two viewers, but that is unacceptable.

original: de lta bas na gzugs la lta bar byed pas lta ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na gzugs la lta bar byed pas lta ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is seeing because it sees visible form.🔽

original: zhes bya ba de mi 'thad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de mi 'thad do //
translated: Thus, it is untenable to state, “It is seeing because it sees form.”🔽If you think, “It is not tenable that the error of two actions of seeing

original: ci ste thal ba'i bya ba gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ba'i skyon der gyur na mi rung ngo //
analyzed: ci ste thal ba'i bya ba gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ba'i skyon der gyur na mi rung ngo //
translated: would ensue,”

original: snyam nas lta ba nyid lta ba'i bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir lta bar byed pas lta ba'o zhe na /
analyzed: snyam nas lta ba nyid lta ba'i bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir lta bar byed pas lta ba'o zhe na /
translated: and you say, “It is seeing because seeing itself possesses the action of seeing,”

original: de la bshad pa /
analyzed: de la bshad pa /
translated: then Nāgārjuna addresses this point:

original: lta ba lta nyid ma yin te //
analyzed: lta ba lta nyid ma yin te //
translated: Seeing is not seeing itself.

original: lta ba lta bar byed pa nyid do //🔽zhes de ltar rtog na de yang mi rigs pa ma yin te lta bar byed do //
analyzed: lta ba lta bar byed pa nyid do // zhes de ltar rtog na de yang mi rigs pa ma yin te lta bar byed do //
translated: If you think, “It is seeing because it sees,”

original: zhes bya ba de la @176b lta ba'i bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de la @176b lta ba'i bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that also is not tenable because in that statement “it sees,” the action of seeing does not exist.

original: de de la 'di snyam du skyon der gyur na mi rung bas lta bar byed do //
analyzed: de de la 'di snyam du skyon der gyur na mi rung bas lta bar byed do //
translated: If you think, “Because it is untenable that such an error would ensue, it sees

original: zhes bya ba de nyid lta ba'i bya ba dang ldan par sems na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de nyid lta ba'i bya ba dang ldan par sems na /
translated: itself possesses the action of seeing,”

original: de lta bshad pa /
analyzed: de lta bshad pa /
translated: then Nāgārjuna explains:

original: lta ba min pa mi lta nyid //
analyzed: lta ba min pa mi lta nyid //
translated: That which is not seeing does not see.

original: de lta na yang lta ba'i bya ba dang bral ba'i lta ba ni lta ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang lta ba'i bya ba dang bral ba'i lta ba ni lta ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if that were so, then seeing would be seeing that is devoid of the activity of seeing.

original: de la lta ba ma yin pa ji ltar lta bar byed do //
analyzed: de la lta ba ma yin pa ji ltar lta bar byed do //
translated: How could that which is not seeing see?

original: zhes byar ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: zhes byar ni mi rung ste /
translated: It is not tenable to say,

original: 'di ltar lta ba ma yin pa ji ltar lta bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar lta ba ma yin pa ji ltar lta bar 'gyur /
translated: “How could that which is not seeing see?”

original: ci ste lta na ni sor mo'i rtse mo yang lta bar 'gyur ba zhig na mi lta ste /
analyzed: ci ste lta na ni sor mo'i rtse mo yang lta bar 'gyur ba zhig na mi lta ste /
translated: If it did see, then the tip of a finger would see. But it does not see.

original: de lta bas na lta ba ma yin pa lta bar byed do zhes bya ba de yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de lta bas na lta ba ma yin pa lta bar byed do zhes bya ba de yang mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore it is not tenable to say, “That which is not seeing sees.”

original: smras pa / bya ba'i rkyen 'di ni byed pa la brjod pa yin gyi byed pa po la ma yin pas /
analyzed: smras pa / bya ba'i rkyen 'di ni byed pa la brjod pa yin gyi byed pa po la ma yin pas /
translated: Objection: This condition of action is stated in terms of the agent, not the action.

original: 'dis lta bar byed pas lta ba ste /
analyzed: 'dis lta bar byed pas lta ba ste /
translated: Since it sees, it is seeing.

original: gang zhig lta bar byed ce na /
analyzed: gang zhig lta bar byed ce na /
translated: What is it that sees?

original: lta ba po'o //🔽bshad pa / lta ba nyid kyis lta ba po'ang //
analyzed: lta ba po'o // bshad pa / lta ba nyid kyis lta ba po'ang //
translated: The seer.🔽In response Nāgārjuna explains:🔽The seer should be understood

original: rnam par bshad par shes par bya //🔽'di la / lta ba rang gi bdag nyid ni //
analyzed: rnam par bshad par shes par bya // 'di la / lta ba rang gi bdag nyid ni //
translated: to be explained by seeing itself.🔽Here,🔽seeing does not see

original: de ni de la mi lta nyid //
analyzed: de ni de la mi lta nyid //
translated: its own nature.

original: gang zhig bdag la mi lta bar //
analyzed: gang zhig bdag la mi lta bar //
translated: But if it does not see itself,

original: de gzhan dag la ji ltar lta //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag gis lta bas lta bar byed do zhes bya ba de bsal zin te /
analyzed: de gzhan dag la ji ltar lta // zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag gis lta bas lta bar byed do zhes bya ba de bsal zin te /
translated: how can it see another?🔽Thus, the statement “seeing sees” has been refuted.

original: lta bas bsal ba de nyid kyis lta ba po yang bsal ba nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: lta bas bsal ba de nyid kyis lta ba po yang bsal ba nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: And just as seeing has been refuted, so too should one understand that the seer has been refuted.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'dir don gzhan cung zad ma smras pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir don gzhan cung zad ma smras pa ste /
translated: Because nothing else has been stated here.

original: mig lta ba po nyid yin no zhes bya ba btang ste bdag lta ba po yin no zhes smras pa 'ba' zhig tu zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig lta ba po nyid yin no zhes bya ba btang ste bdag lta ba po yin no zhes smras pa 'ba' zhig tu zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement “the eye is the seer” has been abandoned and only the statement “the self is the seer” remains.

original: de la lta ba la lta ba por rtog gam bdag la lta ba por rtog kyang rung ste bsal ba'i gtan tshigs dag ni mtshungs so //
analyzed: de la lta ba la lta ba por rtog gam bdag la lta ba por rtog kyang rung ste bsal ba'i gtan tshigs dag ni mtshungs so //
translated: Whether one conceives the seer in the context of seeing or the self in the context of the seer, the refutation is the same.

original: 'dir skyon gzhan 'di yang yod de /
analyzed: 'dir skyon gzhan 'di yang yod de /
translated: Here is another fault.

original: lta ba pos lta bas lta bar byed na lta ba gsum du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lta ba pos lta bas lta bar byed na lta ba gsum du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the seer sees by means of seeing, then it follows that there are three seeings.

original: smras pa / lta bas lta bar byed zhe'am lta ba pos lta bar byed do zhes bya ba 'dis kho bo la ci bya /
analyzed: smras pa / lta bas lta bar byed zhe'am lta ba pos lta bar byed do zhes bya ba 'dis kho bo la ci bya /
translated: Objection: What is the point of saying “seeing sees” or “the seer sees”?

original: yong ni blta bar bya ba bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa dag yod pa la gang gis lta bar byed pa'i lta ba de ni yod do /
analyzed: yong ni blta bar bya ba bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa dag yod pa la gang gis lta bar byed pa'i lta ba de ni yod do /
translated: But when the object seen, such as a pot or cloth, exists, then the seeing that sees it exists.

original: bshad pa / ci khyod sa mkhan med par 'brog dgon par 'thom mam /
analyzed: bshad pa / ci khyod sa mkhan med par 'brog dgon par 'thom mam /
translated: Response: Are you wandering in the wilderness without a guide?

original: khyod lta ba po med par blta bar bya ba dang lta ba yod par 'dod ko //🔽ma spangs lta bo yod min te //
analyzed: khyod lta ba po med par blta bar bya ba dang lta ba yod par 'dod ko // ma spangs lta bo yod min te //
translated: You assert that the object seen and seeing exist without a seer.🔽Without an abandoned seer,

original: lta ba spangs par gyur kyang ngo //🔽lta bo med na blta bya dang // lta ba de dag @177a * //
analyzed: lta ba spangs par gyur kyang ngo // lta bo med na blta bya dang // lta ba de dag @177a * //
translated: there is no abandonment of seeing.🔽If there is no seer,

original: ga la yod //🔽'di la lta ba nyid na lta ba po yin gyi mi lta na ma yin no //🔽zhes sngar bstan pa des na lta ba dang ldan pa'i phyir lta ba po yin pas lta ba po lta bar byed do //
analyzed: ga la yod // 'di la lta ba nyid na lta ba po yin gyi mi lta na ma yin no // zhes sngar bstan pa des na lta ba dang ldan pa'i phyir lta ba po yin pas lta ba po lta bar byed do //
translated: how could there be the object seen and seeing?🔽Here, if seeing exists, then the seer exists, but if it does not see, it does not.

original: zhes bya ba de mi 'thad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de mi 'thad do //
translated: Since this was previously explained, because the seer possesses seeing, it is untenable to say “the seer sees.”

original: lta ba'i bya ba gnyis la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ba'i bya ba gnyis la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the two actions of seeing do not exist.

original: de ltar re zhig lta ba ma spangs na lta ba po ma yin pas lta ba po med do //🔽da ni lta ba po ma yin pa yang lta bar mi byed pa nyid de /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig lta ba ma spangs na lta ba po ma yin pas lta ba po med do // da ni lta ba po ma yin pa yang lta bar mi byed pa nyid de /
translated: Thus, if seeing does not exist, then the seer does not exist because he is not a seer.🔽Now, it is also shown that the nonseer does not see because he is devoid of the action of seeing.

original: lta ba'i bya ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa de bzhin du lta ba spangs par gyur na yang lta ba po med do //
analyzed: lta ba'i bya ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa de bzhin du lta ba spangs par gyur na yang lta ba po med do //
translated: In the same way, if seeing is abandoned, then the seer does not exist.

original: de la lta ba spangs kyang rung ma spangs kyang rung ste lta ba po med na khyod kyi blta bar bya ba dang lta ba yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de la lta ba spangs kyang rung ma spangs kyang rung ste lta ba po med na khyod kyi blta bar bya ba dang lta ba yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: In that regard, whether seeing is abandoned or not, if the seer does not exist, how could the seen and seeing exist for you?

original: 'di ltar gang gis lta bar byed pas blta bar bya ba yin na gang gis lta bar byed pas de ni med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gis lta bar byed pas blta bar bya ba yin na gang gis lta bar byed pas de ni med do //
translated: In this way, if something is seen because of seeing, then that does not exist because of seeing.

original: de med na gang gis lta bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de med na gang gis lta bar 'gyur /
translated: If that does not exist, then what would see?

original: mi lta na blta bar bya bar ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: mi lta na blta bar bya bar ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If it does not see, then how could it be the seen?

original: 'ga' zhig gis gang gis lta bar byed pa de ni de'i lta ba yin na gang gis lta bar byed pa de ni med do //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis gang gis lta bar byed pa de ni de'i lta ba yin na gang gis lta bar byed pa de ni med do //
translated: Some say: If that by which one sees is seeing, then that by which one sees does not exist.

original: de med na gang gis lta bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de med na gang gis lta bar 'gyur te /
translated: If that does not exist, then by what will one see?

original: de lta bas na lta ba po med na blta bar bya ba dang lta ba mi 'thad pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bas na lta ba po med na blta bar bya ba dang lta ba mi 'thad pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, if the seer does not exist, then the seen and seeing are untenable.

original: de'i phyir skye mched rnams yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir skye mched rnams yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the sense spheres do not exist.

original: smras pa / skye mched rnams ni yod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / skye mched rnams ni yod pa nyid yin te /
translated: Objection: The sense spheres do exist.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: rnam par shes pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because consciousness exists.

original: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa dngos po rnams dmigs par byed pa ni yod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa dngos po rnams dmigs par byed pa ni yod do //
translated: Thus, consciousness that observes things exists.

original: de yod pa'i phyir skye mched rnams kyang yod do //
analyzed: de yod pa'i phyir skye mched rnams kyang yod do //
translated: Because it exists, the sense spheres also exist.🔽In response Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / blta bya lta ba med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bshad pa / blta bya lta ba med pa'i phyir //
translated: Because the seen and seeing do not exist,

original: rnam par shes la sogs pa bzhi //🔽yod min nye bar len la sogs //
analyzed: rnam par shes la sogs pa bzhi // yod min nye bar len la sogs //
translated: The four such as consciousness🔽Do not exist. How could

original: ji lta bur na yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji lta bur na yod par 'gyur //
translated: The appropriator and so on exist?

original: gang gi tshe lta ba po med na blta bar bya ba dang lta ba mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe lta ba po med na blta bar bya ba dang lta ba mi 'thad do //
translated: When the seer does not exist, the seen and seeing are untenable.🔽

original: zhes bshad pa de'i tshe gnas med par rnam par shes pa ji ltar yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bshad pa de'i tshe gnas med par rnam par shes pa ji ltar yod par 'gyur te /
translated: When it is said that if there is no seer, then the seen and seeing are untenable, then how could consciousness exist without a basis?

original: 'di ltar blta bar bya ba las gzhan ci zhig rnam par shes par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar blta bar bya ba las gzhan ci zhig rnam par shes par 'gyur /
translated: In this way, what other than the seen would consciousness be conscious of?

original: lta ba med na rnam par shes pa ltos pa med par ji ltar yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: lta ba med na rnam par shes pa ltos pa med par ji ltar yod par 'gyur /
translated: If seeing does not exist, how could consciousness exist without a basis?

original: ci ste 'gyur na ni long ba la yod par 'gyur ba zhig na mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste 'gyur na ni long ba la yod par 'gyur ba zhig na mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it did, then it would exist for the blind, but it does not.

original: de lta bas na blta bar bya ba dang lta ba med na gnas med par rnam par shes pa yod par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na blta bar bya ba dang lta ba med na gnas med par rnam par shes pa yod par mi 'thad do //
translated: Thus, if the seen and seeing do not exist, it is untenable that consciousness exists without a basis.

original: rnam par shes pa med na reg pa ga la yod //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa med na reg pa ga la yod //
translated: If consciousness does not exist, how could contact exist?

original: reg pa med na tshor @177b ba ga la yod //
analyzed: reg pa med na tshor @177b ba ga la yod //
translated: If contact does not exist, how could feeling exist?

original: tshor ba med na sred pa ga la yod //
analyzed: tshor ba med na sred pa ga la yod //
translated: If feeling does not exist, how could craving exist?

original: de bzhin du nye bar len pa dang srid pa dang / skye ba dang rga shi dag kyang yod par ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du nye bar len pa dang srid pa dang / skye ba dang rga shi dag kyang yod par ga la 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, how could appropriation, becoming, birth, and aging and death exist?

original: de bas na skye mched rnams ni yod pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na skye mched rnams ni yod pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the sense-spheres do not exist.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /🔽de la 'phags pa nyan thos ni mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs gang dag 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba 'di dag la rtag pa nyid dam brtan pa nyid dam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang / de la 'phags pa nyan thos ni mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs gang dag 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba 'di dag la rtag pa nyid dam brtan pa nyid dam /
translated: The Lord also said:

original: de bzhin nyid dam gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dam /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dam gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dam /
translated: “Here, the noble disciple, with regard to the forms cognizable by the eye, whether past, future, or present, does not consider anything as ‘permanent,’ ‘stable,’🔽‘eternal,’ ‘not alterable into something else.’

original: ma nor ba de bzhin nyid ni 'ga' yang med kyi sgyu ma de ni yod do //
analyzed: ma nor ba de bzhin nyid ni 'ga' yang med kyi sgyu ma de ni yod do //
translated: But the illusion exists.

original: sgyu mar byas pa de ni yod do //
analyzed: sgyu mar byas pa de ni yod do //
translated: The creation of the illusion exists.

original: sems rmongs par byed pa de ni yod de /
analyzed: sems rmongs par byed pa de ni yod de /
translated: The delusion of the mind exists.

original: de ni gyi na zhig yod do //
analyzed: de ni gyi na zhig yod do //
translated: It is somewhere.

original: snyam du de ltar so sor rtog par byed do //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: snyam du de ltar so sor rtog par byed do // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus he discerns it individually.

original: smras pa / khyod kyis re zhig lta ba ni bkag na nyan pa la sogs pa ni ma bkag pas des na nyan pa la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir dngos po rnams yod do //
analyzed: smras pa / khyod kyis re zhig lta ba ni bkag na nyan pa la sogs pa ni ma bkag pas des na nyan pa la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir dngos po rnams yod do //
translated: Objection: You have refuted seeing, but you have not refuted hearing, etc. Therefore, since hearing, etc. exist, entities exist.

original: bshad pa / lta bas nyan dang snom pa dang // myong bar byed dang reg byed yid //
analyzed: bshad pa / lta bas nyan dang snom pa dang // myong bar byed dang reg byed yid //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: Seeing, hearing, smelling, Tasting, touching, and mental cognition,

original: nyan pa po dang mnyan la sogs //
analyzed: nyan pa po dang mnyan la sogs //
translated: The hearer, the heard, and so on,

original: rnam par bshad par shes par bya //
analyzed: rnam par bshad par shes par bya //
translated: Should be understood as explained.

original: nyan pa la sogs pa de dag ni rnam par bshad pa nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: nyan pa la sogs pa de dag ni rnam par bshad pa nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: Those such as hearing should be understood as explained.

original: gang gis rnam par bshad ce na /
analyzed: gang gis rnam par bshad ce na /
translated: By what are they explained?

original: lta ba nyid kyis te /
analyzed: lta ba nyid kyis te /
translated: By seeing itself.

original: ji ltar lta ba rnam pa thams cad du brtags na mi 'thad pa de bzhin du nyan pa la sogs pa dag kyang shes par bya'o //🔽ji ltar lta ba po mi 'thad pa de bzhin du nyan pa po la sogs pa dag kyang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar lta ba rnam pa thams cad du brtags na mi 'thad pa de bzhin du nyan pa la sogs pa dag kyang shes par bya'o // ji ltar lta ba po mi 'thad pa de bzhin du nyan pa po la sogs pa dag kyang shes par bya'o //
translated: Just as seeing is not tenable when analyzed in any way, so too hearing and so on should be understood.🔽Just as the seer is not tenable, so too the hearer and so on should be understood.

original: ji ltar blta bar bya ba bsal ba de bzhin du mnyan par bya ba la sogs pa dag kyang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar blta bar bya ba bsal ba de bzhin du mnyan par bya ba la sogs pa dag kyang shes par bya'o //
translated: Just as the seen is refuted, so too the heard and so on should be understood.

original: de lta byas na skye mched rnams kyang stong pa nyid du grub par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta byas na skye mched rnams kyang stong pa nyid du grub par shes par bya'o //
translated: In this way, you should understand that the sense bases are also established as emptiness.

original: skye mched brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa gsum pa'o /
analyzed: skye mched brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa gsum pa'o /
translated: This is the third chapter, called Critique of the Faculties.

original: // /'dir smras pa /
analyzed: // /'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: 'di la gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga po dag bstan to //
analyzed: 'di la gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga po dag bstan to //
translated: The five aggregates, such as form, are taught.

original: de dag sdug bsngal lo zhes gsungs te //
analyzed: de dag sdug bsngal lo zhes gsungs te //
translated: They are said to be suffering.

original: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden par gsungs so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden par gsungs so //
translated: They are taught to be the truth of suffering for the noble ones.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa gang yin pa de ni med par ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa gang yin pa de ni med par ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: How could that which is the truth of the noble ones be nonexistent?

original: de bas na phung po rnams ni yod do //
analyzed: de bas na phung po rnams ni yod do //
translated: Therefore the aggregates exist.🔽In response, Aryadeva says:

original: bshad pa / gzugs kyi rgyu ni ma gtogs par //
analyzed: bshad pa / gzugs kyi rgyu ni ma gtogs par //
translated: Apart from the cause of form,

original: gzugs ni dmigs par mi 'gyur @178a * //
analyzed: gzugs ni dmigs par mi 'gyur @178a * //
translated: form is not observed.

original: ro // 'di la 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag ni gzugs kyi rgyur bstan /
analyzed: ro // 'di la 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag ni gzugs kyi rgyur bstan /
translated: Here the four great elements are taught to be the cause of form.

original: gzugs ni de dag gi 'bras bur bstan na /
analyzed: gzugs ni de dag gi 'bras bur bstan na /
translated: Form is taught to be their effect.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag ma gtogs par 'byung ba chen po bzhi po de dag las don gzhan du gyur pa gzugs zhes bya bar 'bras bu ni ci yang med de /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag ma gtogs par 'byung ba chen po bzhi po de dag las don gzhan du gyur pa gzugs zhes bya bar 'bras bu ni ci yang med de /
translated: Apart from the four great elements, there is no effect called “form” that is a different object from the four great elements.

original: de lta bas na gzugs ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na gzugs ni mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore form is untenable.

original: smras pa / re zhig 'byung ba dag ni yod de /
analyzed: smras pa / re zhig 'byung ba dag ni yod de /
translated: Objection: First, the primary elements exist.

original: de la rgyu yod pa'i phyir 'bras bu yang yod pas gzugs kyang rab tu grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la rgyu yod pa'i phyir 'bras bu yang yod pas gzugs kyang rab tu grub pa nyid do //
translated: Since the cause exists, the effect also exists. Therefore form is fully established.🔽In response Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / gzugs zhes bya ba ma gtogs par //
analyzed: bshad pa / gzugs zhes bya ba ma gtogs par //
translated: Apart from what is called form,

original: gzugs kyi rgyu yang mi snang ngo //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rgyu yang mi snang ngo //
translated: the cause of form is not seen.

original: gzugs ma gtogs par yang 'di ni gzugs kyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: gzugs ma gtogs par yang 'di ni gzugs kyi rgyu'o //
translated: Apart from form, “This is the cause of form.”

original: zhes bya ba mi snang ba nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba mi snang ba nyid do //
translated: That is not seen.

original: gzugs ni mi 'thad par smras zin te /
analyzed: gzugs ni mi 'thad par smras zin te /
translated: Form has already been refuted as untenable.

original: de ltar gzugs mi 'thad pa'i phyir gzugs kyi rgyu yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de ltar gzugs mi 'thad pa'i phyir gzugs kyi rgyu yang mi 'thad do //
translated: Since form is untenable in that way, the cause of form is also untenable.

original: smras pa // 'di la khyod rgyu la brten nas 'bras bu sel bar byed cing /
analyzed: smras pa // 'di la khyod rgyu la brten nas 'bras bu sel bar byed cing /
translated: Objection: In this regard, you refute the effect in reliance on the cause,

original: 'bras bu la brten nas rgyu sel bar byed pas de la gang la brten nas gzhan zhig sel bar byed pa de ni re zhig yod do //
analyzed: 'bras bu la brten nas rgyu sel bar byed pas de la gang la brten nas gzhan zhig sel bar byed pa de ni re zhig yod do //
translated: and you refute the cause in reliance on the effect. Therefore that in reliance on which something is refuted exists first,

original: de yod na gzhan yang rab tu 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yod na gzhan yang rab tu 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: and if that exists, the other is also established.🔽In response Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / gzhan yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: bshad pa / gzhan yod pa nyid do //
translated: The existence of the other

original: zhes brjod par mi nus so //
analyzed: zhes brjod par mi nus so //
translated: cannot be stated.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Because,

original: 'di ltar / gzugs kyi rgyu ni ma gtogs par //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gzugs kyi rgyu ni ma gtogs par //
translated: apart from the cause of form,

original: gzugs na gzugs ni rgyu med par //🔽thal bar 'gyur te don gang yang //
analyzed: gzugs na gzugs ni rgyu med par // thal bar 'gyur te don gang yang //
translated: form would be without a cause.🔽But no object whatsoever

original: rgyu med pa ni gang na'ang med /
analyzed: rgyu med pa ni gang na'ang med /
translated: exists without a cause.

original: gal te rgyu bas kyang 'bras bu yod na ni de'i tshe rgyu med pa can du 'gyur te /🔽don gang yang rgyu med pa can ni /
analyzed: gal te rgyu bas kyang 'bras bu yod na ni de'i tshe rgyu med pa can du 'gyur te / don gang yang rgyu med pa can ni /
translated: If the effect existed prior to the cause, then it would follow that it would be without a cause.🔽No object whatsoever

original: ma mthong zhing gang du yang ma bstan te /
analyzed: ma mthong zhing gang du yang ma bstan te /
translated: is seen or taught to be without a cause.

original: rtag tu thams cad las thams cad 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / rtsom pa thams cad don med pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu thams cad las thams cad 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / rtsom pa thams cad don med pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it would follow that everything would always arise from everything, and the error would ensue that all endeavor would be pointless.

original: de bzhin du /🔽gal te gzugs ni ma gtogs par //
analyzed: de bzhin du / gal te gzugs ni ma gtogs par //
translated: Similarly,🔽if the cause of form existed

original: gzugs kyi rgyu zhig yod na ni //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rgyu zhig yod na ni //
translated: apart from form,

original: 'bras bu med pa'i rgyur 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa'i rgyur 'gyur te //
translated: the cause would be without an effect.

original: 'bras bu med pa'i rgyu med do //
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa'i rgyu med do //
translated: But there is no cause without an effect.

original: gal te 'bras bu bsal kyang rgyu yod na ni rgyu de 'bras bu med pa can du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu bsal kyang rgyu yod na ni rgyu de 'bras bu med pa can du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the cause existed even when the effect was eliminated, then it would follow that the cause would be without an effect.

original: 'bras bu med pa can gyi rgyu ni med de /
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa can gyi rgyu ni med de /
translated: A cause that has no effect does not exist.

original: 'di ni 'di'i'o zhes bya ba'i tha snyad kyang mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / thams cad kyi rgyu thams cad yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'di'i'o zhes bya ba'i tha snyad kyang mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / thams cad kyi rgyu thams cad yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because the convention “this is the cause of that” is untenable, and because it follows that everything would be the cause of everything.

original: de lta bas @178b na gzugs kyi rgyu dag kyang mi 'thad pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: de lta bas @178b na gzugs kyi rgyu dag kyang mi 'thad pa nyid yin la /
translated: Therefore, it is untenable that the causes of form exist.

original: gzugs kyang 'bras bur mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gzugs kyang 'bras bur mi 'thad do //
translated: And it is also untenable that form is an effect.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover:

original: gzugs yod na yang gzugs kyi ni //
analyzed: gzugs yod na yang gzugs kyi ni //
translated: Even if form exists,

original: rgyu yang 'thad par mi 'gyur nyid //
analyzed: rgyu yang 'thad par mi 'gyur nyid //
translated: the cause of form is untenable.

original: gzugs med na yang gzugs kyi ni //
analyzed: gzugs med na yang gzugs kyi ni //
translated: Even if form does not exist,

original: rgyu yang 'thad par mi 'gyur nyid //
analyzed: rgyu yang 'thad par mi 'gyur nyid //
translated: the cause of form is untenable.

original: 'di la gzugs kyi rgyu ci zhig brtags na gzugs yod pa la brtag gam /
analyzed: 'di la gzugs kyi rgyu ci zhig brtags na gzugs yod pa la brtag gam /
translated: Here, if you imagine what is the cause of form, is it imagined in form that exists?

original: 'on te gzugs med pa la brtag grang na /
analyzed: 'on te gzugs med pa la brtag grang na /
translated: Or is it imagined in form that does not exist?

original: gzugs yod pa la ni gzugs kyi rgyu mi 'thad de /
analyzed: gzugs yod pa la ni gzugs kyi rgyu mi 'thad de /
translated: The cause of form is untenable in form that exists.

original: med pa la yang mi 'thad do //🔽de la re zhig yod pa ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: med pa la yang mi 'thad do // de la re zhig yod pa ni mi 'thad de /
translated: It is also untenable in form that does not exist.🔽First, it is untenable that it exists.

original: 'di ltar yod pa la rgyus ci zhig bya /
analyzed: 'di ltar yod pa la rgyus ci zhig bya /
translated: In that case, what would a cause do for that which exists?

original: ci ste yod pa la yang rgyu'i bya ba yod par 'gyur na ni nam yang mi bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste yod pa la yang rgyu'i bya ba yod par 'gyur na ni nam yang mi bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the activity of a cause were to exist in regard to an existent, then it would never not be active.

original: de yang mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de yang mi 'dod de /
translated: But that is unacceptable.

original: de lta bas na gzugs yod pa la gzugs kyi rgyu mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na gzugs yod pa la gzugs kyi rgyu mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is untenable that the cause of form exists in regard to existent form.

original: gzugs med pa la yang gzugs kyi rgyu mi 'thad de /
analyzed: gzugs med pa la yang gzugs kyi rgyu mi 'thad de /
translated: Also, the cause of form is untenable in regard to non-existent form.

original: 'di ltar gzugs med na de gang gi rgyur 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs med na de gang gi rgyur 'gyur /
translated: In this way, if form does not exist, what would be the cause of that?

original: de lta bas na gzugs med pa la yang gzugs kyi rgyu mi 'thad do //🔽de ni rkyen dgag par yang med dam /🔽yod pa'i don la yang /🔽rkyen ni rung ba ma yin te //
analyzed: de lta bas na gzugs med pa la yang gzugs kyi rgyu mi 'thad do // de ni rkyen dgag par yang med dam / yod pa'i don la yang / rkyen ni rung ba ma yin te //
translated: Therefore, the cause of form is untenable in regard to non-existent form.

original: zhes rab tu bstan zin mod kyi /
analyzed: zhes rab tu bstan zin mod kyi /
translated: This has already been taught in the following:🔽“The condition is not tenable in regard to an existent object,🔽nor is the condition tenable in regard to a non-existent object.”

original: yang 'di yang skabs su bab pas bstan to //
analyzed: yang 'di yang skabs su bab pas bstan to //
translated: But this is also relevant here, so it is taught.

original: rgyu med pa yi gzugs dag ni //
analyzed: rgyu med pa yi gzugs dag ni //
translated: Form without a cause

original: 'thad par mi rung rung min nyid //
analyzed: 'thad par mi rung rung min nyid //
translated: is untenable; it is not tenable.

original: rgyu ma bstan pa glo bur gyi gzugs ni 'thad par mi rung ba nyid de rung ba ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu ma bstan pa glo bur gyi gzugs ni 'thad par mi rung ba nyid de rung ba ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Form that is causeless and adventitious is untenable; it is not tenable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rtag tu thams cad 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / rtsom pa thams cad don med pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu thams cad 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / rtsom pa thams cad don med pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that everything would always arise, and because the error would arise that all activity would be pointless.

original: de bas na rgyu med pa can gyi phyogs ni thams cad kho na yin pa'i phyir 'thad par mi rung ba nyid de rung ba ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na rgyu med pa can gyi phyogs ni thams cad kho na yin pa'i phyir 'thad par mi rung ba nyid de rung ba ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, because the position of causelessness is entirely untenable, it is not tenable, it is not reasonable.

original: zhes yang dang yang du nges par bzung ste bshad do //
analyzed: zhes yang dang yang du nges par bzung ste bshad do //
translated: Thus, it is explained again and again with certainty.

original: de phyir gzugs kyi rnam par rtog /'ga' yang rnam par brtag mi bya //
analyzed: de phyir gzugs kyi rnam par rtog /'ga' yang rnam par brtag mi bya //
translated: Therefore, one should not imagine any conceptualization of form.

original: gang gi phyir gzugs kyi rgyu ma gtogs par gzugs dmigs par mi 'gyur ba dang / gzugs yod pa dang med pa la yang gzugs kyi rgyu mi 'thad pa dang / rgyu med pa'i gzugs ni 'thad par mi rung ba nyid de rung ba ma yin pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir khyod lta bu mkhas pa'i rang bzhin can de kho na rtogs par 'dod pas gzugs kyi rnam par rtog pa 'ga' yang rnam par brtag par mi bya
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs kyi rgyu ma gtogs par gzugs dmigs par mi 'gyur ba dang / gzugs yod pa dang med pa la yang gzugs kyi rgyu mi 'thad pa dang / rgyu med pa'i gzugs ni 'thad par mi rung ba nyid de rung ba ma yin pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir khyod lta bu mkhas pa'i rang bzhin can de kho na rtogs par 'dod pas gzugs kyi rnam par rtog pa 'ga' yang rnam par brtag par mi bya
translated: Because form is not observed apart from the cause of form, and it is untenable that the cause of form exists or does not exist, and it is not tenable that form is without a cause, therefore, you who are wise by nature and desire to understand reality should not imagine any conception of form at all.

original: bar rigs @179a * //
analyzed: bar rigs @179a * //
translated: It is reasonable to do so,

original: te / 'di ltar gnas med pa la bsam pa ji ltar rigs par 'gyur /
analyzed: te / 'di ltar gnas med pa la bsam pa ji ltar rigs par 'gyur /
translated: because how could it be reasonable to think about what is baseless?

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: 'bras bu rgyu dang 'dra ba zhis bya ba 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu rgyu dang 'dra ba zhis bya ba 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: it is not tenable to say that the effect is similar to the cause.🔽It is also not tenable to say that

original: 'bras bu rgyu dang mi 'dra zhes //🔽bya ba'ang 'thad pa ma yin no //🔽'bras bu dang rgyur brtags na //🔽'bras bu rgyu dang 'dra ba'am /
analyzed: 'bras bu rgyu dang mi 'dra zhes // bya ba'ang 'thad pa ma yin no // 'bras bu dang rgyur brtags na // 'bras bu rgyu dang 'dra ba'am /
translated: the effect is not similar to the cause.🔽When you investigate the effect and the cause,

original: mi 'dra bar brtag grang na /
analyzed: mi 'dra bar brtag grang na /
translated: is the effect similar to the cause🔽or is it not similar to the cause?

original: de la 'bras bu rgyu dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni phyogs de la ni gzugs 'byung ba rnams kyi 'bras bur mi 'thad pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la 'bras bu rgyu dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni phyogs de la ni gzugs 'byung ba rnams kyi 'bras bur mi 'thad pa nyid do //
translated: In that regard, the position that the effect is similar to the cause is untenable as the effect of the primary elements.

original: 'bras bu rgyu dang mi 'dra ba zhes bya ba'i phyogs de la yang gzugs 'byung ba rnams kyi 'bras bur mi 'thad pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'bras bu rgyu dang mi 'dra ba zhes bya ba'i phyogs de la yang gzugs 'byung ba rnams kyi 'bras bur mi 'thad pa nyid do //
translated: The position that the effect is not similar to the cause is also untenable as the effect of the primary elements.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: 'di la 'byung ba rnams ni sra ba dang / gsher ba dang / tsha ba dang g-yo ba'i ngo bo nyid du bstan na 'byung ba'i yon tan de dag ni gzugs la dmigs su med de /
analyzed: 'di la 'byung ba rnams ni sra ba dang / gsher ba dang / tsha ba dang g-yo ba'i ngo bo nyid du bstan na 'byung ba'i yon tan de dag ni gzugs la dmigs su med de /
translated: Here, the primary elements are taught to have the nature of solidity, fluidity, heat, and motion. Those qualities of the primary elements are not observed in form.

original: 'di ltar sa ni sra ba nyid /
analyzed: 'di ltar sa ni sra ba nyid /
translated: Thus, earth is observed as solidity,

original: chu ni gsher ba nyid /
analyzed: chu ni gsher ba nyid /
translated: water as fluidity,

original: me ni tsha ba nyid /🔽rlung ni g-yo ba nyid du dmigs pas de'i phyir de ltar 'bras bu rgyu dang 'dra ba yang med la /🔽rgyu dang mi 'dra ba yang med pa de'i phyir gzugs 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: me ni tsha ba nyid / rlung ni g-yo ba nyid du dmigs pas de'i phyir de ltar 'bras bu rgyu dang 'dra ba yang med la / rgyu dang mi 'dra ba yang med pa de'i phyir gzugs 'bras bu'o //
translated: fire as heat,🔽and wind as motion. Therefore, the effect is not similar to the cause in that way,

original: zhes bya bar mi 'thad pa nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya bar mi 'thad pa nyid do //
translated: and the cause is not similar to the effect. For that reason, it is untenable to say, “Form is the effect of the primary elements.”

original: tshor ba 'du shes 'du byed dang // sems dang dngos po thams cad kyang //
analyzed: tshor ba 'du shes 'du byed dang // sems dang dngos po thams cad kyang //
translated: Feeling, perception, mental formations,🔽And mind itself, and all phenomena,

original: rnam pa dag ni thams cad du //
analyzed: rnam pa dag ni thams cad du //
translated: Feeling, perception, mental formations, And consciousness, as well as all entities,🔽In every way,

original: gzugs nyid kyis ni rim pa mtshungs //🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa de dag kyang gzugs mi 'thad pa nyid kyis mi 'thad par rim pa mtshungs te /
analyzed: gzugs nyid kyis ni rim pa mtshungs // tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa de dag kyang gzugs mi 'thad pa nyid kyis mi 'thad par rim pa mtshungs te /
translated: Are the same as form.🔽Feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness are the same as form in being untenable.

original: ji ltar 'byung ba ma gtogs par gzugs med pa de bzhin du reg pa ma gtogs par tshor ba med la /
analyzed: ji ltar 'byung ba ma gtogs par gzugs med pa de bzhin du reg pa ma gtogs par tshor ba med la /
translated: Just as form does not exist apart from the elements, so too feeling does not exist apart from contact.

original: ji ltar gzugs ma gtogs par gzugs kyi rgyu med pa de bzhin du tshor ba ma gtogs par yang reg pa med de /
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs ma gtogs par gzugs kyi rgyu med pa de bzhin du tshor ba ma gtogs par yang reg pa med de /
translated: Just as form does not exist without a cause that is form, so too contact does not exist without feeling.

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
translated: Thus the Blessed One has said:

original: bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa la brten nas bde ba'i tshor ba skye'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa la brten nas bde ba'i tshor ba skye'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: “Pleasant feeling arises in dependence on a contact that is a condition for pleasant feeling.”

original: lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya ste de lta bas na phung po rnams yod do zhes bya ba de mi 'thad pa nyid do //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya ste de lta bas na phung po rnams yod do zhes bya ba de mi 'thad pa nyid do //
translated: The same should be applied to the rest. Therefore, it is not tenable to say that the aggregates exist.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang sgyu ma 'di ni byis pa 'drid pa'o //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang sgyu ma 'di ni byis pa 'drid pa'o // zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Bhagavān also said, “This illusion deceives fools.🔽”

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: Thus,

original: gzugs ni dbu brdos pa 'dra //
analyzed: gzugs ni dbu brdos pa 'dra //
translated: Form is like a mass of foam,

original: tshor ba chu bur dag dang mtshungs //
analyzed: tshor ba chu bur dag dang mtshungs //
translated: Feeling is like a water bubble,

original: 'du shes smig rgyu 'dra ba ste //
analyzed: 'du shes smig rgyu 'dra ba ste //
translated: Perception is like a mirage,

original: 'du @179b byed rnams ni chu shing bzhin //
analyzed: 'du @179b byed rnams ni chu shing bzhin //
translated: Formations are like a plantain tree,

original: rnam shes sgyu ma lta bu zhes //
analyzed: rnam shes sgyu ma lta bu zhes //
translated: And consciousness is like an illusion.

original: nyi ma'i gnyen gyis bka' stsal to //🔽zhes kyang gsungs so //🔽phung po rnams nyi tshe gzugs mi 'thad pa nyid kyis mi 'thad par rim pa mtshungs par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: nyi ma'i gnyen gyis bka' stsal to // zhes kyang gsungs so // phung po rnams nyi tshe gzugs mi 'thad pa nyid kyis mi 'thad par rim pa mtshungs par ma zad kyi /
translated: Thus spoke the Kinsman of the Sun.🔽It is not only the aggregates that are untenable due to the untenability of form alone.

original: chos thams cad kyang gzugs mi 'thad pa nyid kyis mi 'thad par rim pa mtshungs so //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang gzugs mi 'thad pa nyid kyis mi 'thad par rim pa mtshungs so //
translated: All phenomena are untenable due to the untenability of form alone.

original: de ltar gang gi phyir chos thams cad gzugs mi 'thad pa nyid kyis mi 'thad par rim pa mtshungs pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar gang gi phyir chos thams cad gzugs mi 'thad pa nyid kyis mi 'thad par rim pa mtshungs pa de'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because all phenomena are equally untenable due to the untenability of form,

original: stong pa nyid kyis brtsad byas tshe //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis brtsad byas tshe //
translated: When emptiness is used in debate,

original: gang zhig lan 'debs smra byed pa //
analyzed: gang zhig lan 'debs smra byed pa //
translated: Whatever answer is given

original: de yis thams cad lan btab min //
analyzed: de yis thams cad lan btab min //
translated: Will not be an answer at all,

original: bsgrub par bya dang mtshungs par 'gyur //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya dang mtshungs par 'gyur //
translated: But will be just like the thesis.

original: stong pa nyid kyis brtsad cing 'gyed pa brtsams te yongs su gleng ba'i tshe gang zhig stong pa nyid ma yin pas lan 'debs shing smra bar byed pa de'i tshe de dag thams cad ni lan btab pa ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis brtsad cing 'gyed pa brtsams te yongs su gleng ba'i tshe gang zhig stong pa nyid ma yin pas lan 'debs shing smra bar byed pa de'i tshe de dag thams cad ni lan btab pa ma yin no //
translated: When emptiness is used in debate, when a dispute is begun and a discussion takes place, whatever answer is given by someone who does not accept emptiness will not be an answer at all.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?🔽Because it will be just like the thesis.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang mtshungs par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / 'di lta ste dper na dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid stong pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang mtshungs par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / 'di lta ste dper na dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid stong pa'o //
translated: For example, it is like the following. All things are empty of essence.

original: zhes dam bcas na dpe bstan pa'i phyir snam bu ngo bo nyid stong par sgrub par byed pa'i tshe gang zhig re zhig re zhig rgyu spun dag ni yod do zhes zer ba'i de ni bsgrub par bya ba dang mtshungs pa yin te /🔽gtan tshigs gang dag nyid kyis snam bu ngo bo nyid stong par bstan pa de dag nyid rgyu spun dag stong pa nyid du rab tu sgrub par byed pa yang yin pas de'i phyir rgyur spun dag stong pa nyid ma yin par ston pa ni bsgrub par bya
analyzed: zhes dam bcas na dpe bstan pa'i phyir snam bu ngo bo nyid stong par sgrub par byed pa'i tshe gang zhig re zhig re zhig rgyu spun dag ni yod do zhes zer ba'i de ni bsgrub par bya ba dang mtshungs pa yin te / gtan tshigs gang dag nyid kyis snam bu ngo bo nyid stong par bstan pa de dag nyid rgyu spun dag stong pa nyid du rab tu sgrub par byed pa yang yin pas de'i phyir rgyur spun dag stong pa nyid ma yin par ston pa ni bsgrub par bya
translated: If you assert that, then in order to demonstrate the example, when you prove that a cloth is empty of intrinsic reality, whatever you say is the same as the probandum.

original: ba snam bu dang mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ba snam bu dang mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: Because whatever reasons demonstrate that a cloth is empty of intrinsic reality also prove that the causes, the threads, are empty, therefore demonstrating that the causes, the threads, are not empty is the same as the probandum, the cloth.

original: de bzhin du skye bo chos kyi gnas skabs shes pa dag dge ba'i chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni dge ba'o snyam pa dang / lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin du rnam par nges so snyam du sems shing de dag la sogs pa smra na dge ba'i chos rnams kyang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pas na de yang bsgrub par bya ba dang mtshungs pa
analyzed: de bzhin du skye bo chos kyi gnas skabs shes pa dag dge ba'i chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni dge ba'o snyam pa dang / lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin du rnam par nges so snyam du sems shing de dag la sogs pa smra na dge ba'i chos rnams kyang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pas na de yang bsgrub par bya ba dang mtshungs pa
translated: Likewise, when people who know the status of phenomena say, “The nature of virtuous phenomena is virtuous,” and “The rest are ascertained in the same way,” and so on, then because virtuous phenomena are dependently arisen, they are essenceless. Therefore, this is similar to the probandum.

original: yin te / bsgrub par bya ba dang mtshungs pa'i phyir lan btab pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yin te / bsgrub par bya ba dang mtshungs pa'i phyir lan btab pa ma yin no //
translated: Because it is similar to the probandum, it is not a response.

original: slob dpon 'phags pa ltas kyang //
analyzed: slob dpon 'phags pa ltas kyang //
translated: Ācārya Ārya deva also says:

original: dngos po gcig la gang lta ba //
analyzed: dngos po gcig la gang lta ba //
translated: Whatever is seen in one thing

original: de ni kun la'ang lta bar 'dod //
analyzed: de ni kun la'ang lta bar 'dod //
translated: Is asserted to be seen in everything.

original: gcig gi stong nyid gang yin pa //🔽de nyid @180a * //
analyzed: gcig gi stong nyid gang yin pa // de nyid @180a * //
translated: The emptiness of one thing

original: kun gyi stong pa nyid //🔽ces gsungs so //
analyzed: kun gyi stong pa nyid // ces gsungs so //
translated: Is the emptiness of all.

original: stong pa nyid kyis bshad byas tshe //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis bshad byas tshe //
translated: When emptiness is explained,

original: gang zhig skyon 'dogs smra byed pa //
analyzed: gang zhig skyon 'dogs smra byed pa //
translated: Whoever speaks to ascribe faults

original: de yis thams cad skyon btags min //
analyzed: de yis thams cad skyon btags min //
translated: It is not that everything is labeled as faulty.🔽

original: bsgrub par bya dang mtshungs par 'gyur //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya dang mtshungs par 'gyur //
translated: All of those are just like the thesis.

original: stong pa nyid kyi dngos po ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du rnam par bshad pa'i tshe gang zhig stong pa nyid ma yin pas skyon 'dogs shing smra bar byed pa de'i de dag thams cad kyang snga ma kho na bzhin du bsgrub par bya ba dang mtshungs
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi dngos po ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du rnam par bshad pa'i tshe gang zhig stong pa nyid ma yin pas skyon 'dogs shing smra bar byed pa de'i de dag thams cad kyang snga ma kho na bzhin du bsgrub par bya ba dang mtshungs
translated: When emptiness is explained as the essencelessness of things, those who, not understanding it to be so, speak of faults, all of those are just like the thesis.

original: pa'i phyir skyon btags pa ma yin te /
analyzed: pa'i phyir skyon btags pa ma yin te /
translated: Because they are just the same as the thesis, they do not fault it.

original: de ni don gcig pa kho na yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de ni don gcig pa kho na yin mod kyi /
translated: This is because they are just the same.

original: gnas skabs gzhan gyi bye brag gis yang bstan to //
analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan gyi bye brag gis yang bstan to //
translated: But they are taught again in terms of their specific contexts.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di gnyis ni rab tu byed pa thams cad kyi khongs su gtogs par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di gnyis ni rab tu byed pa thams cad kyi khongs su gtogs par blta bar bya ste /
translated: These two verses should be seen as included in all of the chapters,

original: thams cad du grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are established in all of them.

original: phung po brtag pa zhes bya ste rab tu byed pa bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: phung po brtag pa zhes bya ste rab tu byed pa bzhi pa'o /
translated: This is the fourth chapter, called “The Examination of the Aggregates.”

original: // /'dir smras pa /
analyzed: // /'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: 'di la sogs pa khams drug po dag kyang bstan /
analyzed: 'di la sogs pa khams drug po dag kyang bstan /
translated: The six elements, such as earth,

original: de dag gi so so'i mtshan nyid kyang bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gi so so'i mtshan nyid kyang bstan to //
translated: Their individual characteristics are also taught.

original: de la nam mkha'i mtshan nyid ni mi sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: de la nam mkha'i mtshan nyid ni mi sgrib pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of space is non-obstruction.

original: zhes bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bstan te /
translated: This is taught.

original: dngos po med na ni mtshan nyid bstan par mi rigs pas de lta bas na mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir nam mkha' yod do //
analyzed: dngos po med na ni mtshan nyid bstan par mi rigs pas de lta bas na mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir nam mkha' yod do //
translated: If it were a non-entity, it would not be tenable to teach its characteristic. Therefore, because its characteristic exists, space exists.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' yod pa de bzhin du khams lhag ma rnams kyang rang gi mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir yod do //
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' yod pa de bzhin du khams lhag ma rnams kyang rang gi mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir yod do //
translated: Just as space exists, so too the remaining elements exist because their individual characteristics exist.

original: bshad pa / nam mkha'i mtshan nyid ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: bshad pa / nam mkha'i mtshan nyid ni mi 'thad do //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: The characteristic of space is untenable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?🔽Thus:

original: 'di ltar / nam mkha'i mtshan nyid snga rol na //
analyzed: 'di ltar / nam mkha'i mtshan nyid snga rol na //
translated: Prior to the characteristic of space,

original: nam mkha' cung zad yod ma yin //
analyzed: nam mkha' cung zad yod ma yin //
translated: Space does not exist in the least.

original: gal te nam mkha'i mtshan nyid kyi snga rol na nam mkha' zhes bya ba cung zad cig yod na ni de la nam mkha' 'di'i mtshan nyid ni 'di yin no zhes mtshan nyid bstan pa yang rigs pa zhig na nam mkha'i mtshan nyid kyi snga rol na nam
analyzed: gal te nam mkha'i mtshan nyid kyi snga rol na nam mkha' zhes bya ba cung zad cig yod na ni de la nam mkha' 'di'i mtshan nyid ni 'di yin no zhes mtshan nyid bstan pa yang rigs pa zhig na nam mkha'i mtshan nyid kyi snga rol na nam
translated: If space existed in the least, prior to the characteristic of space, then it would be logical to teach the characteristic of space, saying, “The characteristic of space is this.”

original: mkha' med do //
analyzed: mkha' med do //
translated: But space does not exist prior to the characteristic of space.

original: nam mkha' med na nam mkha'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba de ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur /
analyzed: nam mkha' med na nam mkha'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba de ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur /
translated: If space does not exist, how could the so-called characteristic of space be tenable?

original: ci ste nam mkha'i mtshan nyid kyi snga rol na nam mkha' yod do zhes de ltar rtog na /
analyzed: ci ste nam mkha'i mtshan nyid kyi snga rol na nam mkha' yod do zhes de ltar rtog na /
translated: But if you imagine that space exists prior to the characteristic of space,

original: de lta na /
analyzed: de lta na /
translated: then in that case,

original: gal te mtshan las snga gyur na /
analyzed: gal te mtshan las snga gyur na /
translated: if it existed prior to the characteristic,

original: mtshan nyid med par thal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med par thal bar 'gyur /
translated: it follows it would be without a characteristic.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: @180b mtshan nyid med pa yod do //
analyzed: @180b mtshan nyid med pa yod do //
translated: Things that lack characteristics exist.

original: zhes bshad pa /
analyzed: zhes bshad pa /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds:

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i dngos po ni //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i dngos po ni //
translated: Things that lack characteristics

original: 'ga' yang gang na yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'ga' yang gang na yod ma yin //
translated: do not exist in any way.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nyid ces bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nyid ces bya ba'i don te /
translated: The word “only” means “just.”

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i dngos po ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i dngos po ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: No entity whatsoever that is without a characteristic exists.

original: gzhung lugs gang du yang ma bstan to //
analyzed: gzhung lugs gang du yang ma bstan to //
translated: It is not taught in any scriptural system.

original: 'o na de /
analyzed: 'o na de /
translated: Well then,

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i dngos med na //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i dngos med na //
translated: if there is no entity without a characteristic,

original: mtshan nyid gang du 'jug par 'gyur //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gang du 'jug par 'gyur //
translated: where would a characteristic apply?

original: de bstan par rigs so //
analyzed: de bstan par rigs so //
translated: It is reasonable to teach that.🔽Thus, a characteristic

original: 'di ltar / mtshan nyid med la mtshan nyid ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / mtshan nyid med la mtshan nyid ni //
translated: does not apply to that which is without a characteristic.

original: mi 'jug de ltar gang gi phyir mtshan nyid med pa'i dngos po 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir mtshan nyid med pa'i dngos po med na de gzhi med pa la mtshan nyid 'jug par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: mi 'jug de ltar gang gi phyir mtshan nyid med pa'i dngos po 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir mtshan nyid med pa'i dngos po med na de gzhi med pa la mtshan nyid 'jug par mi 'thad do //
translated: Since no entity whatsoever that is without a characteristic exists, therefore, if an entity without a characteristic does not exist, it is untenable that a characteristic applies to a nonexistent basis.

original: 'o na mtshan nyid dang bcas pa'i dngos po la mtshan nyid 'jug par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na mtshan nyid dang bcas pa'i dngos po la mtshan nyid 'jug par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: Well then, a characteristic would apply to an entity that possesses a characteristic.🔽Nāgārjuna responds:

original: bshad pa / mtshan nyid bcas la min /
analyzed: bshad pa / mtshan nyid bcas la min /
translated: It does not apply to that which possesses a characteristic.

original: mtshan nyid dang bcas pa'i dngos po la yang mtshan nyid 'jug par mi 'thad de /
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang bcas pa'i dngos po la yang mtshan nyid 'jug par mi 'thad de /
translated: It is also untenable that a characteristic applies to an entity that possesses a characteristic.

original: dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would serve no purpose.

original: dngos po rang gi mtshan nyid dang bcas par rab tu grub pa la yang mtshan nyid kyis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: dngos po rang gi mtshan nyid dang bcas par rab tu grub pa la yang mtshan nyid kyis ci zhig bya /
translated: But if a thing is fully established along with its intrinsic identity, what would its identity do?

original: de lta na thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, it follows that there would be an infinite regress.

original: de nam yang mtshan nyid dang bcas pa ma yin par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de nam yang mtshan nyid dang bcas pa ma yin par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: For it would never not have an identity.

original: rtag tu mtshan nyid 'jug par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag tu mtshan nyid 'jug par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And it follows that its identity would always be engaged.

original: de yang mi 'dod de //
analyzed: de yang mi 'dod de //
translated: But that is unacceptable.

original: de lta bas na mtshan nyid dang bcas pa'i dngos po la yang mtshan nyid 'jug par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na mtshan nyid dang bcas pa'i dngos po la yang mtshan nyid 'jug par mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is also untenable that an identity is engaged in a thing that has an identity.

original: de la 'di snyam du mtshan nyid dang bcas pa dang mtshan nyid med pa dag las gzhan pa la 'jug par sems na /🔽bshad pa / mtshan bcas mtshan nyid med pa las //
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du mtshan nyid dang bcas pa dang mtshan nyid med pa dag las gzhan pa la 'jug par sems na / bshad pa / mtshan bcas mtshan nyid med pa las //
translated: But if you think that it is engaged in something other than that which has an identity and that which does not have an identity,🔽then Nāgārjuna explains:🔽It is also not engaged

original: gzhan la'ang 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan la'ang 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: in something other than that which has an identity and that which does not have an identity.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mi srid pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi srid pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is impossible.

original: gal te mtshan nyid dang bcas na ni mtshan nyid med pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gal te mtshan nyid dang bcas na ni mtshan nyid med pa ma yin la /
translated: If it has an identity, it is not without an identity.

original: ci ste mtshan nyid med na ni mtshan nyid dang bcas pa ma yin pas de'i phyir mtshan nyid dang bcas pa dang mtshan nyid med pa zhes bya ba de ni dgag par mi mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ste mtshan nyid med na ni mtshan nyid dang bcas pa ma yin pas de'i phyir mtshan nyid dang bcas pa dang mtshan nyid med pa zhes bya ba de ni dgag par mi mthun pa yin te /
translated: But if it does not have a characteristic, it is not one that has a characteristic. Therefore, that which has a characteristic and that which does not have a characteristic are both negated.

original: de lta bas na mi srid pa kho na'i phyir mtshan nyid dang bcas pa dang mtshan nyid med pa gzhan la yang mtshan nyid 'jug @181a * //🔽par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na mi srid pa kho na'i phyir mtshan nyid dang bcas pa dang mtshan nyid med pa gzhan la yang mtshan nyid 'jug @181a * // par mi 'thad do //
translated: Thus, because it is impossible, it is untenable that a characteristic would apply to that which has a characteristic and that which does not have a characteristic.

original: mtshan nyid 'jug pa ma yin na //
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'jug pa ma yin na //
translated: If a characteristic does not apply,

original: mtshan gzhi 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan gzhi 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: A basis of those characteristics is not tenable.

original: mtshan nyid 'jug pa ma yin na mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yang 'thad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'jug pa ma yin na mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yang 'thad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If a characteristic does not apply, a basis of those characteristics is not tenable.

original: 'di ltar khyod kyis mtshan nyid dang ldan pa las khams rab tu 'grub par bstan na mtshan nyid dang ldan pa de yang mtshan nyid mi 'jug pa'i phyir mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar khyod kyis mtshan nyid dang ldan pa las khams rab tu 'grub par bstan na mtshan nyid dang ldan pa de yang mtshan nyid mi 'jug pa'i phyir mi 'thad do //
translated: In this way, you have described the establishment of the elements as possessing characteristics, but that which possesses characteristics is not tenable because a characteristic does not apply.

original: de med na khyod kyi mtshan nyid kyi gzhi gang gis 'grub par 'thad /
analyzed: de med na khyod kyi mtshan nyid kyi gzhi gang gis 'grub par 'thad /
translated: If that is not so, how could a basis of those characteristics be established?

original: smras pa / de re zhig mtshan nyid ni yod de /
analyzed: smras pa / de re zhig mtshan nyid ni yod de /
translated: Objection: First, characteristics exist.

original: mtshan nyid yod pas mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yang rab tu 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid yod pas mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yang rab tu 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since characteristics exist, the basis of characteristics is also fully established.🔽Nāgārjuna responds:

original: bshad pa / mtshan gzhi 'thad pa ma yin na //
analyzed: bshad pa / mtshan gzhi 'thad pa ma yin na //
translated: If the basis of characteristics is not tenable,

original: mtshan nyid kyang ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyang ni yod ma yin //
translated: characteristics also do not exist.

original: 'di la mtshan nyid kyi gzhi la brten nas mtshan nyid du 'gyur na mtshan nyid kyi gzhi de yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'di la mtshan nyid kyi gzhi la brten nas mtshan nyid du 'gyur na mtshan nyid kyi gzhi de yang mi 'thad do //
translated: Here, if a characteristic exists in dependence on the basis of characteristics, that basis of characteristics is not tenable.

original: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi med na gzhi med pa'i mtshan nyid ji ltar 'thad /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi med na gzhi med pa'i mtshan nyid ji ltar 'thad /
translated: If the basis of characteristics does not exist, how could a characteristic that lacks a basis be tenable?

original: de lta bas na mtshan nyid kyang yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bas na mtshan nyid kyang yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Thus characteristics also do not exist.

original: de phyir mtshan gzhi yod min te //
analyzed: de phyir mtshan gzhi yod min te //
translated: Therefore the basis of characteristics does not exist.

original: mtshan nyid yod pa nyid ma yin //
analyzed: mtshan nyid yod pa nyid ma yin //
translated: Characteristics also do not exist.

original: de ltar gang gi phyir rnam pa thams cad du brtags na mtshan nyid 'jug par mi 'thad pa de'i phyir mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gang gi phyir rnam pa thams cad du brtags na mtshan nyid 'jug par mi 'thad pa de'i phyir mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, since in every way it is untenable for a characteristic to apply, therefore the basis of characteristics does not exist.

original: gang gi phyir mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir gang zhig med pa'i mtshan nyid kyang yod pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir gang zhig med pa'i mtshan nyid kyang yod pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Because the basis of those characteristics does not exist, therefore the characteristic of that which does not exist also does not exist.

original: smras pa / 'di ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi'o //
analyzed: smras pa / 'di ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi'o //
translated: Objection: Although it is said, “This is the basis of those characteristics,”

original: 'di ni mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni mtshan nyid do //
translated: and “This is the characteristic,”

original: zhes bya ba de brjod par mi nus mod kyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de brjod par mi nus mod kyi /
translated: it is not possible to express them.

original: 'on kyang re zhig dngos po ni yod do //
analyzed: 'on kyang re zhig dngos po ni yod do //
translated: Nevertheless, an entity does exist.🔽In response Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / mtshan gzhi mtshan nyid ma gtogs pa'i //
analyzed: bshad pa / mtshan gzhi mtshan nyid ma gtogs pa'i //
translated: Apart from the basis of those characteristics and the characteristics,

original: dngos po yang ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: dngos po yang ni yod ma yin //
translated: an entity also does not exist.

original: gal te dngos po 'ga' zhig yod par 'gyur na mtshan nyid kyi gzhi 'am mtshan nyid gcig tu 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po 'ga' zhig yod par 'gyur na mtshan nyid kyi gzhi 'am mtshan nyid gcig tu 'gyur grang na /
translated: If an entity existed, it would be either the basis of those characteristics or the characteristic.

original: gang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yang ma yin la mtshan nyid kyang ma yin pa de ni yod pa nyid ma yin pa de'i phyir mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang mtshan nyid ma gtogs pa'i dngos po 'ga' yang yod pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yang ma yin la mtshan nyid kyang ma yin pa de ni yod pa nyid ma yin pa de'i phyir mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang mtshan nyid ma gtogs pa'i dngos po 'ga' yang yod pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: But that which is neither the basis of those characteristics nor the characteristic does not exist. Therefore, apart from the basis of those characteristics and the characteristics, no entity at all exists.

original: smras pa / dngos po ni yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: smras pa / dngos po ni yod pa nyid de /
translated: Objection: An entity does exist.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: dngos po med pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a non-thing exists.

original: 'di la khyod na re mtshan nyid kyi gzhi @181b dang mtshan nyid dag med do zhes zer ba de ni dngos po la ltos pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di la khyod na re mtshan nyid kyi gzhi @181b dang mtshan nyid dag med do zhes zer ba de ni dngos po la ltos pa yin te /
translated: Here, you say that the basis of those characteristics and the characteristics themselves do not exist. But that is dependent on a thing.

original: de'i phyir gang gi dngos po med do zhes brjod pa'i dngos po de ni 'ga' zhig yod pas de lta bas na dngos po med pa yod pa'i phyir dngos po yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gi dngos po med do zhes brjod pa'i dngos po de ni 'ga' zhig yod pas de lta bas na dngos po med pa yod pa'i phyir dngos po yod pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, since the thing that is said to be nonexistent exists, a non-thing exists. Thus, because a non-thing exists, a thing exists.

original: bshad pa legs par brjod do //
analyzed: bshad pa legs par brjod do //
translated: Response: You have spoken well.

original: gal te dngos po med pa yod na ni dngos po yang yod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po med pa yod na ni dngos po yang yod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If a non-thing exists, then a thing would also exist.

original: dngos po med pa yod pa ma yin pas dngos po yod par ga la 'gyur /
