analyzed: dngos po med pa yod pa ma yin pas dngos po yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: But since a non-thing does not exist, how could a thing exist?

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: dngos po yod pa ma yin na //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa ma yin na //
translated: If a thing does not exist,

original: dngos med gang gi yin par 'gyur //
analyzed: dngos med gang gi yin par 'gyur //
translated: whose non-thing would it be?🔽Previously you said:

original: sngar / mtshan gzhi mtshan nyid ma gtogs pa'i //
analyzed: sngar / mtshan gzhi mtshan nyid ma gtogs pa'i //
translated: A thing that is not a basis of those characteristics

original: dngos po yang ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: dngos po yang ni yod ma yin //
translated: And is not a characteristic itself does not exist.

original: zhes bstan pas dngos po de yod pa ma yin na khyod kyi dngos po med pa de gang gi yin par brtag /'di ltar dngos po'i dngos po med par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: zhes bstan pas dngos po de yod pa ma yin na khyod kyi dngos po med pa de gang gi yin par brtag /'di ltar dngos po'i dngos po med par 'gyur grang na /
translated: Thus, if that thing does not exist, how could its nonthing be conceived?🔽If it were the case that the nonthing of a thing were to occur,

original: dngos po de yang yod pa ma yin na dngos po med pa de gang gi yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: dngos po de yang yod pa ma yin na dngos po med pa de gang gi yin par 'gyur /
translated: then since that thing does not exist, how could its nonthing occur?

original: de lta bas na dngos po med pa'i phyir dngos po med pa yang med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po med pa'i phyir dngos po med pa yang med do //
translated: Therefore, because a thing does not exist, a nonthing also does not exist.

original: smras pa / gang gi dngos po dang dngos po med pa de dag shes par byed cing dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag rtog par byed pa de ni re zhig yod do //
analyzed: smras pa / gang gi dngos po dang dngos po med pa de dag shes par byed cing dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag rtog par byed pa de ni re zhig yod do //
translated: Objection: But first that which makes known those things and nonthings and conceives of things and nonthings exists.

original: de yod pas dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag kyang rab tu 'grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de yod pas dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag kyang rab tu 'grub pa nyid do //
translated: Because of its existence, things and nonthings are fully established.🔽In response, Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / dngos dang dngos med mi mthun chos //
analyzed: bshad pa / dngos dang dngos med mi mthun chos //
translated: Things and nonthings are incompatible phenomena.

original: gang gis dngos dang dngos med shes //
analyzed: gang gis dngos dang dngos med shes //
translated: By what means does one know things and nonthings?

original: mi mthun pa'i chos ni de dag mi bzlog pa'i chos te /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i chos ni de dag mi bzlog pa'i chos te /
translated: In this context, incompatible phenomena are phenomena that do not mutually exclude each other.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag gi mi mthun pa'i chos ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa mi mthun pa'i chos so //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag gi mi mthun pa'i chos ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa mi mthun pa'i chos so //
translated: The incompatible phenomena of things and non-things are the incompatible phenomena of things and non-things.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag gi mi mthun pa'i chos gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag gi mi mthun pa'i chos gang yin zhe na /
translated: What are the incompatible phenomena of things and non-things?

original: dngos po yang ma yin la dngos po med pa yang ma yin pa'o //🔽de la gal te 'ga' zhig yod par 'gyur na dngos po'i chos sam /
analyzed: dngos po yang ma yin la dngos po med pa yang ma yin pa'o // de la gal te 'ga' zhig yod par 'gyur na dngos po'i chos sam /
translated: They are neither a thing nor a non-thing.

original: dngos po med pa'i chos shin tu 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i chos shin tu 'gyur grang na /
translated: If they were to exist, they would be the phenomena of a thing or the phenomena of a non-thing.

original: gang dngos po'i chos kyang ma yin la dngos po med pa'i chos kyang ma yin pa de ni yod pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gang dngos po'i chos kyang ma yin la dngos po med pa'i chos kyang ma yin pa de ni yod pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: But that which is neither the phenomena of a thing nor the phenomena of a non-thing does not exist.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag dang mi mthun pa'i chos de med na gang gis dngos po dang dngos po med pa de dag shes par brtag / de lta @182a * //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag dang mi mthun pa'i chos de med na gang gis dngos po dang dngos po med pa de dag shes par brtag / de lta @182a * //
translated: Since the phenomena incompatible with things and non-things do not exist, how can things and non-things be imagined to be known?

original: bas na dngos po dang dngos po med par shes pa yang med do //
analyzed: bas na dngos po dang dngos po med par shes pa yang med do //
translated: Therefore, the knowledge of things and non-things does not exist.

original: de phyir nam mkha' dngos po min //
analyzed: de phyir nam mkha' dngos po min //
translated: Therefore, space is not a thing.

original: dngos med ma yin mtshan gzhi min //
analyzed: dngos med ma yin mtshan gzhi min //
translated: It is not a non-entity, nor a basis of characteristics,

original: mtshan nyid ma yin //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ma yin //
translated: nor a characteristic.

original: de ltar gang gi phyir brtags na mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang mtshan nyid dag med cing /
analyzed: de ltar gang gi phyir brtags na mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang mtshan nyid dag med cing /
translated: Thus, when investigated, the basis of characteristics and the characteristics do not exist.

original: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang mtshan nyid dag ma gtogs pa'i dngos po gzhan yang med do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang mtshan nyid dag ma gtogs pa'i dngos po gzhan yang med do //
translated: And apart from the basis of characteristics and the characteristics, there is no other entity.

original: dngos po med na dngos po med pa yang med pa de'i phyir nam mkha' ni dngos po yang ma yin dngos po med pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: dngos po med na dngos po med pa yang med pa de'i phyir nam mkha' ni dngos po yang ma yin dngos po med pa yang ma yin /
translated: If there is no entity, there is also no non-entity. Therefore, space is not an entity, nor a non-entity,

original: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yang ma yin mtshan nyid kyang ma yin no//
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yang ma yin mtshan nyid kyang ma yin no//
translated: not a basis of characteristics, nor a characteristic.

original: 'di ltar gal te nam mkha' zhes bya ba cung zhig yod par gyur na de bzhi po de dag las gang yang rung ba zhig tu 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te nam mkha' zhes bya ba cung zhig yod par gyur na de bzhi po de dag las gang yang rung ba zhig tu 'gyur grang na /
translated: Thus, if something called “space” existed, it would be one of these four.

original: bzhi po de dag kyang med pas de'i phyir nam mkha' yod pa ma yin no //🔽khams lnga po //
analyzed: bzhi po de dag kyang med pas de'i phyir nam mkha' yod pa ma yin no // khams lnga po //
translated: But since these four do not exist, space does not exist.🔽The other five elements

original: gzhan gang dag kyang nam mkha' mtshungs //
analyzed: gzhan gang dag kyang nam mkha' mtshungs //
translated: are also similar to space.

original: nam mkha' mtshungs zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtshungs zhes bya ba ni //
translated: “Similar to space” means

original: nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa ste /
translated: They are similar to space.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' brtags na dngos po yang ma yin /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' brtags na dngos po yang ma yin /
translated: When space is investigated, it is not a thing,

original: dngos po med pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: dngos po med pa yang ma yin /
translated: it is not a nonthing,

original: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yang ma yin mtshan nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yang ma yin mtshan nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: it is not a basis of characteristics, and it is not characteristics.

original: nam mkha' zhes bya ba ni ci yang ma yin pa de bzhin du sa la sogs pa khams lnga po gzhan dag gang yin pa de dag kyang dngos po yang ma yin /
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes bya ba ni ci yang ma yin pa de bzhin du sa la sogs pa khams lnga po gzhan dag gang yin pa de dag kyang dngos po yang ma yin /
translated: Just as space is nothing whatsoever, so too the other five elements, such as earth, are not things,

original: dngos po med pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: dngos po med pa yang ma yin /
translated: they are not nonthings,

original: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yang ma yin /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yang ma yin /
translated: they are not bases of characteristics,

original: mtshan nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: and they are not characteristics.

original: dngos po 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pas de'i phyir khams rnams kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pas de'i phyir khams rnams kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since nothing exists, the elements also do not exist.

original: smras pa // 'di la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis chos bstan pa dag ni phal cher phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag la brten pa yin na de la gal te phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag med pa nyid yin pa de dag don med pa
analyzed: smras pa // 'di la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis chos bstan pa dag ni phal cher phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag la brten pa yin na de la gal te phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag med pa nyid yin pa de dag don med pa
translated: Objection: In this regard, the teachings of the buddhas, the blessed ones, are mostly based on the aggregates, constituents, and bases. If the aggregates, constituents, and bases do not exist, then are they not meaningless?

original: nyid du mi 'gyur ram de dag don med pa nyid du mi rigs na de ci lta bu zhig / bshad pa /
analyzed: nyid du mi 'gyur ram de dag don med pa nyid du mi rigs na de ci lta bu zhig / bshad pa /
translated: If it is not logical that they are meaningless, then what are they?

original: kho bos phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag med pa nyid du mi smra'i /
analyzed: kho bos phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag med pa nyid du mi smra'i /
translated: Response: We do not say that the aggregates, constituents, and bases do not exist.

original: de dag yod pa nyid du smra ba sel bar byed do //
analyzed: de dag yod pa nyid du smra ba sel bar byed do //
translated: We refute the assertion that they exist.

original: de gnyi ga yang skyon du che ste /
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang skyon du che ste /
translated: Both of these are great errors.

original: 'di ltar 'og nas kyang /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'og nas kyang /
translated: As it says below:

original: yod ces bya @182b brtag par 'dzin //
analyzed: yod ces bya @182b brtag par 'dzin //
translated: To say “exists” is to hold eternalism.

original: med ces bya ba chad par lta //🔽de phyir yod dang med pa la //
analyzed: med ces bya ba chad par lta // de phyir yod dang med pa la //
translated: To say “does not exist” is to hold nihilism.🔽Therefore the wise do not hold

original: mkhas pas gnas par mi bya'o //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mkhas pas gnas par mi bya'o //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: to existence or nonexistence.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang ka tya na 'jig rten 'di ni gnyis la gnas te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang ka tya na 'jig rten 'di ni gnyis la gnas te /
translated: The Lord has also said, “Katyayana, this world is based on duality,

original: phal cher yod pa nyid dang / med pa nyid la gnas so zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: phal cher yod pa nyid dang / med pa nyid la gnas so zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: for the most part it is based on existence and nonexistence.”

original: de'i phyir kho bo ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung bas yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid kyi skyon dang bral ba chad pa ma yin rtag pa ma yin pa rjes su rab tu ston pa med pa nyid du mi smra'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bo ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung bas yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid kyi skyon dang bral ba chad pa ma yin rtag pa ma yin pa rjes su rab tu ston pa med pa nyid du mi smra'o //
translated: Therefore, we do not say that things do not exist, for we teach that dependent origination is free from the errors of existence and nonexistence, and is not annihilated nor eternal.

original: de lta bas na kho bo cag la phung po dang / khams dang skye mched dag la brten pa'i chos ston pa dag don med pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na kho bo cag la phung po dang / khams dang skye mched dag la brten pa'i chos ston pa dag don med pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it is not the case that our teaching of the Dharma based on the aggregates, elements, and faculties is meaningless.

original: blo chung gang dag dngos rnams la //
analyzed: blo chung gang dag dngos rnams la //
translated: Those of little intelligence

original: yod pa nyid dang med nyid du //🔽lta ba de ni blta bya ba //
analyzed: yod pa nyid dang med nyid du // lta ba de ni blta bya ba //
translated: who view things as existent or nonexistent🔽do not see the pacification

original: nye bar zhi ba zhi mi mthong //
analyzed: nye bar zhi ba zhi mi mthong //
translated: of views, which is peace.

original: blo chung ngu gang dag rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mchog tu zab pa ma rtogs pa na dngos po rnams la yod pa nyid dang / med pa nyid du rjes su lta ba chad pa dang rtag par lta bas blo gros kyi mig bsgribs pa de dag gis ni mya ngan las 'das pa lta bar bya ba nye bar zhi zhing zhi ba mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: blo chung ngu gang dag rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mchog tu zab pa ma rtogs pa na dngos po rnams la yod pa nyid dang / med pa nyid du rjes su lta ba chad pa dang rtag par lta bas blo gros kyi mig bsgribs pa de dag gis ni mya ngan las 'das pa lta bar bya ba nye bar zhi zhing zhi ba mi mthong ngo //
translated: Those of little intelligence, who do not understand the supreme profundity of dependent origination, are obscured in their intellect by the views of nihilism and reification, which are based on the views of existence and non-existence in regard to things. They do not see nirvana, which is to be seen, as peace and tranquility.

original: de'i phyir yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma mthong ba spros pa la mngon par dga' ba'i yid dang ldan pa de dag gi phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag la brten pa'i chos ston pa dag ni don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma mthong ba spros pa la mngon par dga' ba'i yid dang ldan pa de dag gi phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag la brten pa'i chos ston pa dag ni don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, for those whose minds delight in conceptual elaboration, who do not see things as they are in reality, the teachings of the Dharma based on the aggregates, elements and faculties are meaningless.

original: de lta bas na 'di ni don dam pa yin gyis mi 'jigs shig / smras pa /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni don dam pa yin gyis mi 'jigs shig / smras pa /
translated: Therefore, this is the ultimate truth, so do not be afraid!

original: ci'i phyir nam mkha'i khams gang yin pa de dang por brtags /
analyzed: ci'i phyir nam mkha'i khams gang yin pa de dang por brtags /
translated: Objection: Why is the space element examined first?

original: khams bstan pa la dang por sa'i khams bstan pas sa'i khams nyid dang po brtag par bya ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: khams bstan pa la dang por sa'i khams bstan pas sa'i khams nyid dang po brtag par bya ba'i rigs so //
translated: Since the elements are taught, it is reasonable to first examine the earth element.

original: bshad pa / grags pa'i don gyis ma grags pa'i don rab tu bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: bshad pa / grags pa'i don gyis ma grags pa'i don rab tu bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: Response: The meaning of the well known should be used to establish the meaning of the not well known.

original: 'jig rten ni phal cher nam mkha' la ci yang ma yin par mos te /🔽'di ltar smra ba po dag na re spros pa de dag thams cad ni nam mkha'o //🔽zhes zer bas de dag thams cad ni ci yang ma yin no /
analyzed: 'jig rten ni phal cher nam mkha' la ci yang ma yin par mos te / 'di ltar smra ba po dag na re spros pa de dag thams cad ni nam mkha'o // zhes zer bas de dag thams cad ni ci yang ma yin no /
translated: The world is mostly inclined to think that space is nothing at all.

original: zhes bya bar bsam mo //
analyzed: zhes bya bar bsam mo //
translated: Thus, when the proponents of mental proliferation say, “All of these mental proliferations are space,” they think that all of these are nothing at all.

original: de'i phyir khams lhag ma lnga po dag kyang nam mkha' dang mtshungs par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i dpe bstan @183a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir khams lhag ma lnga po dag kyang nam mkha' dang mtshungs par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i dpe bstan @183a * //
translated: Therefore, the remaining five elements should be described as being similar to space.

original: pa'i phyir nam mkha' stong pa nyid du grub pa dang por bstan to //
analyzed: pa'i phyir nam mkha' stong pa nyid du grub pa dang por bstan to //
translated: In order to demonstrate this point, the establishment of the emptiness of space is taught first.

original: khams brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa lnga pa'o /
analyzed: khams brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa lnga pa'o /
translated: This is the fifth chapter, called the Critique of the Elements.

original: // /'dir smras pa /
analyzed: // /'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: khyod kyis phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag gi stong pa nyid rjes su rab tu bstan pas kho bo stong pa nyid nyan 'dod par gyur gyis /
analyzed: khyod kyis phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag gi stong pa nyid rjes su rab tu bstan pas kho bo stong pa nyid nyan 'dod par gyur gyis /
translated: You have taught the emptiness of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases. I am eager to hear about emptiness.

original: de'i phyir de ni 'dod chags dang chags pa brtag par bya ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni 'dod chags dang chags pa brtag par bya ba'i rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is appropriate to investigate desire and the desirous one.

original: bshad pa de ltar bya'o //
analyzed: bshad pa de ltar bya'o //
translated: We will explain it in that way.

original: smras pa / 'di la de dang der 'dod chags dang chags pa spangs pa bstan /
analyzed: smras pa / 'di la de dang der 'dod chags dang chags pa spangs pa bstan /
translated: Objection: In this regard, the abandonment of desire and the desirous one has been taught.

original: 'dod chags nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir rigs pa yang bstan to //
analyzed: 'dod chags nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir rigs pa yang bstan to //
translated: The reasoning for the pacification of desire has also been taught.

original: med na ni nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i rigs pa yang bstan pa'i mi rigs te /
analyzed: med na ni nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i rigs pa yang bstan pa'i mi rigs te /
translated: If they do not exist, it is not reasonable to teach the reasoning for their pacification.

original: 'di ltar sbrul gyis ma zin na gsang sngags dang sman gyi bya ba med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar sbrul gyis ma zin na gsang sngags dang sman gyi bya ba med do //
translated: Thus, if there is no snake bite, there is no need for the rites of mantra and medicine.

original: de lta bas na 'dod chags dang chags pa dag ni yod do //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dod chags dang chags pa dag ni yod do //
translated: Therefore, desire and the desirous one exist.

original: bshad pa / 'dod chags dang chags pa dag ni mi srid do //
analyzed: bshad pa / 'dod chags dang chags pa dag ni mi srid do //
translated: In response, Aryadeva says: Desire and the desirous one are impossible.

original: ji ltar zhe na //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na //
translated: How so?

original: gal te 'dod chags snga rol na //
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags snga rol na //
translated: If desire existed prior to the desirous one,

original: 'dod chags med pa'i chags yod na //
analyzed: 'dod chags med pa'i chags yod na //
translated: If there were attachment without passion,

original: de la brten nas 'dod chags yod //
analyzed: de la brten nas 'dod chags yod //
translated: then passion would exist in dependence on that.

original: chags yod 'dod chags yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: chags yod 'dod chags yod par 'gyur //
translated: If there were attachment, passion would exist.

original: gal te 'dod chags kyi snga rol na chags pa 'dod chags med pa 'dod chags las gzhan du gyur pa 'ga' zhig yod na ni de la brten nas 'dod chags yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags kyi snga rol na chags pa 'dod chags med pa 'dod chags las gzhan du gyur pa 'ga' zhig yod na ni de la brten nas 'dod chags yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If prior to passion, attachment without passion—that is, something other than passion—existed, then passion would exist in dependence on that.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chags yod 'dod chags yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: chags yod 'dod chags yod par 'gyur //
translated: If there were attachment, passion would exist.

original: 'di ltar chags pa yod na 'dod chags kyang 'di'o zhes 'thad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar chags pa yod na 'dod chags kyang 'di'o zhes 'thad par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, if there were attachment, it would be tenable to say, “This is passion.”

original: chags pa med na de su'i 'dod chags su 'gyur te /
analyzed: chags pa med na de su'i 'dod chags su 'gyur te /
translated: But if there were no attachment, whose passion would it be?

original: 'di ltar gzhi med pa la 'dod chags mi 'thad pas de'i phyir chags pa med na 'dod chags mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhi med pa la 'dod chags mi 'thad pas de'i phyir chags pa med na 'dod chags mi 'thad do //
translated: In this way, since it is untenable that passion exists without a basis, therefore if there were no attachment, passion would be untenable.

original: smras pa / chags pa yod na 'dod chags yod do //
analyzed: smras pa / chags pa yod na 'dod chags yod do //
translated: Objection: If there were attachment, passion would exist.

original: 'dir bshad pa /🔽chags pa yod par gyur na yang //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / chags pa yod par gyur na yang //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds:🔽Even if attachment existed,

original: 'dod chags yod par ga la 'gyur//
analyzed: 'dod chags yod par ga la 'gyur//
translated: how could passion exist?

original: khyod kyi chags pa yod par gyur na yang /
analyzed: khyod kyi chags pa yod par gyur na yang /
translated: But even if attachment existed,

original: 'dod chags yod pa nyid du ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dod chags yod pa nyid du ga la 'gyur te /
translated: how could attachment exist?

original: 'di ltar chags pa la 'dod chags kyi bya ba ci yang med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar chags pa la 'dod chags kyi bya ba ci yang med do //
translated: In this way, there is no activity of attachment whatsoever in the one who is attached.

original: chags par mi byed na ni ji ltar 'dod chags yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: chags par mi byed na ni ji ltar 'dod chags yin par 'gyur /
translated: If one does not become attached, how could it be attachment?

original: ci ste 'gyur na ni gang yang 'dod chags ma yin pa nyid @183b du mi 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod de /
analyzed: ci ste 'gyur na ni gang yang 'dod chags ma yin pa nyid @183b du mi 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod de /
translated: But if it were, then it would not be nonattachment. But that is unacceptable.

original: de'i phyir chags pa yod par gyur na yang 'dod chags mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir chags pa yod par gyur na yang 'dod chags mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, even if the one who is attached existed, attachment would not be tenable.

original: smras pa / re zhig chags pa ni yod de /
analyzed: smras pa / re zhig chags pa ni yod de /
translated: Objection: First, the one who is attached exists.

original: de yang 'dod chags med na mi 'byung bas 'dod chags kyang rab tu grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de yang 'dod chags med na mi 'byung bas 'dod chags kyang rab tu grub pa nyid do //
translated: Moreover, since it does not occur without attachment, attachment is also fully established.

original: bshad pa / chags pa la yang 'dod chags ni //🔽yod dam med kyang rim pa mtshungs //
analyzed: bshad pa / chags pa la yang 'dod chags ni // yod dam med kyang rim pa mtshungs //
translated: In response, Nāgārjuna explains:

original: chags pa yod par yongs brtags na //
analyzed: chags pa yod par yongs brtags na //
translated: Whether the one who is attached exists or does not exist, the analysis is the same.🔽If you imagine the one who is attached exists,

original: 'dod chags yod dam med kyang rung ste chags pa la yang 'dod chags mi 'thad pa de nyid dang rim pa mtshungs so //
analyzed: 'dod chags yod dam med kyang rung ste chags pa la yang 'dod chags mi 'thad pa de nyid dang rim pa mtshungs so //
translated: Whether or not attachment exists, it is not tenable that one who is attached exists.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gal te chags pa'i snga rol na //
analyzed: gal te chags pa'i snga rol na //
translated: If, prior to one who is attached,

original: chags med 'dod chags yod na ni //
analyzed: chags med 'dod chags yod na ni //
translated: Attachment exists without one who is attached,

original: de la brten nas chags pa yod //
analyzed: de la brten nas chags pa yod //
translated: Then, in dependence on that, one who is attached exists.

original: 'dod chags yod na chags yod 'gyur //🔽gal te chags pa'i snga rol na 'dod chags chags pa med pa chags pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba 'ga' zhig yod na ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags yod na chags yod 'gyur // gal te chags pa'i snga rol na 'dod chags chags pa med pa chags pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba 'ga' zhig yod na ni /
translated: If attachment exists, one who is attached exists.

original: de la brten nas chags pa yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la brten nas chags pa yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If, prior to one who is attached, attachment exists without one who is attached, that is, without one who is attached existing as something other than attachment, then, in dependence on that, one who is attached exists.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'dod chags yod na chags yod 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dod chags yod na chags yod 'gyur //
translated: If attachment exists, one who is attached exists.

original: 'di ltar 'dod chags yod na chags pa yang 'dis 'di chags so zhes 'thad par 'gyur ro //🔽'dod chags med na gang gis de chags par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod chags yod na chags pa yang 'dis 'di chags so zhes 'thad par 'gyur ro // 'dod chags med na gang gis de chags par 'gyur /
translated: In this way, if attachment exists, it is tenable to say, “By this, he is attached.”🔽But if attachment does not exist, by what would he be attached?

original: ma chags pa na ni ji ltar chags par 'gyur /
analyzed: ma chags pa na ni ji ltar chags par 'gyur /
translated: If he is not attached, how could he be attached?

original: ci ste 'gyur na ni gang yang chags pa ma yin pa nyid du mi 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod de /
analyzed: ci ste 'gyur na ni gang yang chags pa ma yin pa nyid du mi 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod de /
translated: But if it did, then it would not be the case that no one is attached. But that is unacceptable.

original: de'i phyir 'dod chags med na chags pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod chags med na chags pa mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, if attachment does not exist, being attached is not tenable.

original: de la 'di snyam du 'dod chags yod na chags pa yod par sems na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du 'dod chags yod na chags pa yod par sems na /
translated: But if you think that if attachment exists, being attached exists,🔽then Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / 'dod chags yod par gyur na yang //
analyzed: bshad pa / 'dod chags yod par gyur na yang //
translated: Even if attachment existed,

original: chags pa yod par ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: chags pa yod par ga la 'gyur //
translated: how could being attached exist?

original: khyod kyi 'dod chags yod par gyur na yang chags pa med pa nyid du ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: khyod kyi 'dod chags yod par gyur na yang chags pa med pa nyid du ga la 'gyur te /
translated: Even if your attachment existed, how could it be the case that being attached does not exist?

original: 'di ltar gal te 'dod chags yod na chags par 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te 'dod chags yod na chags par 'gyur na /
translated: In this way, if attachment existed, being attached would exist.

original: chags pa med de 'dod chags des chags par gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chags pa med de 'dod chags des chags par gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: But being attached does not exist because one is not attached by that attachment.

original: chags pa ma yin na ni ji ltar chags par 'gyur /
analyzed: chags pa ma yin na ni ji ltar chags par 'gyur /
translated: If one is not attached, how could one be attached?

original: ci ste 'gyur na ni nam yang chags pa ma yin pa nyid du mi 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod de //
analyzed: ci ste 'gyur na ni nam yang chags pa ma yin pa nyid du mi 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod de //
translated: But if one were, then it would not be the case that no one is ever not attached. But that is unacceptable.

original: 'dod chags la yang chags pa ni //
analyzed: 'dod chags la yang chags pa ni //
translated: Also, with regard to attachment,

original: yod dam med kyang rim pa mtshungs //
analyzed: yod dam med kyang rim pa mtshungs //
translated: the analysis is the same whether it exists or not.

original: de'i phyir 'dod chags yod par gyur na yang @184a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod chags yod par gyur na yang @184a * //
translated: Therefore, even if attachment existed,

original: chags pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: chags pa mi 'thad do //
translated: the one who is attached would not be tenable.

original: smras pa / 'dod chags dang chags pa gnyis la snga phyi med de /
analyzed: smras pa / 'dod chags dang chags pa gnyis la snga phyi med de /
translated: Objection: Neither attachment nor the one who is attached is prior.

original: 'di ltar de gnyis ni lhan cig nyid du skye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de gnyis ni lhan cig nyid du skye ba yin no //
translated: In this way, they arise simultaneously.

original: bshad pa / 'dod chags dang ni chags pa dag / lhan cig nyid du skye mi rigs //
analyzed: bshad pa / 'dod chags dang ni chags pa dag / lhan cig nyid du skye mi rigs //
translated: In response, Aryadeva says: It is illogical for attachment and the one who is attached🔽to arise simultaneously.

original: 'dod chags dang chags pa dag lhan cig nyid du skye bar mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang chags pa dag lhan cig nyid du skye bar mi 'thad do //
translated: It is illogical for attachment and the one who is attached to arise simultaneously.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?🔽In that case, attachment and the one who is attached

original: 'di ltar 'dod chags chags pa dag / phan tshun ltos pa med par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod chags chags pa dag / phan tshun ltos pa med par 'gyur //
translated: would not be mutually dependent.

original: 'di ltar gal te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te /
translated: In this way,

original: 'dod chags dang chags pa dag lhan cig nyid du skye bar gyur na 'dod chags dang chags pa dag phan tshun ltos pa med par 'gyur ro //🔽de ltar gyur na 'di'i 'dod chags ni 'di'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang chags pa dag lhan cig nyid du skye bar gyur na 'dod chags dang chags pa dag phan tshun ltos pa med par 'gyur ro // de ltar gyur na 'di'i 'dod chags ni 'di'o //
translated: if attachment and the one who is attached arose simultaneously, attachment and the one who is attached would not be mutually dependent.🔽If that were so, it would be untenable to say, “This is attachment.

original: 'dis ni 'di chags so zhes bya ba de dag mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di chags so zhes bya ba de dag mi 'thad do //
translated: This one is attached to that.”

original: de dag med na 'dod chags mi 'thad pa nyid la chags pa yang mi 'thad pa nyid de /🔽'di ltar 'dod chags ni chags par byed pa yin la chags pa ni chags par bya ba yin na lhan cig nyid du skyes pa phan tshun ltos med pa dag la de dag mi 'thad pas de'i phyir 'dod chags dang chags pa dag lhan cig nyid du skye
analyzed: de dag med na 'dod chags mi 'thad pa nyid la chags pa yang mi 'thad pa nyid de / 'di ltar 'dod chags ni chags par byed pa yin la chags pa ni chags par bya ba yin na lhan cig nyid du skyes pa phan tshun ltos med pa dag la de dag mi 'thad pas de'i phyir 'dod chags dang chags pa dag lhan cig nyid du skye
translated: If they do not exist, then attachment is untenable, and one who is attached is untenable.

original: bar yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: bar yang mi rigs so //
translated: Thus attachment is that which causes attachment, and one who is attached is that which is to be attached. But it is untenable that they are produced simultaneously, since they are mutually independent. Therefore it is also untenable that attachment and one who is attached are produced simultaneously.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: khyod na re gang dag lhan cig nyid do zhes zer ba'i 'dod chags dang / chags pa de dag gcig pa nyid dam tha dad pa nyid du 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: khyod na re gang dag lhan cig nyid do zhes zer ba'i 'dod chags dang / chags pa de dag gcig pa nyid dam tha dad pa nyid du 'gyur grang na /
translated: you say that attachment and one who is attached are produced simultaneously. But are they identical or different?

original: de la / gcig nyid lhan cig nyid med de //
analyzed: de la / gcig nyid lhan cig nyid med de //
translated: They are not identical and not different.

original: re zhig gcig pa nyid yin na lhan cig nyid mi 'thad do //
analyzed: re zhig gcig pa nyid yin na lhan cig nyid mi 'thad do //
translated: First, if they are identical, it is untenable that they are produced simultaneously.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: de nyid de dang lhan cig min //
analyzed: de nyid de dang lhan cig min //
translated: That itself is not simultaneous with itself.

original: 'di na ba lang gcig pu zhes pa ni gcig pa nyid de ba lang gcig la snyegs so //
analyzed: 'di na ba lang gcig pu zhes pa ni gcig pa nyid de ba lang gcig la snyegs so //
translated: Here, “one cow” is oneness, and it is related to one cow.

original: de la ba lang gcig pu de nyid ba lang gcig pu de nyid dang / ji ltar lhan cig tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la ba lang gcig pu de nyid ba lang gcig pu de nyid dang / ji ltar lhan cig tu 'gyur te /
translated: How could that one cow be simultaneous with that one cow?

original: de'i phyir gcig pu nyid yin na lhan cig nyid mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig pu nyid yin na lhan cig nyid mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, if it is one, simultaneity is not tenable.

original: smras pa / 'o na tha dad pa nyid yin na lhan cig nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smras pa / 'o na tha dad pa nyid yin na lhan cig nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Objection: But if they are different, they would be simultaneous.🔽In response, Aryadeva says:

original: bshad pa / ci ste tha dad nyid yin na //
analyzed: bshad pa / ci ste tha dad nyid yin na //
translated: If they are different,

original: lhan cig nyid du ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: lhan cig nyid du ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: how could they be simultaneous?

original: gal te gcig pa nyid yin na yang lhan cig nyid du mi 'thad na tha dad pa nyid yin na lhan cig nyid du ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te gcig pa nyid yin na yang lhan cig nyid du mi 'thad na tha dad pa nyid yin na lhan cig nyid du ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If it is not tenable that they are simultaneous even if they are the same, how could they be simultaneous if they are different?

original: 'di ltar tha dad pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni lhan @184b cig nyid yin na mi mthun pa de gnyis gcig na ji ltar lhan cig gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar tha dad pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni lhan @184b cig nyid yin na mi mthun pa de gnyis gcig na ji ltar lhan cig gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, simultaneity is the opposite of difference. If these two opposites are the same, how could they exist simultaneously?

original: de'i phyir tha dad pa nyid yin na yang lhan cig nyid mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir tha dad pa nyid yin na yang lhan cig nyid mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, if they are different, simultaneity is not tenable.

original: ci ste mi 'thad pa bzhin du yang 'dod chags dang chags pa dag la lhan cig nyid yod do //
analyzed: ci ste mi 'thad pa bzhin du yang 'dod chags dang chags pa dag la lhan cig nyid yod do //
translated: But if it is not tenable, then attachment and one who is attached would exist in mutual dependence.🔽

original: zhes rtog na /
analyzed: zhes rtog na /
translated: But if you think that attachment and one who is attached exist as coexistent things, even though that is untenable,

original: de la yang bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la yang bshad par bya ste /
translated: then Nāgārjuna addresses this point:

original: gal te gcig pu lhan cig na //
analyzed: gal te gcig pu lhan cig na //
translated: If one thing is coexistent,

original: grogs med par yang der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grogs med par yang der 'gyur ro //
translated: Then it would exist without a companion.

original: gal te tha dad lhan cig na //
analyzed: gal te tha dad lhan cig na //
translated: If different things are coexistent,

original: grogs med par yang der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grogs med par yang der 'gyur ro //
translated: Then it would exist without a companion.

original: gal te re zhig 'dod chags dang chags pa dag gcig pa nyid yin yang lhan cig nyid du 'gyur na ni de lta na grogs med par yang lhan cig nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te re zhig 'dod chags dang chags pa dag gcig pa nyid yin yang lhan cig nyid du 'gyur na ni de lta na grogs med par yang lhan cig nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If attachment and one who is attached are one, but they are coexistent, then in that case they would be coexistent even without a companion.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: 'di la gcig ni gcig pu la snyegs te /
analyzed: 'di la gcig ni gcig pu la snyegs te /
translated: Here one thing is applied to one thing.

original: de na ba lang gcig dang rta gcig ces bya ba'i gcig nyid ni ba lang la yang snyegs rta la yang snyegs pas gang dang gang na gcig pa nyid yod pa de dang de na lhan cig nyid yod cing /
analyzed: de na ba lang gcig dang rta gcig ces bya ba'i gcig nyid ni ba lang la yang snyegs rta la yang snyegs pas gang dang gang na gcig pa nyid yod pa de dang de na lhan cig nyid yod cing /
translated: Since the one in “one cow” and “one horse” is applied to the cow and is applied to the horse, wherever one exists, there coexistent things exist.

original: ba lang gcig pu nyid dang / rta gcig pu nyid la grogs med par yang lhan cig nyid yod par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ba lang gcig pu nyid dang / rta gcig pu nyid la grogs med par yang lhan cig nyid yod par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: It follows that a single ox and a single horse would exist as coexistent without a companion.

original: de lta na lhan cig nyid du brtag pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na lhan cig nyid du brtag pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then the investigation of co-existence would be pointless.

original: ci ste yang tha dad pa nyid yin yang /
analyzed: ci ste yang tha dad pa nyid yin yang /
translated: But if, although they are different,

original: lhan cig nyid du 'gyur na ni de lta na yang grogs med par yang lhan cig nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhan cig nyid du 'gyur na ni de lta na yang grogs med par yang lhan cig nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: they would exist as coexistent, then in that case, even without a companion, they would exist as coexistent.

original: ji ltar zhe na /🔽'di la ba lang las kyang rta tha dad la /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / 'di la ba lang las kyang rta tha dad la /
translated: How so?

original: rta las kyang ba lang tha dad pas gang dang gang na tha dad pa nyid yod pa de dang de na lhan cig nyid yod cing /
analyzed: rta las kyang ba lang tha dad pas gang dang gang na tha dad pa nyid yod pa de dang de na lhan cig nyid yod cing /
translated: Here, a horse is different from an ox, and an ox is different from a horse. Therefore, wherever difference exists, there co-existence exists.

original: ba lang tha dad pa nyid dang / rta tha dad pa nyid la grogs med par yang lhan cig nyid yod par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ba lang tha dad pa nyid dang / rta tha dad pa nyid la grogs med par yang lhan cig nyid yod par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: But it follows that the difference of an ox and the difference of a horse would exist as coexistent without a companion.

original: de lta na yang lhan cig nyid du brtag pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang lhan cig nyid du brtag pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then the investigation of co-existence would be pointless.

original: smras pa / tha dad pa nyid ni ba lang la yod pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: smras pa / tha dad pa nyid ni ba lang la yod pa yang ma yin la /
translated: Objection: Difference does not exist in the cow,

original: rta la yod pa yang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rta la yod pa yang ma yin gyi /
translated: nor does it exist in the horse.

original: de gnyi ga lhan cig byung ba la yod pas de ni gnyi ga spyi'i 'bras bu yin te phrad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de gnyi ga lhan cig byung ba la yod pas de ni gnyi ga spyi'i 'bras bu yin te phrad pa bzhin no //
translated: Since it exists in the conjunction of both, it is the effect of both, like contact.

original: gal te tha dad pa nyid so so ba yod par gyur na ni tha dad pa nyid gnyis su 'gyur ba dang / dngos po phan tshun mi ltos par re re la yang yod par 'gyur bas don mi 'dod de /
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa nyid so so ba yod par gyur na ni tha dad pa nyid gnyis su 'gyur ba dang / dngos po phan tshun mi ltos par re re la yang yod par 'gyur bas don mi 'dod de /
translated: If difference existed separately, then difference would be twofold, and each would exist without mutual dependence. But that is unacceptable.

original: de'i phyir tha dad pa nyid ni gnyi ga lhan cig byung ba @185a * //🔽la yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir tha dad pa nyid ni gnyi ga lhan cig byung ba @185a * // la yod do //
translated: Therefore difference exists in the conjunction of both.

original: bshad pa / gal te tha dad lhan cig na //
analyzed: bshad pa / gal te tha dad lhan cig na //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: If difference exists in conjunction,

original: 'dod chags chags pa ci zhig yin //
analyzed: 'dod chags chags pa ci zhig yin //
translated: what is the difference between attachment and one who is attached?

original: tha dad nyid du grub gyur na //
analyzed: tha dad nyid du grub gyur na //
translated: If difference were established,

original: des na de gnyis lhan cig 'gyur //
analyzed: des na de gnyis lhan cig 'gyur //
translated: then those two would exist in conjunction.

original: tha dad pa nyid gnyi ga la yod par ni 'dod la rag go //
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid gnyi ga la yod par ni 'dod la rag go //
translated: You may accept that difference exists in both.

original: gal te tha dad pa nyid gnyi ga la yod pa la lhan cig nyid du rtog na de ltar na 'dod chags dang chags pa dag la ci zhig rab tu bsgrub pa yin /
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa nyid gnyi ga la yod pa la lhan cig nyid du rtog na de ltar na 'dod chags dang chags pa dag la ci zhig rab tu bsgrub pa yin /
translated: If you imagine that co-existence belongs to the two when they are different, then what is established in regard to desire and the desirous one?

original: gang gi tshe de ltar yang rtog na de gnyis tha dad pa nyid du grub pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar yang rtog na de gnyis tha dad pa nyid du grub pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you imagine it in this way, then they are established as different.

original: des na tha dad pa nyid du rab tu grub pa'i phyir de gnyis lhan cig nyid du rtog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na tha dad pa nyid du rab tu grub pa'i phyir de gnyis lhan cig nyid du rtog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because they are established as different, you imagine that they are co-existent.🔽If desire and the desirous one

original: gal te 'dod chags chags pa dag / tha dad nyid du grub 'gyur na //🔽de gnyis lhan cig nyid du ni //
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags chags pa dag / tha dad nyid du grub 'gyur na // de gnyis lhan cig nyid du ni //
translated: are established as different,🔽why do you imagine🔽that they are co-existent?

original: ci yi phyir na yongs su rtog / nyid du zhes bya ba'i sgra ni kho nar zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ci yi phyir na yongs su rtog / nyid du zhes bya ba'i sgra ni kho nar zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word “only” means “exclusively.”

original: gal te 'di snyam du 'dod chags dang chags pa dag tha dad pa'i dngos por grub pa nyid du sems na /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du 'dod chags dang chags pa dag tha dad pa'i dngos por grub pa nyid du sems na /
translated: If you think that desire and the desirous one are established as different things,🔽then why do you imagine that they are co-existent?

original: de gnyis la lhan cig gi dngos po tha dad pa'i dngos po dang mi mthun pa de ni med par ci'i phyir yongs su rtog par byed gang gi tshe tha dad pa'i dngos por grub na lhan cig gi dngos por brtags su zin kyang /🔽'dod chags dang chags pa dag ldog par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de gnyis la lhan cig gi dngos po tha dad pa'i dngos po dang mi mthun pa de ni med par ci'i phyir yongs su rtog par byed gang gi tshe tha dad pa'i dngos por grub na lhan cig gi dngos por brtags su zin kyang / 'dod chags dang chags pa dag ldog par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: When they are established as different things, then even if you imagine that they are coexistent,

original: 'jug par 'gyur ba cung zad tsam yang med do //
analyzed: 'jug par 'gyur ba cung zad tsam yang med do //
translated: there is not the slightest difference between them in terms of engaging or not engaging with attachment.

original: 'di ltar chags pa la 'dod chags kyis yang ci zhig byar yod de /
analyzed: 'di ltar chags pa la 'dod chags kyis yang ci zhig byar yod de /
translated: In that case, what would attachment do for one who is attached?

original: de lta bas na lhan cig gi dngos por brtags su zin kyang tha dad pa nyid kyi skyon chags pa kho na'i phyir lhan cig gi dngos por brtag pa don med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bas na lhan cig gi dngos por brtags su zin kyang tha dad pa nyid kyi skyon chags pa kho na'i phyir lhan cig gi dngos por brtag pa don med par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, even if you imagine that they are coexistent, the error of their being different things still applies. Thus, the imagination that they are coexistent is pointless,

original: tshig zin pa la chus 'debs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: tshig zin pa la chus 'debs pa bzhin no //
translated: like trying to fill a container that already has been filled.

original: tha dad grub par ma gyur pas //
analyzed: tha dad grub par ma gyur pas //
translated: Since they are not established as different,

original: de phyir lhan cig 'dod byed dam //
analyzed: de phyir lhan cig 'dod byed dam //
translated: why do you imagine that they are coexistent?

original: lhan cig rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: lhan cig rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir //
translated: For the sake of establishing their coexistence,

original: tha dad nyid du yang 'dod dam //
analyzed: tha dad nyid du yang 'dod dam //
translated: Or do you assert they are different?

original: 'dod chags dang chags pa dag tha dad pa nyid du ni dgos pa med pa'i phyir grub par ma gyur pas de rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir lhan cig nyid du 'dod par byed la /🔽lhan cig nyid du yang gcig pa nyid kyi skyon chags pa'i phyir ma grub pas de rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir yang tha dad pa nyid du yang 'dod par byed pa khyod ni gos ngan pa lhags pa chen pos nyen pa bskums @185b nas bskums pa yang brnags
analyzed: 'dod chags dang chags pa dag tha dad pa nyid du ni dgos pa med pa'i phyir grub par ma gyur pas de rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir lhan cig nyid du 'dod par byed la / lhan cig nyid du yang gcig pa nyid kyi skyon chags pa'i phyir ma grub pas de rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir yang tha dad pa nyid du yang 'dod par byed pa khyod ni gos ngan pa lhags pa chen pos nyen pa bskums @185b nas bskums pa yang brnags
translated: Since it is not established that attachment and one who is attached are different, because there is no need for them to be different, in order to establish that, you assert they are coexistent.

original: mi bzod pas yang skyong bar byed pa dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: mi bzod pas yang skyong bar byed pa dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: But since it is not established that they are coexistent, because the error of sameness would ensue, in order to establish that, you assert they are different. You are like someone who, unable to bear the cold, wraps himself in a blanket, but then, being unable to bear the heat, uncovers himself.

original: tha dad dngos po ma grub pas //
analyzed: tha dad dngos po ma grub pas //
translated: Since the thing that is different is not established,

original: lhan cig dngos po 'grub mi 'gyur //
analyzed: lhan cig dngos po 'grub mi 'gyur //
translated: The thing that is coexistent is not established.

original: tha dad dngos po gang zhig la //
analyzed: tha dad dngos po gang zhig la //
translated: In what thing that is different

original: lhan cig dngos por 'dod par byed //
analyzed: lhan cig dngos por 'dod par byed //
translated: Is the thing that is coexistent asserted?

original: 'di la so so la tha dad pa'i dngos po yod dam de gnyis lhan cig 'byung ba la yod grang na /
analyzed: 'di la so so la tha dad pa'i dngos po yod dam de gnyis lhan cig 'byung ba la yod grang na /
translated: Here, does the thing that is different exist in each, or does it exist in the two that are coexistent?

original: 'dod chags dang chags pa tha dad du gyur pa dag la ni 'di ni 'dod chags so //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang chags pa tha dad du gyur pa dag la ni 'di ni 'dod chags so //
translated: Desire and the desirous one are different from each other.

original: 'di ni 'dis chags so zhes bya ba de lta bu rnam pa thams cad du mi srid do //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dis chags so zhes bya ba de lta bu rnam pa thams cad du mi srid do //
translated: But if attachment and one who is attached were different, it would be impossible to say, “This is attachment,” and “This is one who is attached.”

original: tha dad pa'i dngos por rab tu grub pa med na lhan cig gi dngos po 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i dngos por rab tu grub pa med na lhan cig gi dngos po 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were established as different things, then they would not be established as coexistent things.

original: 'di ltar khyod ni tha dad pa'i dngos po yod na de gnyis kyi lhan cig gi dngos po yod par 'dod na /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyod ni tha dad pa'i dngos po yod na de gnyis kyi lhan cig gi dngos po yod par 'dod na /
translated: For you assert that the coexistent thing of those two exists if the different thing exists.

original: tha dad pa'i dngos po de yang rnam pa thams cad du mi 'grub po //🔽tha dad pa'i dngos po med na khyod kyi lhan cig gi dngos po yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i dngos po de yang rnam pa thams cad du mi 'grub po // tha dad pa'i dngos po med na khyod kyi lhan cig gi dngos po yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: But that different thing is not established in any way.🔽If the different thing does not exist, how could the coexistent thing exist?

original: 'o na tha dad pa'i dngos po gang zhig yod na 'dod chags dang chags pa dag lhan cig gi dngos por 'dod pa ci re re la yod dam /
analyzed: 'o na tha dad pa'i dngos po gang zhig yod na 'dod chags dang chags pa dag lhan cig gi dngos por 'dod pa ci re re la yod dam /
translated: But if the different thing exists, what is it? Is it the attachment or one who is attached?

original: 'on te gnyi ga lhan cig byung ba la yod dam 'on te khyod kyis rang dgar tha dad pa'i dngos po gzhan zhig brtags kyang rung ste /
analyzed: 'on te gnyi ga lhan cig byung ba la yod dam 'on te khyod kyis rang dgar tha dad pa'i dngos po gzhan zhig brtags kyang rung ste /
translated: But if you say that they exist together, or if you imagine some other different thing on your own,🔽then state what that difference is, in virtue of which you maintain that attachment and one who is attached exist as coexistent things.🔽Attachment and one who is attached are not established

original: tha dad pa gang yod na 'dod chags dang chags pa dag lhan cig gi dngos por 'dod pa de smros shig / de ltar 'dod chags chags pa dag / lhan cig lhan cig min mi 'grub //
analyzed: tha dad pa gang yod na 'dod chags dang chags pa dag lhan cig gi dngos por 'dod pa de smros shig / de ltar 'dod chags chags pa dag / lhan cig lhan cig min mi 'grub //
translated: as coexistent or not coexistent.🔽Just as with attachment,

original: 'dod chags bzhin du chos rnams kun //
analyzed: 'dod chags bzhin du chos rnams kun //
translated: all things are not established

original: lhan cig lhan cig min mi 'grub //🔽gal te 'dod chags snga rol na //
analyzed: lhan cig lhan cig min mi 'grub // gal te 'dod chags snga rol na //
translated: as coexistent or not coexistent.🔽If prior to attachment

original: 'dod chags med pa'i chags yod na //
analyzed: 'dod chags med pa'i chags yod na //
translated: one who is attached existed without attachment,

original: de la brten nas 'dod chags yod //
analyzed: de la brten nas 'dod chags yod //
translated: then attachment would exist in dependence on that.

original: chags yod 'dod chags yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: chags yod 'dod chags yod par 'gyur //
translated: If one who is attached existed, attachment would exist.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang dag sngar 'das pa'i rnams pa de dag gis de ltar 'dod chags rnams chags pa dang lhan cig gam chags pa med par yang 'grub pa med do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang dag sngar 'das pa'i rnams pa de dag gis de ltar 'dod chags rnams chags pa dang lhan cig gam chags pa med par yang 'grub pa med do //
translated: In this way, attachment and one who is attached are not established as coexistent or not coexistent, as was previously explained in the chapter on the past.

original: ji ltar 'dod chags chags pa dang lhan cig gam chags pa med pa yang 'grub pa med pa de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang 'ga' zhig dang lhan cig gam 'ga' yang med par yang 'grub pa med do //🔽'dod @186a * //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod chags chags pa dang lhan cig gam chags pa med pa yang 'grub pa med pa de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang 'ga' zhig dang lhan cig gam 'ga' yang med par yang 'grub pa med do // 'dod @186a * //
translated: Just as attachment and one who is attached are not established as either simultaneous or not simultaneous, so too all things are not established as either simultaneous or not simultaneous with anything.

original: chags dang chags pa brtag pa zhes bya ste rab tu byed pa drug pa'o /
analyzed: chags dang chags pa brtag pa zhes bya ste rab tu byed pa drug pa'o /
translated: Chapter VI Examination of Desire and the Desirous One

original: // /'dir smras pa /
analyzed: // /'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: khyod kyis 'dod chags dang chags pa brtag pa de byas pas kho bo'i yid stong pa nyid nyan pa la spro bar byas kyi /
analyzed: khyod kyis 'dod chags dang chags pa brtag pa de byas pas kho bo'i yid stong pa nyid nyan pa la spro bar byas kyi /
translated: “Since you have examined desire and the desirous one, you have made my mind eager to listen to emptiness.

original: de'i phyir de ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid brtag par bya ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid brtag par bya ba'i rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is appropriate to examine the characteristics of the produced.”

original: bshad pa / de ltar bya'o //
analyzed: bshad pa / de ltar bya'o //
translated: We will do just that.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: 'di la skye ba dang / gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag 'dus byas kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid du bstan te /
analyzed: 'di la skye ba dang / gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag 'dus byas kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid du bstan te /
translated: Arising, enduring, and ceasing are taught to be the general characteristics of the produced.

original: med pa la ni mtshan nyid bstan par mi rigs pas mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir 'dus byas yod do //
analyzed: med pa la ni mtshan nyid bstan par mi rigs pas mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir 'dus byas yod do //
translated: Since it is not tenable to teach characteristics of what does not exist, since characteristics exist, the produced exists.

original: bshad pa / 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid mi 'thad pas de yod pa'i phyir 'dus byas yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: bshad pa / 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid mi 'thad pas de yod pa'i phyir 'dus byas yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: Since the characteristics of conditioned phenomena are untenable, how could conditioned phenomena exist because they exist?

original: gal te ji ltar zhe na /🔽sngar / mtshan nyid med la mtshan nyid ni //🔽mi 'jug mtshan nyid bcas la min //
analyzed: gal te ji ltar zhe na / sngar / mtshan nyid med la mtshan nyid ni // mi 'jug mtshan nyid bcas la min //
translated: If you ask, how?🔽This has already been refuted previously:🔽A characteristic does not apply to that which lacks a characteristic.

original: zhes bstan pas bkag zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bstan pas bkag zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: A characteristic does not apply to that which possesses a characteristic.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: gal te skye ba 'dus byas na //
analyzed: gal te skye ba 'dus byas na //
translated: If arising is conditioned,

original: de la mtshan nyid gsum ldan 'gyur //
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid gsum ldan 'gyur //
translated: it would possess three characteristics.

original: ci ste skye ba 'dus ma byas //
analyzed: ci ste skye ba 'dus ma byas //
translated: But if arising is unconditioned,

original: ji ltar 'dus byas mtshan nyid yin //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dus byas mtshan nyid yin //
translated: how could it be a characteristic of a conditioned phenomenon?

original: zhes bya ba 'di ni /🔽gal te skye ba 'dus byas na //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di ni / gal te skye ba 'dus byas na //
translated: This is also connected to the previous section:🔽If arising is conditioned,

original: ji ltar 'dus byas mtshan nyid yin //🔽zhes phyogs gong ma dang yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dus byas mtshan nyid yin // zhes phyogs gong ma dang yang sbyar ro //
translated: how could it be a characteristic of a conditioned phenomenon?

original: skye ba 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa gang yin pa de yang 'dus byas sam 'dus ma byas shin tu brtag grang na /
analyzed: skye ba 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa gang yin pa de yang 'dus byas sam 'dus ma byas shin tu brtag grang na /
translated: That which is taught to be the characteristic of a conditioned phenomenon should be thoroughly examined as to whether it is conditioned or unconditioned.

original: de la re zhig 'dus byas su yongs su rtog na /
analyzed: de la re zhig 'dus byas su yongs su rtog na /
translated: If it is thoroughly examined as conditioned,

original: skye ba de yang skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mtshan nyid gsum dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye ba de yang skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mtshan nyid gsum dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, that arising would possess three characteristics, since it has the characteristics of arising, enduring, and disintegrating.

original: 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Because it is a conditioned phenomenon.

original: mtshan nyid gsum dang ldan par 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gsum dang ldan par 'gyur ba ni /
translated: Possessing three characteristics

original: mtshan nyid gsum po dag tshogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gsum po dag tshogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: means that the three characteristics would be assembled.

original: smras pa / de yang mtshan nyid gsum dang ldan no //
analyzed: smras pa / de yang mtshan nyid gsum dang ldan no //
translated: Objection: But that also possesses three characteristics.

original: ji ltar 'dus byas mtshan nyid yin /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dus byas mtshan nyid yin /
translated: How is it a characteristic of a conditioned phenomenon?

original: gal te skye ba yang skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan /
analyzed: gal te skye ba yang skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan /
translated: If arising possesses the characteristics of arising, enduring, and disintegrating,

original: gnas pa yang skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan /
analyzed: gnas pa yang skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan /
translated: enduring possesses the characteristics of arising, enduring, and disintegrating,

original: 'jig pa yang skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan na mtshan nyid mtshungs pa'i phyir mtshan nyid rnams la khyad par yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa yang skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan na mtshan nyid mtshungs pa'i phyir mtshan nyid rnams la khyad par yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: and disintegration possesses the characteristics of arising, enduring, and disintegrating, then the characteristics would be distinguished because they are similar.

original: @186b khyad par med na 'di ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: @186b khyad par med na 'di ni skye ba'o //
translated: If they are not distinguished, then this is arising,

original: 'di ni gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gnas pa'o //
translated: this is enduring,🔽and this is disintegrating.

original: 'di ni 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig pa'o //
translated: This is the destruction.🔽

original: zhes bya ba de dag yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de dag yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: How could these be?

original: smras pa / de ni nyes par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: smras pa / de ni nyes par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Objection: That is not a fault.

original: ji ltar spyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin du zin kyang khyad par gyi mtshan nyid la ltos nas 'di ni bum pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar spyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin du zin kyang khyad par gyi mtshan nyid la ltos nas 'di ni bum pa'o //
translated: Just as, in general, the characteristics of conditioned phenomena exist, and in dependence on the specific characteristics, it is said, “This is a vase,”

original: 'di ni snam bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni snam bu'o //
translated: “This is cloth,”

original: zhes bya ba de dag yod pa de bzhin du 'dir yang khyad par gyi mtshan nyid la ltos nas skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag rab tu 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de dag yod pa de bzhin du 'dir yang khyad par gyi mtshan nyid la ltos nas skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag rab tu 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: in the same way, here, in dependence on the specific characteristics, arising, enduring, and disintegrating are established.

original: khyad par de gang zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that specific characteristic?

original: skyed par byed pa dang / gnas par byed pa dang / 'jig par byed pa dag go //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa dang / gnas par byed pa dang / 'jig par byed pa dag go //
translated: The producer, the endurer, and the disintegrator.

original: bshad pa / de ni mi 'thad do /
analyzed: bshad pa / de ni mi 'thad do /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: That is untenable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'di ltar bum pa skyed par byed pa dang / mngon par 'grub par byed pa gang yin pa des ni gzhan ci yang skyed par mi byed la /
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa skyed par byed pa dang / mngon par 'grub par byed pa gang yin pa des ni gzhan ci yang skyed par mi byed la /
translated: Because whatever produces a vase and causes it to be established does not produce anything else.

original: bum pa gnas par byed pas kyang gzhan ci yang gnas par mi byed cing /
analyzed: bum pa gnas par byed pas kyang gzhan ci yang gnas par mi byed cing /
translated: Also, the one that causes the vase to endure does not cause anything else to endure.

original: bum pa 'jig par byed pas kyang gzhan ci yang 'jig par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bum pa 'jig par byed pas kyang gzhan ci yang 'jig par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the one that causes the vase to be destroyed does not cause anything else to be destroyed.

original: smras pa / de dag gis bum pa nyid skye ba dang gnas pa dang / 'jig par byed pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: smras pa / de dag gis bum pa nyid skye ba dang gnas pa dang / 'jig par byed pas nyes pa med do //
translated: Objection: There is no error because they cause the vase itself to arise, endure, and be destroyed.

original: bshad pa / 'o na ni de dag bum pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa / 'o na ni de dag bum pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin te /
translated: Response: But then they are not the characteristics of the vase,

original: byed pa po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are its agents.

original: 'di lta bu skyed par byed pa'i pha bu'i mtshan nyid ma yin la gzhi dang tho ba yang bum pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di lta bu skyed par byed pa'i pha bu'i mtshan nyid ma yin la gzhi dang tho ba yang bum pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: For example, a father who produces a son is not the son’s characteristic, and a base and a hammer are not the characteristics of a vase.

original: de lta bas na skye ba la sogs pa dag 'dus byas yin na 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na skye ba la sogs pa dag 'dus byas yin na 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, if arising and so on are conditioned phenomena, it is untenable that they are the characteristics of conditioned phenomena.

original: ci ste skye ba 'dus ma byas su yongs su rtog na de la yang bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: ci ste skye ba 'dus ma byas su yongs su rtog na de la yang bshad par bya ste /
translated: But if you imagine that arising is an unconditioned phenomenon, then we would respond to that as follows:🔽It is said:

original: 'di ltar 'dus byas mtshan nyid yin //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dus byas mtshan nyid yin //
translated: It is a characteristic of conditioned phenomena.

original: 'dus ma byas yin na ji ltar 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas yin na ji ltar 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If they are unconditioned, how could they be the characteristics of conditioned phenomena?

original: 'dis mtshon par byed pas mtshan nyid yin na gang skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dang bral ba des ni rang nyid la yang mtshan par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'dis mtshon par byed pas mtshan nyid yin na gang skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dang bral ba des ni rang nyid la yang mtshan par mi byed do //
translated: If they are characteristics because they characterize something, then that which is devoid of arising, enduring, and disintegrating does not characterize itself.

original: gang rang nyid la mtshan par mi byed pa des gzhan ji ltar mtshon par byed /
analyzed: gang rang nyid la mtshan par mi byed pa des gzhan ji ltar mtshon par byed /
translated: How could that which does not characterize itself characterize something else?

original: ci ste byed na ni mya ngan las 'das pa 'dus ma byas kyang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin par thal bar 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod de /
analyzed: ci ste byed na ni mya ngan las 'das pa 'dus ma byas kyang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin par thal bar 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod de /
translated: But if it did, then it would follow that unconditioned nirvana would be a characteristic of conditioned phenomena, but that is unacceptable.

original: de lta bas na skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag 'dus ma byas yin na yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du mi 'thad @187a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag 'dus ma byas yin na yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du mi 'thad @187a * //
translated: Thus, even if arising, enduring, and disintegrating were unconditioned, it is untenable that they are the characteristics of conditioned phenomena.

original: de ; / mtshan nyid du brtags na yang skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa dag so so ba'am /
analyzed: de ; / mtshan nyid du brtags na yang skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa dag so so ba'am /
translated: If you imagine that they are characteristics, then either arising, enduring, and disintegrating individually or

original: 'dus pa zhig 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: 'dus pa zhig 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur grang na /
translated: arising, enduring, and disintegrating collectively would be the characteristics of conditioned phenomena.

original: de la / skye sogs gsum po so so yis //🔽'dus byas mtshan 'dra bar ni //
analyzed: de la / skye sogs gsum po so so yis // 'dus byas mtshan 'dra bar ni //
translated: The three, arising, etc., individually🔽are not able to characterize the conditioned.

original: nus min 'dus pa yin na yang //
analyzed: nus min 'dus pa yin na yang //
translated: Even collectively,

original: gcig la dus gcig ji ltar rung //
analyzed: gcig la dus gcig ji ltar rung //
translated: how could they be in one thing at one time?

original: skye ba dang gnas pa dang // skye ba dang gnas pa dang / 'jig pa dag re re la yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid bya bar mi nus te /
analyzed: skye ba dang gnas pa dang // skye ba dang gnas pa dang / 'jig pa dag re re la yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid bya bar mi nus te /
translated: Arising, enduring, and ceasing are not able to function as the characteristics of the conditioned, individually.

original: nus min zhes bya ba ni mi chog pa dang / mi nus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nus min zhes bya ba ni mi chog pa dang / mi nus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Are not able” means “are not possible” and “are not suitable.”

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: 'di la re zhig dngos po mngon par mi grub cing /
analyzed: 'di la re zhig dngos po mngon par mi grub cing /
translated: First, an entity is not established.

original: med pa la ni skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag mi 'thad do //
analyzed: med pa la ni skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag mi 'thad do //
translated: Arising, enduring, and ceasing are not tenable for what is nonexistent.

original: 'di ltar skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag ni dngos po la brten pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag ni dngos po la brten pa yin te /
translated: In this way, arising, enduring, and ceasing are dependent on an entity.

original: bum pa'i skye ba dang / bum pa'i gnas pa dang bum pa'i 'jig pa zhes bya ba yin na bum pa de mngon par ma grub na /
analyzed: bum pa'i skye ba dang / bum pa'i gnas pa dang bum pa'i 'jig pa zhes bya ba yin na bum pa de mngon par ma grub na /
translated: If the arising, enduring, and ceasing of a vase are called the arising, enduring, and ceasing of a vase, then if that vase is not established,

original: skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag gang gi mtshan nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag gang gi mtshan nyid du 'gyur /
translated: What would the characteristics of arising, enduring, and disintegrating be?

original: de ni 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni zhig pa dang med pa ste /
analyzed: de ni 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni zhig pa dang med pa ste /
translated: “That which is called disintegration” is destruction and nonexistence.

original: de gang la yod pa de ni med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de gang la yod pa de ni med pa nyid do //
translated: That which has that is nonexistent.

original: de med na skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag gang gi mtshan nyid du 'gyur te /🔽de ltar re zhig skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag so so'am /
analyzed: de med na skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag gang gi mtshan nyid du 'gyur te / de ltar re zhig skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag so so'am /
translated: If that does not exist, what would the characteristics of arising, enduring, and disintegrating be?

original: 'dus pa yang dngos po mngon par ma grub pa dang / zhig pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dus pa yang dngos po mngon par ma grub pa dang / zhig pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin no //
translated: Thus, first, arising, enduring, and disintegrating are not the characteristics of an entity that is not established or that has been destroyed, either individually or collectively.

original: de la 'di snyam du de dag dngos po mngon par grub pa dang ma zhig pa'i mtshan nyid yin par sems na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du de dag dngos po mngon par grub pa dang ma zhig pa'i mtshan nyid yin par sems na /
translated: If you think that they are the characteristics of an entity that is established and not destroyed,

original: de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: that also is not tenable.

original: ji ltar zhe na /🔽'di la bum pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po yod pa la ni skye ba med de /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / 'di la bum pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po yod pa la ni skye ba med de /
translated: How so?🔽Here, an existent entity called a vase does not arise, because

original: 'di ltar yod pa la yang skye ba'i bya ba med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar yod pa la yang skye ba'i bya ba med do //
translated: an existent entity does not have the activity of arising.

original: ci ste yod kyang skye bar gyur na ni nam yang mi skye bar mi 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: ci ste yod kyang skye bar gyur na ni nam yang mi skye bar mi 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod do //
translated: But if it were to arise even though it exists, then it would never not arise. But that is unacceptable.

original: de ltar bas na yod pa la skye ba med de //
analyzed: de ltar bas na yod pa la skye ba med de //
translated: Thus, arising does not exist for that which exists.

original: med pa gang yin pa de ji ltar mtshan nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: med pa gang yin pa de ji ltar mtshan nyid du 'gyur /
translated: But how could that which does not exist be a characteristic?

original: smras pa / re zhig gnas pa ni yod do //
analyzed: smras pa / re zhig gnas pa ni yod do //
translated: Objection: First, endurance exists.🔽In response, Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / gnas pa yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: bshad pa / gnas pa yang mi 'thad de /
translated: Endurance is also untenable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'jig pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is related to destruction.

original: 'di ltar 'dus byas ni mi rtog pa dang khor zug tu rjes su 'brel pas khor zug tu mi rtag na ji ltar gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dus byas ni mi rtog pa dang khor zug tu rjes su 'brel pas khor zug tu mi rtag na ji ltar gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, since conditioned phenomena are related to impermanence in a continuous and uninterrupted way, how could they endure?

original: gnas pa dang 'jig pa gnyis @187b 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa dang 'jig pa gnyis @187b 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because endurance and destruction are mutually exclusive.

original: 'di ltar 'og nas kyang /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'og nas kyang /
translated: As it will be said below:

original: dngos po 'gag par 'gyur na ni //
analyzed: dngos po 'gag par 'gyur na ni //
translated: If an entity were to cease,

original: gnas par 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas par 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: endurance would not be tenable.

original: gang yang 'gag par mi 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gang yang 'gag par mi 'gyur ba //
translated: That which does not cease

original: de ni dngos po mi 'thad do //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ni dngos po mi 'thad do // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: is untenable as an entity.

original: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
translated: And Master Āryadeva also says:

original: gnas med dngos po ga la yod //
analyzed: gnas med dngos po ga la yod //
translated: How can there be an existent that does not endure?

original: mi rtag pas na gang la gnas //
analyzed: mi rtag pas na gang la gnas //
translated: Since it is impermanent, it does not endure.

original: gal te dang po gnas gyur na //
analyzed: gal te dang po gnas gyur na //
translated: If it endures at first,

original: tha mar rnyings par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha mar rnyings par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it will not age at the end.

original: gal te khor zug mi rtag yod //
analyzed: gal te khor zug mi rtag yod //
translated: If it endures and is impermanent,

original: khor zug gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khor zug gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it will not endure.

original: yang na rtag par gyur pa las //
analyzed: yang na rtag par gyur pa las //
translated: If it is permanent,

original: phyis na mi rtag par yang 'gyur //
analyzed: phyis na mi rtag par yang 'gyur //
translated: it will not become impermanent later.🔽If an impermanent thing

original: gal te dngos po mi rtag dang // lhan cig gnas pa yod gyur na //🔽mi rtag log par 'gyur ba'am //
analyzed: gal te dngos po mi rtag dang // lhan cig gnas pa yod gyur na // mi rtag log par 'gyur ba'am //
translated: existed together with endurance,🔽either impermanence would be wrong,

original: yang na gnas pa brdzun par 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yang na gnas pa brdzun par 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: or endurance would be false.

original: de lta bas na gnas pa yang med de /
analyzed: de lta bas na gnas pa yang med de /
translated: Thus, endurance does not exist.

original: med na gang yin pa ji ltar 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: med na gang yin pa ji ltar 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur /
translated: If it does not exist, how could it be a characteristic of the produced?

original: smras pa / 'o na 'jig pa yod do //
analyzed: smras pa / 'o na 'jig pa yod do //
translated: Objection: But destruction exists.

original: bshad pa / gnas pa med par 'jig pa ga la yod de /
analyzed: bshad pa / gnas pa med par 'jig pa ga la yod de /
translated: In response, Aryadeva says: How can there be destruction without endurance?

original: 'di ltar dngos po gnas pa yod na 'jig par 'gyur gyi gnas pa med na 'jig par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po gnas pa yod na 'jig par 'gyur gyi gnas pa med na 'jig par ga la 'gyur /
