translated: If an existent endures, it can be destroyed. How can it be destroyed if it does not endure?

original: de yang 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni zhig pa dang med pa ste de gang la yod pa de ni med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de yang 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni zhig pa dang med pa ste de gang la yod pa de ni med pa nyid do //
translated: Moreover, “destruction” is the state of having been destroyed and the state of nonexistence. That which has that is nonexistent.

original: de med na skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag gang gi mtshan nyid du 'gyur zhes bstan zin pas de'i phyir 'jig pa yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de med na skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag gang gi mtshan nyid du 'gyur zhes bstan zin pas de'i phyir 'jig pa yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du mi 'thad do //
translated: If that does not exist, then with respect to what would arising, enduring, and disintegrating be characteristics? Since this has already been explained, therefore destruction is not tenable as a characteristic of conditioned phenomena.

original: de'i phyir de ltar skye ba dang gnas pa dang / 'jig pa dag so so ba yang 'dus byas mngon par grub pa'i mtshan nyid du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar skye ba dang gnas pa dang / 'jig pa dag so so ba yang 'dus byas mngon par grub pa'i mtshan nyid du mi 'thad do //
translated: Thus arising, enduring, and disintegrating are not tenable as the characteristics of conditioned phenomena individually.

original: lhan cig tu skye'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir chos kyi gnas skabs shes pa dag skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag lhan cig tu skye'o zhes brjod pas de'i phyir yang so so ba dag mtshan nyid du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: lhan cig tu skye'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir chos kyi gnas skabs shes pa dag skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag lhan cig tu skye'o zhes brjod pas de'i phyir yang so so ba dag mtshan nyid du mi 'thad do //
translated: Since it is said that they arise together, those who know the state of phenomena say that arising, enduring, and disintegrating arise together. Therefore it is also not tenable that they are characteristics individually.

original: smras pa / 'dus pa dag ni mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / 'dus pa dag ni mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: Objection: The collection is the characteristic.🔽In response, Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / 'dus pa yin na yang /
analyzed: bshad pa / 'dus pa yin na yang /
translated: Even if they are a collection,

original: gcig la dus gcig ji ltar rung /
analyzed: gcig la dus gcig ji ltar rung /
translated: How could they be suitable in one at one time?

original: so so ba gang dag mtshan nyid ma yin pa de dag 'dus pa phan tshun 'gal ba dag 'dus byas kyi dngos po gcig la dus gcig tu ji ltar rung /
analyzed: so so ba gang dag mtshan nyid ma yin pa de dag 'dus pa phan tshun 'gal ba dag 'dus byas kyi dngos po gcig la dus gcig tu ji ltar rung /
translated: How could those individual characteristics that are not characteristics be suitable in one conditioned thing at one time, since they mutually contradict each other when they assemble?

original: 'di ltar gang gi tshe na skye ba de'i tshe na gnas pa dang 'jig pa med la /🔽gang gi tshe gnas pa de'i tshe na skye ba dang 'jig @188a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi tshe na skye ba de'i tshe na gnas pa dang 'jig pa med la / gang gi tshe gnas pa de'i tshe na skye ba dang 'jig @188a * //
translated: In this way, when there is arising, at that time there is neither enduring nor disintegrating.

original: pa med cing /
analyzed: pa med cing /
translated: When there is enduring, at that time there is neither arising nor disintegrating.🔽When there is disintegrating, at that time there is neither arising nor enduring.

original: gang gi tshe 'jig pa de'i tshe na yang skye ba dang gnas pa med pa de'i phyir skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa so so ba dang 'dus pa dag kyang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'jig pa de'i tshe na yang skye ba dang gnas pa med pa de'i phyir skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa so so ba dang 'dus pa dag kyang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, arising, enduring, and disintegrating, individually and collectively, are untenable as characteristics of conditioned phenomena.

original: mtshan nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir 'dus byas yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir 'dus byas yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because the characteristics are untenable, conditioned phenomena do not exist.

original: smras pa ; ltag chod de lta bu 'ba' zhig gis ci bya /
analyzed: smras pa ; ltag chod de lta bu 'ba' zhig gis ci bya /
translated: Objection: What is the point of this mere sophistry?

original: yod ni gang gi skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa de 'dus byas yin no //
analyzed: yod ni gang gi skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa de 'dus byas yin no //
translated: That which has arising, enduring, and disintegrating exists and is conditioned.

original: bshad pa / kho bo ltag chod kyi phyir mi rtsom gyis kho bo ni de kho na shes par bya ba'i phyir rtsom mo //
analyzed: bshad pa / kho bo ltag chod kyi phyir mi rtsom gyis kho bo ni de kho na shes par bya ba'i phyir rtsom mo //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: We do not argue for the sake of quibbling, but rather to understand reality.

original: skye ba zhes bya ba de gang yin pa smros shig /
analyzed: skye ba zhes bya ba de gang yin pa smros shig /
translated: Tell us, what is this so-called arising?

original: smras pa / bum pa skye'o //
analyzed: smras pa / bum pa skye'o //
translated: Objection: A vase arises.🔽Nāgārjuna responds: First, think carefully about the state in which a vase comes to be called a vase, and then speak.

original: bshad pa / re zhig gnas skabs gang la bum pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ba legs par soms la smros shig / de la gang gi tshe ma skyes pa la ni bum pa zhes byar yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: bshad pa / re zhig gnas skabs gang la bum pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ba legs par soms la smros shig / de la gang gi tshe ma skyes pa la ni bum pa zhes byar yang mi rung ste /
translated: If it is not yet arisen, it is not suitable to be called a vase.

original: skyes pa nyid la bum pa zhes bya bar 'gyur zhing bum pa yang 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir mtshan nyid gsum dang ldan pa nyid yin pa de'i tshe skye ba bum pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: skyes pa nyid la bum pa zhes bya bar 'gyur zhing bum pa yang 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir mtshan nyid gsum dang ldan pa nyid yin pa de'i tshe skye ba bum pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: When it is arisen, it is called a vase. Since a vase is a conditioned phenomenon, it possesses the three characteristics. At that time, arising is the characteristic of a vase.

original: zhes bya ba de ji ltar 'thad //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de ji ltar 'thad //
translated: How could that be tenable?

original: ji ltar yod pa la yang skye bas ci bya /
analyzed: ji ltar yod pa la yang skye bas ci bya /
translated: If it exists, what does arising do for it?

original: mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la yang mtshan nyid kyis ci bya /
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la yang mtshan nyid kyis ci bya /
translated: If it possesses characteristics, what does a characteristic do for it?

original: ci ste bum pa ma yin pa skye zhing skyes zin nas bum par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste bum pa ma yin pa skye zhing skyes zin nas bum par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: But if you think that which is not a vase arises and having arisen becomes a vase,

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /🔽bum pa ma yin pa skye zhing zhes bya ba de re lde'am /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te / bum pa ma yin pa skye zhing zhes bya ba de re lde'am /
translated: that also is not logical.

original: snam bu'am / 'on te bum pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ci yang med pa zhig gam ci yin /🔽de la re zhig gal te re lde'am /
analyzed: snam bu'am / 'on te bum pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ci yang med pa zhig gam ci yin / de la re zhig gal te re lde'am /
translated: If that which is not a vase arises, is it a straw mat or a woolen cloth or is it something that is called “that which is not a vase” that does not exist at all?

original: snam bu zhig skye na ni de skyes zin nas ji ltar bum par 'gyur /
analyzed: snam bu zhig skye na ni de skyes zin nas ji ltar bum par 'gyur /
translated: First, if a straw mat or a woolen cloth arises, then having arisen, how could it become a vase?

original: ci ste bum pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ci'ang med pa zhig yin na ni ci yang med pa gang yin pa de ji ltar skye ci ste skye na ni ri bong gi rva yang ci'i phyir mi skye /
analyzed: ci ste bum pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ci'ang med pa zhig yin na ni ci yang med pa gang yin pa de ji ltar skye ci ste skye na ni ri bong gi rva yang ci'i phyir mi skye /
translated: But if that which is called “that which is not a vase” does not exist at all, then how could that which is nothing at all arise? But if it arises, then why does the horn of an ass not arise?

original: de'i phyir skye ba zhes bya ba de mi 'thad do //🔽skye ba zhes bya ba de 'di la med na gang skye ba de 'dus byas yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba zhes bya ba de mi 'thad do // skye ba zhes bya ba de 'di la med na gang skye ba de 'dus byas yin no //
translated: Therefore, that which is called “arising” is untenable.

original: zhes bya ba de ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur /
translated: If that which is called “arising” does not exist here, then how could it be tenable to state, “That which arises is a conditioned phenomenon”?

original: gang skye ba med pa ji ltar gnas pa dang 'jig par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang skye ba med pa ji ltar gnas pa dang 'jig par 'gyur /
translated: How could that which does not arise endure and be destroyed?

original: de lta na skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa zhes bya ba dag ni /
analyzed: de lta na skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa zhes bya ba dag ni /
translated: Thus arising, enduring, and being destroyed are

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kho nar zad do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kho nar zad do //
translated: merely mundane conventions.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover:

original: skye dang gnas dang 'jig rnams la //🔽'dus byas mtshan nyid gzhan zhig ni //
analyzed: skye dang gnas dang 'jig rnams la // 'dus byas mtshan nyid gzhan zhig ni //
translated: Arising, enduring, and being destroyed🔽If the characteristics of conditioned phenomena

original: gal te yod na thug pa med //
analyzed: gal te yod na thug pa med //
translated: Have another characteristic, there is an infinite regress.

original: med na de @188b dag 'dus byas min //
analyzed: med na de @188b dag 'dus byas min //
translated: If they do not have another characteristic, they are not conditioned phenomena.

original: skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa gang dag 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du bstan pa de dag la 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gzhan zhig yod dam 'on te med /
analyzed: skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa gang dag 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du bstan pa de dag la 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gzhan zhig yod dam 'on te med /
translated: Arising, enduring, and being destroyed are taught to be the characteristics of conditioned phenomena. Do they have another characteristic or do they not?

original: de la re zhig gal te de dag las 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gzhan zhig yod na ni de lta na thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la re zhig gal te de dag las 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gzhan zhig yod na ni de lta na thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: First, if they have another characteristic, then it follows that there would be an infinite regress.

original: skye ba la yang skye ba yod la de la yang gzhan zhig yod cing de la yang gzhan yod de /
analyzed: skye ba la yang skye ba yod la de la yang gzhan zhig yod cing de la yang gzhan yod de /
translated: Arising would have arising, and that would have another, and that would have another.

original: mtha' med par 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: mtha' med par 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod do //
translated: But that is unacceptable, because it would be endless.

original: ci ste thug pa med par gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pa de dag la 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gzhan med par sems na /
analyzed: ci ste thug pa med par gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pa de dag la 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gzhan med par sems na /
translated: If you think that it is not tenable that there is no end, and you think that these do not have other characteristics of conditioned phenomena,

original: de lta na yang de dag 'dus byas ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na yang de dag 'dus byas ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: then in that case they would not be conditioned phenomena.

original: 'dus byas ma yin na ji ltar 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'dus byas ma yin na ji ltar 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If they are not conditioned phenomena, how could they be characteristics of conditioned phenomena?

original: sngar bstan zin to /
analyzed: sngar bstan zin to /
translated: This has already been explained.

original: // / dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa bud dha p'a li ta /
analyzed: // / dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa bud dha p'a li ta /
translated: Buddhapālita’s Commentary on the Root Verses of the Middle Way

original: bam po gsum pa /
analyzed: bam po gsum pa /
translated: Volume Three

original: smras pa / skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag 'dus byas kyang yin la /
analyzed: smras pa / skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag 'dus byas kyang yin la /
translated: Objection: Arising, enduring, and disintegrating are conditioned phenomena,

original: thug pa med par yang thal bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: thug pa med par yang thal bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: and it is not the case that it would follow that there is an infinite regress.

original: ji ltar zhe na /🔽skye ba'i skye bas rtsa ba yi //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / skye ba'i skye bas rtsa ba yi //
translated: How is that?🔽The arising of arising

original: skye ba 'ba' zhig skyed par byed //
analyzed: skye ba 'ba' zhig skyed par byed //
translated: Generates only the basic arising.

original: rtsa ba'i skye bas skye ba yi //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i skye bas skye ba yi //
translated: The basic arising

original: skye ba'ang skyed par byed pa yin //
analyzed: skye ba'ang skyed par byed pa yin //
translated: Generates the arising of arising.

original: 'di la rnam par shes pa la sogs pa chos rnams las chos gang yang rung ba zhig skye ba na de bdag nyid dang bco lnga ste /
analyzed: 'di la rnam par shes pa la sogs pa chos rnams las chos gang yang rung ba zhig skye ba na de bdag nyid dang bco lnga ste /
translated: When any phenomenon arises, such as consciousness and so on, it arises with fifteen things:

original: chos de dang / chos de'i skye ba dang / chos de'i gnas pa dang / chos de'i 'jig pa dang / chos de'i ldan pa dang / chos de'i rga ba dang / 'dir gal te chos de dkar po yin na chos de yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba'am /
analyzed: chos de dang / chos de'i skye ba dang / chos de'i gnas pa dang / chos de'i 'jig pa dang / chos de'i ldan pa dang / chos de'i rga ba dang / 'dir gal te chos de dkar po yin na chos de yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba'am /
translated: the phenomenon itself, the arising of the phenomenon, the enduring of the phenomenon, the disintegrating of the phenomenon, the possession of the phenomenon, the aging of the phenomenon, and if the phenomenon is white, then the purification of the phenomenon or

original: ci ste chos de nag po yin na chos de'i log pa'i rnam par grol ba dang / de bzhin du gal te chos de nges par 'byung ba yin na chos de'i nges par 'byung ba nyid dam /
analyzed: ci ste chos de nag po yin na chos de'i log pa'i rnam par grol ba dang / de bzhin du gal te chos de nges par 'byung ba yin na chos de'i nges par 'byung ba nyid dam /
translated: if the phenomenon is black, then the nonpurification of the phenomenon, and if the phenomenon is renunciation, then the renunciation of the phenomenon or

original: ci ste chos de nges par 'byung ba ma yin na chos de'i nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa nyid skye ste /
analyzed: ci ste chos de nges par 'byung ba ma yin na chos de'i nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa nyid skye ste /
translated: if the phenomenon is nonrenunciation, then the nonrenunciation of the phenomenon.

original: de dag ni re zhig 'khor ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni re zhig 'khor ces bya'o //
translated: These are called the retinue.

original: de ni skye ba'i skye ba dang / gnas pa'i gnas pa dang / 'jig pa'i 'jig pa dang / ldan pa'i ldan pa dang / rga ba'i rga ba dang / yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba'i yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba'am /
analyzed: de ni skye ba'i skye ba dang / gnas pa'i gnas pa dang / 'jig pa'i 'jig pa dang / ldan pa'i ldan pa dang / rga ba'i rga ba dang / yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba'i yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba'am /
translated: that is, the arising of arising, the enduring of enduring, the aging of aging, the passing away of passing away, the possession of possession, the aging of aging, the correct liberation of correct liberation,

original: log pa'i rnam par grol ba'i log pa'i rnam par grol ba dang / nges par 'byung @189a * //🔽pa nyid kyi nges par 'byung ba nyid dam /
analyzed: log pa'i rnam par grol ba'i log pa'i rnam par grol ba dang / nges par 'byung @189a * // pa nyid kyi nges par 'byung ba nyid dam /
translated: or the incorrect liberation of incorrect liberation, the renunciation of renunciation,

original: nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa nyid kyi nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa nyid kyang skye ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa nyid kyi nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa nyid kyang skye ste /
translated: or the non-renunciation of non-renunciation.

original: de dag ni 'khor gyi 'khor ces bya ste /🔽de ltar chos skye ba bdag nyid dang bco lnga skye'o //
analyzed: de dag ni 'khor gyi 'khor ces bya ste / de ltar chos skye ba bdag nyid dang bco lnga skye'o //
translated: These are called the “sub-moments of the primary moments.”🔽Thus, fifteen things arise together with the arising of a single dharma.

original: de la rtsa ba'i skye ba gang yin pa des ni bdag nyid ma gtogs par chos de'i bdag nyid dang bcu bzhi po ji skad bstan pa dag skyed par byed do //
analyzed: de la rtsa ba'i skye ba gang yin pa des ni bdag nyid ma gtogs par chos de'i bdag nyid dang bcu bzhi po ji skad bstan pa dag skyed par byed do //
translated: Among them, the primary arising gives rise to fourteen things, excluding itself, that are of the same nature as that dharma that was mentioned.

original: skye ba'i skye bas ni rtsa ba'i skye ba de 'ba' zhig skyed par byed de /
analyzed: skye ba'i skye bas ni rtsa ba'i skye ba de 'ba' zhig skyed par byed de /
translated: The arising of arising generates the root arising alone.

original: de ltar gcig gis gcig skyed par byed pas thug pa med par mi 'gyur ro //🔽de bzhin du rtsa ba'i gnas pas kyang gnas pa'i gnas /
analyzed: de ltar gcig gis gcig skyed par byed pas thug pa med par mi 'gyur ro // de bzhin du rtsa ba'i gnas pas kyang gnas pa'i gnas /
translated: Since they generate each other in this way, there is no infinite regress.

original: pa gnas par byed la /
analyzed: pa gnas par byed la /
translated: In the same way, the root endurance causes the endurance of endurance.

original: gnas pa'i gnas pas kyang rtsa ba'i gnas pa gnas par byed do //
analyzed: gnas pa'i gnas pas kyang rtsa ba'i gnas pa gnas par byed do //
translated: The endurance of endurance causes the root endurance.

original: rtsa ba'i 'jig pas kyang 'jig pa'i 'jig pa 'jig par byed la /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i 'jig pas kyang 'jig pa'i 'jig pa 'jig par byed la /
translated: The root disintegration causes the disintegration of disintegration.

original: 'jig pa'i 'jig pas kyang rtsa ba'i 'jig pa 'jig par byed pas de ltar na 'di la yang thug pa med par thal par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i 'jig pas kyang rtsa ba'i 'jig pa 'jig par byed pas de ltar na 'di la yang thug pa med par thal par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The disintegration of disintegration causes the root disintegration. Thus, there is no infinite regress here.🔽Nāgārjuna responds:

original: bshad pa / gal te khyod kyi skye ba'i skyes //
analyzed: bshad pa / gal te khyod kyi skye ba'i skyes //
translated: If your arising of arising

original: rtsa ba'i skye ba skyed byed na //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i skye ba skyed byed na //
translated: generates the root arising,

original: khyod kyi bu bas ma skyed des //
analyzed: khyod kyi bu bas ma skyed des //
translated: then your son would not generate you,

original: de ni ji ltar skyed par byed //
analyzed: de ni ji ltar skyed par byed //
translated: so how could he generate you?

original: gal te khyod kyi skye ba'i skye bas rtsa ba'i skye ba skyed par byed na khyod kyi rtsa ba'i skyed pas ma skyes pa'i skye ba des rtsa ba'i skye ba de ji ltar skyed par byed de /
analyzed: gal te khyod kyi skye ba'i skye bas rtsa ba'i skye ba skyed par byed na khyod kyi rtsa ba'i skyed pas ma skyes pa'i skye ba des rtsa ba'i skye ba de ji ltar skyed par byed de /
translated: If your arising arising causes the generation of the basic arising, then how could that arising arising, which is not generated by the basic arising, cause the generation of the basic arising?

original: rang nyid ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it itself is not generated.

original: smras pa / rtsa ba'i skye bas bskyed pa kho na'i skye ba skye bas rtsa ba'i skye ba skyed par byed kyi ma skyed pas mi byed do //
analyzed: smras pa / rtsa ba'i skye bas bskyed pa kho na'i skye ba skye bas rtsa ba'i skye ba skyed par byed kyi ma skyed pas mi byed do //
translated: Objection: The arising that is generated by the basic arising causes the generation of the basic arising, but that which is not generated does not cause generation.🔽In response, Aryadeva says:

original: bshad pa / gal te khyod kyi rtsa ba yis //
analyzed: bshad pa / gal te khyod kyi rtsa ba yis //
translated: If that which is generated

original: bskyed pa de yis rtsa skyed na //🔽des ma skyed pa'i rtsa ba des //
analyzed: bskyed pa de yis rtsa skyed na // des ma skyed pa'i rtsa ba des //
translated: by your basic arising causes the generation of the basic arising,🔽then how could that basic arising,

original: de ni ji ltar skyed par byed //
analyzed: de ni ji ltar skyed par byed //
translated: which is not generated by it, cause the generation of that?

original: gal te khyod kyi rtsa ba'i skye bas bskyed pa'i skye ba'i skye ba des rtsa ba'i skye ba de skyed bar byed na skye ba'i skye ba des ma skyed pa'i rtsa ba'i skye ba des skye ba'i skye ba de ji ltar skyed par byed /
analyzed: gal te khyod kyi rtsa ba'i skye bas bskyed pa'i skye ba'i skye ba des rtsa ba'i skye ba de skyed bar byed na skye ba'i skye ba des ma skyed pa'i rtsa ba'i skye ba des skye ba'i skye ba de ji ltar skyed par byed /
translated: If the arising arising, which is generated by your basic arising, causes the generation of the basic arising, then how could the basic arising, which is not generated by the arising arising, cause the generation of the arising arising?

original: de ltar na de ni gcig la gcig brten pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na de ni gcig la gcig brten pa yin te /
translated: Thus, they are mutually dependent.

original: gcig la gcig brten pa dag ni rab tu rtag tu mi rung ngo //🔽smras pa / skye ba nyid skye bzhin pas skye ba'i skye ba skyed par byed kyi ma skyes pas ni mi byed do //
analyzed: gcig la gcig brten pa dag ni rab tu rtag tu mi rung ngo // smras pa / skye ba nyid skye bzhin pas skye ba'i skye ba skyed par byed kyi ma skyes pas ni mi byed do //
translated: But it is never tenable that mutually dependent things are real.

original: bshad pa // khyod kyi de ni skye bzhin pa //🔽ma skyes de yis gal te ni //
analyzed: bshad pa // khyod kyi de ni skye bzhin pa // ma skyes de yis gal te ni //
translated: Objection: The arising of arising itself causes the generation of the arising of arising. But it does not cause the generation of the arising of arising that has not yet arisen.🔽In response, Aryadeva says:🔽If that arising of arising

original: de ni skyes par byed nus na //
analyzed: de ni skyes par byed nus na //
translated: Causes the generation of that,🔽Then it is only the arising of arising🔽That you want to generate.

original: de skyed par ni 'dod la rag / khyod kyi rtsa ba'i skye ba de skye bzhin pa rang nyid ma skyes pa des gal te skye @189b ba'i skye ba gzhan de skyed par byed nus na ni skye ba'i skye ba de skyed par 'dod la rag go //
analyzed: de skyed par ni 'dod la rag / khyod kyi rtsa ba'i skye ba de skye bzhin pa rang nyid ma skyes pa des gal te skye @189b ba'i skye ba gzhan de skyed par byed nus na ni skye ba'i skye ba de skyed par 'dod la rag go //
translated: If that basic arising that is in the process of arising causes the generation of that other arising of arising that has not yet arisen, then it is only the arising of arising that you want to generate.

original: yang na khyod kyi skye ba'i skye ba de skye bzhin pa rang nyid ma skyes pa des gal te rtsa ba'i skye ba gzhan de skyed par byed nus na ni rtsa ba'i skye ba de skyed par byad la rag na mi nus te /
analyzed: yang na khyod kyi skye ba'i skye ba de skye bzhin pa rang nyid ma skyes pa des gal te rtsa ba'i skye ba gzhan de skyed par byed nus na ni rtsa ba'i skye ba de skyed par byad la rag na mi nus te /
translated: Moreover, if the arising of arising itself, which is not yet arisen, is able to give rise to the other, the basic arising, then it would have to give rise to the basic arising, but it is not able to do so.

original: 'di ltar rang nyid ma skyes shing med pas gzhan ji ltar skyed par byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar rang nyid ma skyes shing med pas gzhan ji ltar skyed par byed de /
translated: Why is this? Since it itself is not arisen and does not exist, how could it give rise to another?

original: de'i phyir de ni rtog pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni rtog pa tsam du zad do //
translated: Therefore, this is mere speculation.

original: smras pa / skye ba gzhan gyis skyed par mi byed kyang skye ba nyid kyis rang dang gzhan dag bskyed bar bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / skye ba gzhan gyis skyed par mi byed kyang skye ba nyid kyis rang dang gzhan dag bskyed bar bya'o //
translated: Objection: Even though it is not generated by another arising, arising itself gives rise to itself and others.

original: ji ltar zhe na /🔽ji ltar mar mi rang dang gzhan //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / ji ltar mar mi rang dang gzhan //
translated: How is this?

original: snang bar byed pa de bzhin du //🔽skye ba'ang rang dang gzhan gyi dngos //
analyzed: snang bar byed pa de bzhin du // skye ba'ang rang dang gzhan gyi dngos //
translated: Just as a lamp illuminates🔽itself and others,🔽so too arising

original: gnyi ga skyed par byed pa yin //
analyzed: gnyi ga skyed par byed pa yin //
translated: gives rise to itself and others.

original: ji ltar mar mes rang gi bdag nyid kyang snang bar byed la bum pa dang / snam bu la sogs pa dngos po gzhan dag kyang snang bar byed pa de bzhin du skye bas kyang rang gi bdag nyid kyang skyed par byed la bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa dngos po gzhan dag kyang skyed par byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar mar mes rang gi bdag nyid kyang snang bar byed la bum pa dang / snam bu la sogs pa dngos po gzhan dag kyang snang bar byed pa de bzhin du skye bas kyang rang gi bdag nyid kyang skyed par byed la bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa dngos po gzhan dag kyang skyed par byed do //
translated: Just as a butterlamp illuminates both itself and others, so too arising gives rise to both itself and others.

original: bshad pa / gal te mar mes rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag snang bar byed na ni skye bas kyang mar me bzhin du rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag skyed par byed la rag na /
analyzed: bshad pa / gal te mar mes rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag snang bar byed na ni skye bas kyang mar me bzhin du rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag skyed par byed la rag na /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: If a butterlamp illuminates both itself and others, then like a butterlamp, arising would give rise to both itself and others.

original: mar mes ni rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag snang bar mi byed do //
analyzed: mar mes ni rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag snang bar mi byed do //
translated: But a butterlamp does not illuminate both itself and others.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar / mar me dang ni gang dag na //
analyzed: 'di ltar / mar me dang ni gang dag na //
translated: Because a butterlamp and those🔽that are illuminated by it

original: de 'dug pa na mun pa med //
analyzed: de 'dug pa na mun pa med //
translated: are not in the dark.

original: 'di na gang mi snang ba de snang bar bya ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di na gang mi snang ba de snang bar bya ba yin la /
translated: That which is not illuminated is what is illuminated.

original: mun pas bsgribs pas mi snang ba nyid yin na mar me la ni mun pas de'i phyir mar me la mi snang ba med do //
analyzed: mun pas bsgribs pas mi snang ba nyid yin na mar me la ni mun pas de'i phyir mar me la mi snang ba med do //
translated: If it is the darkness that obscures it, then since the lamp is not darkness, the lamp is not obscured.

original: gzhan dag snang bar byed do zhes gang smras pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag snang bar byed do zhes gang smras pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Also, it is not tenable to say that the lamp illuminates itself and others.🔽The lamp does not enter into itself, and the lamp does not enter into others.

original: mar me gzhan bdag nyid dag la 'jug pa de yang mun pa med de /
analyzed: mar me gzhan bdag nyid dag la 'jug pa de yang mun pa med de /
translated: Since the lamp does not enter into itself and others, darkness does not exist there.

original: mun pa med pa'i phyir de dag la yang mi snang ba med do //
analyzed: mun pa med pa'i phyir de dag la yang mi snang ba med do //
translated: Since darkness does not exist there, it is not obscured.

original: 'o na rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag la mi snang ba med na /
analyzed: 'o na rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag la mi snang ba med na /
translated: If the lamp does not illuminate itself and others,

original: mar mes ci zhig snang bar byed /
analyzed: mar mes ci zhig snang bar byed /
translated: what does the lamp illuminate?

original: de smros shig / smras pa /
analyzed: de smros shig / smras pa /
translated: Explain this!

original: mun pa sel bas snang byed yin /🔽'di na mar me skye bzhin pas mun pa sel cing snang bar byed pas snang bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: mun pa sel bas snang byed yin / 'di na mar me skye bzhin pas mun pa sel cing snang bar byed pas snang bar byed pa yin te /
translated: Objection: It is a light because it clears darkness.🔽Here, the lamp that is in the process of arising clears darkness and illuminates itself and others.

original: de la mun pa sel bar byed ba gang yin ma de mar me rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag snang bar byed la yin no zhes smras pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de la mun pa sel bar byed ba gang yin ma de mar me rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag snang bar byed la yin no zhes smras pa de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the lamp clears darkness and illuminates itself and others.

original: mar me dang ni gang dag na //🔽'du bye pa na mun pa med //
analyzed: mar me dang ni gang dag na // 'du bye pa na mun pa med //
translated: And where there are lamps,🔽There is no darkness.🔽

original: ces kyang bshad pas mar @190a * //
analyzed: ces kyang bshad pas mar @190a * //
translated: And also because it is said:🔽“Where there is a lamp, there is no darkness.”🔽Therefore, since a lamp dispels darkness as it arises,

original: me skye bzhin pas mun pa sel ba'i phyir des na mar me rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag la mun pa med do //
analyzed: me skye bzhin pas mun pa sel ba'i phyir des na mar me rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag la mun pa med do //
translated: it is not the case that a lamp is not luminous with respect to itself and others.

original: mun pa med pa'i phyir snang bar byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: mun pa med pa'i phyir snang bar byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: Because it is not dark, it illuminates.

original: de ltar mun pa sel bar byed pa'i phyir mar mes ni rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag snang bar byed do //
analyzed: de ltar mun pa sel bar byed pa'i phyir mar mes ni rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag snang bar byed do //
translated: Thus, because it dispels darkness, a lamp illuminates itself and others.🔽Just as it is with a lamp, so it is with arising: it gives rise to itself and others.

original: mar me ji lta ba de bzhin du skye bas kyang rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid de dag skyed par byed do zhes bya ba de rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: mar me ji lta ba de bzhin du skye bas kyang rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid de dag skyed par byed do zhes bya ba de rigs pa yin no //
translated: This is the argument.

original: bshad pa / mar me skye bzhin pas mun pa sel bar byed do //
analyzed: bshad pa / mar me skye bzhin pas mun pa sel bar byed do //
translated: We say that a lamp dispels darkness as it arises.🔽Explain this:

original: zhes zer ba de smros shig / ji ltar mar me skye bzhin pas //
analyzed: zhes zer ba de smros shig / ji ltar mar me skye bzhin pas //
translated: How does a lamp

original: mun pa sel par byed pa yin //
analyzed: mun pa sel par byed pa yin //
translated: dispels darkness?

original: gang tshe mar me skye bzhin pa //
analyzed: gang tshe mar me skye bzhin pa //
translated: When a lamp arises,

original: mun pa dang ni phrad pa med //
analyzed: mun pa dang ni phrad pa med //
translated: it does not contact darkness.

original: gang tshe mar me dang mun pa dag gcig ni mi srid pa'i phyir mar me skye bzhin pa mun pa dang phrad pa med pa de'i phyir ji ltar mar me skye bzhin pa mun pa dang ma phrad pa des mun pa sel bar byed //
analyzed: gang tshe mar me dang mun pa dag gcig ni mi srid pa'i phyir mar me skye bzhin pa mun pa dang phrad pa med pa de'i phyir ji ltar mar me skye bzhin pa mun pa dang ma phrad pa des mun pa sel bar byed //
translated: If a lamp removes darkness

original: mar me phrad pa med par yang //
analyzed: mar me phrad pa med par yang //
translated: without making contact with it,

original: gal te mun pa sel byed na //
analyzed: gal te mun pa sel byed na //
translated: then darkness would be removed

original: 'jig rten kun na gnas pa'i mun //
analyzed: 'jig rten kun na gnas pa'i mun //
translated: in all the world by a lamp that is burning.
